loans.name: Musa E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Kakajama Technical Vocational Institute, based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 5,000,000 to meet their various personal financial needs. Some of them will invest their loans in businesses, some will use their loan to pay school fees for their children, others will buy house building materials and some will buy pieces of furniture such as a bed or chairs. 

Musa is a school teacher and leader of this group. Fifty-five-year-old Musa was born in Kenema; he is married with 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in nursery school. Musa has been in the teaching profession for 15 years now. He has requested this loan to invest in his wife’s business. His wife has been selling clothes for 3 years.

loans.use: to invest in his wife’s clothes selling business

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 37-year-old mother with four children; she is married to Samer who sells fruit and vegetables.

Sabha has always wanted to have her own business and her own source of income, so she opened a small grocery store almost two years ago, that has been running very successfully in the neighborhood.

Now Sabha is applying for a loan to buy more food products as a preparation for the Holy Month of Ramadan.

loans.use: To add new kinds of food products to her grocery store.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 36 years old. He comes from the village of Sareki in the Sachkhere District of West Georgia. Giorgi lives with his wife, Lia, two daughters (7 and 8 years old) and his parents, who are retired. Both children go to school. 

Giorgi works as stage director in the Sachkhere Theater. He likes his job and is happy with it. Her wife works as a leader of an orchestra in the same theater. However, the salaries they earn aren’t enough for the family; therefore, Giorgi also works as an operator in a local petrol station. The total average income of the family, including Giorgi’s parents’ pensions, is 900 GEL. 

Giorgi has requested credit in order to start up a bee keeping business. He has experience in this business, as the family used to run one years ago. Giorgi will purchase 10 beehives and get approximately 100 liters of honey per year, which will be sold locally to the villagers. Giorgi’s parents will be actively involved in the business. Giorgi is sure that his business will be successful and he will be able to expand it soon.

loans.use: to purchase 10 beehives and bee colonies

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana tiene 41 años es una mujer amable y sincera. Ella cuenta que hace 18 años conformó su familia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Miguel y Doris. A los cuales cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto. Está luchadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, principal actividad económica del lugar. Hace 18 años que comenzó a sembrar arveja y papa en todas sus variedades, los cuales cuida con mucho ahínco. Además de dedicarse a la  ganadería con el cuidado de sus 4 vacas a la que cuida con principal atención. “Tengo una vaca preñada, muy pronto dará un becerro, por lo que tendré uno más”, afirma. Con la adquisición de sus ovejas y la leche de sus vacas, puede tener un ingreso extra al hogar. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una mina de Talco, donde gana una buena suma de dinero. Pero hace poco, sufrió una enfermedad producto de los químicos al que se expone. Por ello, Sebastiana, desea abrir una pequeña bodega de productos de primera necesidad, donde puede tener más ingresos y así mantener a su esposo junto a su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de emprender sus objetivos. Además se compromete en ser una socia activa y responsable. Sebastiana de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja que oscila entre S/. 500 nuevos soles cada una.
texts.en: Sebastiana is a 41-year-old friendly and sincere woman. She married her husband 18 years ago and together they have two children: Miguel and Doris. She cares for her children in her own home located in the hamlet of Yanama Alto, Peru. This hard-working woman makes a living in agriculture, the main economic activity in her area. She started planting all varieties of peas and potatoes 18 years ago and has cared for them diligently. She also dedicates herself to livestock, caring for four cows and giving them personal attention. "I have a pregnant cow who very shortly will have a calf, so I'll have one more," she attests. With the acquisition of some sheep along with the milk from her cows, she can bring extra income to her household. She also has the support of her husband, who works at a mine in Talco and earns a good amount of money. But a little while ago he became sick after being exposed to some chemicals. Because of that, Sebastiana wishes to open a small general store of primary-need products so she can earn more income and provide for her husband and her family. She belongs to the "Manantiales de Yanama" community bank, and this is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, whom she thanks for the opportunity to undertake her objectives. She promises to be an active and responsible member of her community bank. With your support, Sebastiana will use the loan to invest in the purchase of two bags of pea seeds worth 500 soles apiece.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Chanelle Jelicka

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 29, mariée et  mère d’un enfant de 3 ans, ne trouvant pas de travail en fonction de son niveau universitaire, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de :
Chemise, sandales hommes et femmes sachets d’emballages, packs d’eau minérale, jus de fruits, biscuits 
Bien accueillir ses clients,  vendre à bon prix et épargner à partir de ses bénéfices est la stratégie qu’elle met en exergue pour assurer la croissance de son activité.
Vue la haute fréquence des clients, le crédit lui permettra de renforcer l’activité en achetant : 3 douzaines de chemises hommes, des sandales de tout genre, 10 packs d’eau pure, 30 douzaine de sachets d’emballages, 10 packs de jus de fruits pour enfants, 10 cartons de paquets de biscuits de différents gouts. 
Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
Très dévouée, elle fait face à ses obligations familiales
texts.en:
Chanelle Jelicka is 29 years old, married and the mother of a 3-year-old child. Since she could not find a job corresponding to her university level of education, she launched her own business selling skirts, sandals for men and women, packaging bags, mineral water, fruit juice and cookies. A warm welcome to her customers, low prices and investing her profits: that's the reason why her strategy enables her to grow her business.

Since her store is much frequented, this loan will enable her to strengthen her activity and buy 3 dozens of men's shirts, sandals of all kinds, 10 lots of mineral water, 30 dozens of packaging bags, 10 lots of fruit juice cartons for children, 10 lots of various cookies.

Her ambition is to become a wholesaler. Chanelle is a very devoted lady and honors her family commitments.

loans.use: to buy mineral water, sandals, fruit juice and skirts.

loans.name: Raul Eligio

texts.es:
El Señor Raul tiene 37 años de edad, se encuentra acompañado con la Señora Carolina de 29 años de edad, ellos tiene dos hijos. Don Raul se dedica a la mecánica hace más de 13 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.998; comenzó siendo secretario de otra persona, con quien se hizo de conocimientos en la profesión, en la actualidad tiene todo su equipamiento y su local estratégicamente ubicado para que los clientes lleguen fácilmente.
Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre acuden a él, ya que les proporciona una buena atención y simpatía. Uno de sus proyectos es seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta forma seguir creciendo y atraer a más clientes. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su esposa y sus hijos, ya que ellos son las personas más importantes para él.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, masillas, base y demás, para la utilización en el taller mecánico. Está con mucha esperanza en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Raul is 37 years old and accompanied by Sra. Carolina, age 29. They have two children. Don Raul has been a mechanic for more than 13 years, since 1998. He started out as an assistant for another person and gained knowledge about this profession. Raul currently has all of his equipment and a strategic location that his customers can find easily.

He says that he has a large number of customers who always come to him since he provides good service and sympathy. One of his projects is to continue expanding his business so that he can achieve more growth and attract more customers. All of his efforts are geared to providing for his wife and children, the people who are most important to him.

Raul is requesting a loan to buy paints, putty, base coat, and other products that he uses in his auto repair shop. He is extremely hopeful that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy paints, putty, base coat, and other products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 58 years old, has practiced small scale commercial farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 31 years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  

She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene la edad de 20 años, es soltera y no tiene niños ella vive con sus papas y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, el impulso de ayudar a sus padres hizo que ella pusiera su tienda da abarrotes para poder ayudarles con los gastos de la casa ya que ella esta al pendiente de ellos y tiene que mantenerlos ya que son personas grandes. Isabel tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 4 años, ella vende frutas, legumbres, jabón, aceite, leche, papel higiénico, dulces, huevo, refrescos etc. comenta que esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su tienda por que la quiere tener muy bien surtida. A diario ella abre su tienda a las 7 de la mañana y sierra para comer y abecés sierra a las 9 de la noche, platica que sus papas abecés le ayuda a cuidar la tienda. Ella esta muy contenta por el crédito que le otorgaran por que así podrá hacer crecer mas rápido su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 20 years old. She is single, without children. She lives with her parents and has a grocery store. 

She started her grocery business because of an urge to help her parents with the household expenses. She always has her eye on them and takes care of them because they are older.

She has had her business about 4 years. She sells fruit, vegetables, soap, oil, milk, toilet paper, sweets, eggs, soft drinks and other items. She tells us that she is asking for a loan in order to continue investing in the business by keeping it well stocked. 

She opens the stores every day at 7:00 AM, shutting it to eat, and she sometimes closes the store as late in the evening as 9:00 PM. Sometimes her parents chat with her and help her take care of the store. 

She is very happy about the loan, which will help her business to grow more rapidly.

loans.use: to buy purchases for her store

loans.name: Digna Isidra

texts.es:
Doña Digna tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, reside en la comunidad de Palo Verde en el municipio de Danli y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y en pequeña escala al cultivo de cafe.

Ella inició con la venta de productos de la canasta basica desde hace 10 años atras en una pequeña parte de su casa de habitacion y luego con el tiempo fue ahorrando y actualmente se dedica al cultivo de cafe. Su hijo mayor le ayuda con el manejo y cuidado de su pequeña finca mientras ella atiende su pulperia. 

El prestamo que Doña Digna está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de productos como carnes, embutidos, verduras, pastas, refrecos, jugos, maseca, manteca, aceite, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este prestamo podra surtir su pulperia de mas y variados productos para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor diversidad y tambien una parte del prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes.

Su sueño es hacerle mejoras a su casa especialmente donde tiene instalada su pulperia y tambien llegar a ser una productora de cafe en gran escala, para asi poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo en los prestamos anteriores.
texts.en:
Digna is 46 years old and the single mother of four children.  She lives in the community of Palo Verde in the municipality of Danli and she sells groceries and grows coffee on a small scale.

She started by selling products from the basic shopping basket ten years ago in a little part of her house.  Later she saved money and currently she grows coffee.  Her oldest son helps her with the management and care of her little farm while she tends the grocery store.

Digna needs the loan she is requesting to buy products like meats, sausages, vegetables, pasta, soft drinks, juice, cornmeal, lard, and oil, among others.  With the help of this loan she will be able to supply her store with more and varied products to offer her customers greater diversity.  Also, part of the loan will be to buy fertilizers.

Her dream is to make improvements on her house, especially where she has her store.  She also wants to become a coffee grower on a large scale, so she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

This is her third loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her payments punctually as she did with the earlier loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general.

loans.name: Mabondeli Plus Group

texts.en:
Peter is the leader of the Community Bank “Mabondeli Plus,” which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Peter runs a telephone booth that sells prepaid cards, and he is a money changer in his area located east of Kinshasa. He began his business in 1993. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Peter is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received six MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $20 of profit each day. Peter intends with the next loan to diversify his business by adding a game business for children and generate additional profits. His dream is to have a transport company in his area. He is 28 years old and single.

loans.use: to diversify his business by adding a game business for children to generate additional profits.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 48 years old and is a married woman with three children between 14 and 22 years old. She has a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Remedios sells items like canned goods, soap and noodles. She works hard to improve her business and support her family. Remedios has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, canned goods and noodles. Remedios hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy more rice, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Ariuntuya runs a grocery store and wants to support and join to her friend's carpenter business. Her friend Nyamsuren works as a carpenter and has been doing his business for 3 years. Every fall, Nyamsuren preserve his business working material-wood from the suppliers. Because during winter time his carpentry raw material-wood becomes very rare and expensive in the market. Also he can not always make preservation of the raw material in due to have much orders. Thereforen Ariuntuya will be responded for the raw material supplying of their joint business in the further. This year she has a plan to reserve the wood with preservation of the next years. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the wood by a large amount for preservation of working capital.

loans.use: To purchase the wood by a large amount for preservation of working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils such as pots, cutlery, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida's primary source of income comes from her business of providing rice milling services in her village. She also sells coconut, flour, and glutinous rice ideal for making suman (glutinous rice desserts). Profits earned from her business are used for daily allowances and meals for the family. 

Through her patience and perseverance, Zenaida sent her five children to college. They are now married and help her financially although she does not like to rely on their assistance.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more coconut and glutinous rice to sell. In the future, Zenaida would like to have good financial management to uplift her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase coconut and glutinous rice to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 49 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. For the past eight years, Moses has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which provides medicine and treatment to local patients. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale and will help Moses to generate greater profits to pay school fees and medical expenses for his family. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to open a bigger drug shop in town.

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou habite un village situé à 15 km de la ville principale. Il est marié et père de famille. Il est chauffeur : métier qu’il exerce depuis plus de deux ans.IL faut noter qu’il est très assidu dans son travail car sa journée démarre à 08h du matin et se termine à 23h.
Avec le crédit il veut acheter un moteur pour son véhicule Renauld. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa petite famille.
Avec les bénéfices  il pense augmenter son parc automobile.
texts.en: Amadou lives in a village located 15 kilometers away from the main city.  He is married and has a family.  He has been working as a driver for over two years.  Amadou is a very hard worker:  his working day starts at 8AM and ends at 11PM.  With his loan he would like to buy an engine for his Renault vehicle.  He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses.  With the profits, he is thinking of purchasing additional vehicles.

loans.use: To buy a Renault engine.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 24 years old. She was married at an early age and has a son and a daughter. Both of them are young and haven’t started their education yet.
Her husband is a laborer and earns a low income.
In order to financially support her husband, Bushra sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits.

She has good experience and all the required skills in her business and is confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to attract more clients and be able to produce quality work.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Nataly Lizeth

texts.es: La señora Nataly  vive en casa de sus padres y cuenta con negocio fijo, pero esta caseta es en alquiler, vende  gorras viceras, para este fin de año esta comprando gorras ya que hay bastante demanda de este producto, por tal motivo solicito el crédito, cuenta con su propia mercadería y capital, con el tiempo desea comprarse el puesto don de vende, vive en una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una persona joven con ganas de superación, trabaja mucho ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite solventar a su familia, que a pesar de su corta edad se hace cargo de algunos gastos de la casa, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Nataly lives in her parent's house, and has a regular business in a rented stall where she sells hats with visors.  For the end of this year she is buying caps, because there is a lot of demand for this product.  This is the reason that she is requesting a loan.  She has her own merchandise and capital, and in time she wants to buy the stall where she sells her products.  She lives in an urban neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba.  She is a young person who has a strong desire to succeed.  She works a lot and this is the only activity that allows her to pay bills for her family, because in spite of her young age, she is responsible for some of the household expenses.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy caps in bulk

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps rabbits and poultry. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 65,000 loan to buy more rabbits. His business goal is to own many rabbits within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio is from Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, a state located approximately in the middle of Mexico. Ignacio has a small glass business that he began 10 years ago when he lost his job. He is a married man with a very unit family.

Ignacio started his business because of his economic situation and his motivation to own a business. At the beginning, he started in an empty space of his home but, like all very hard working entrepreneurs, his business grew little by little and he then had to rent a space that was bigger than his initial place to move his business to. This new place is located in the center of the city and he believes that micro-loan could be very helpful to help his business to succeed and grow. For this reason, he needs a loan of US$ 450 American dollars to purchase raw materials to make his products.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Ignacio es originario de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro y cuenta con el negocio de Vidriería desde hace 10 años fecha en la que fue retirado de su empleo, es un hombre casado y tiene una familia muy unida, el empezó por la necesidad económica y tener su propio negocio, inicialmente acondicionó un espacio para su negocio en su misma casa y por su gran desempeño y constancia ha visto crecer sus inventarios y sus ventas, por lo que rento un local comercial en el centro de la ciudad, el considera que el micro crédito le será de mucha utilidad, y un factor importante para el crecimiento de su negocio. Por ello esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 450 dólares americanos para compra de materia prima para fabricar sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy organic manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S. is 51 years old and is seeking a loan so that he can repair his home before the rainy season.  S. works in construction and earns $7/day, while his wife (pictured here) earns $1/day as a tailor.  One of their children also works and contributes to the house's costs.  When the rainy season hits, S. is worried that his house will leak, and it will ruin many of their possessions. With this loan, he and his family will be able to fix their house so they are ready for the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair home in order to prevent leaking during the rainy season

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 63 years old and is married with five children. She specializes in the sales of cooked food  for the community. She is from Asaba Delta State of Nigeria. Joy is requesting a loan of $750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food she serves in her little restaurant

loans.name: Antiga

texts.en: Antiga (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children and lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Together with her husband, she has a small food store. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more food items so she can attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Life had not prepared Basilia for times of happiness until now. She lost her mother at the age of 6 and since then she had lived in the city with her father, but a few years later destiny showed her no mercy in snatching away the only person that was left to her in the world for companionship. This happening was very hard for her and cost her a great deal to overcome. When she reached 16 years of age she decided to leave her native Moho in search of a better horizon. At the moment she is in the city of Juliaca and works in the manufacture and sale of skirts - work which she came to start in a rented workshop. Her current wish is to possess as soon as possible her own manufacturing workshop, and to succeed in this she is conscious of the strength she has to show daily to save enough money and to undertake the long journey she has ahead of her. At the moment she wishes to increase her stock of raw materials with the aim of stepping up her production and increasing her income and personal wellbeing. Her request is for an amount of $200, money which will allow her to fulfill her objectives. "Let us make it possible for this young entrepreneur to continue moving forward and succeed in obtaining her dreams."

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

A Basilia la vida no le tenía preparado momentos gratos hasta ahora, perdió a su madre a la edad de 6 años y desde entonces quedó al cuidado de su padre, pero a los pocos años el destino nuevamente se ensañó con ella arrebatándole al único ser que le quedaba en el mundo para hacerle compañía; este hecho fue muy duro para ella y le costó mucho superarlo.Cuando cumplió 16 años decidió salir de su pueblo natal Moho en busca de un mejor horizonte, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca y se dedica a la confección y venta de faldas, trabajo que viene realizando en un taller alquilado.El deseo que tiene es poseer pronto su propio taller de confección y para lograrlo es consciente del esfuerzo que tiene que realizar diariamente para ahorrar lo suficiente y para emprender el largo trecho que tiene que recorrer por el momento desea aumentar la cantidad de materia prima con el fin de incrementar su producción en y acrecentar sus ingresos económicos para procurarse bienestar.La petición que hace es por el monto de 200 dólares, dinero que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos.“Hagamos posible que esta joven emprendedora siga adelante y logre cumplir sus sueños”

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for manufacturing skirts

loans.name: Mateo Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a very strong man, both physically and spiritually, every day he works very hard to get a good harvest and this is why he never has time to spare. He spends all his time preparing for grazing and in the instruments he uses to make his work more effective. He is originally from Tarma and he has decided to stay in the land where he was born in order to progress. Thanks to the impetus that he has in life, he has been able to provide for his family’s education and well being. With his hard work he supports his wife and children; they inspire him to keep working. Victor grows potatoes and broad beans and sells them in bulk; this is why he spends all his time taking care of his harvesting, so that eventually he can see the profits of his hard work. He has taught his diligent work to his three children since their early childhood. He wants this loan to increase his production by buying more seeds. Let’s show our solidarity with this incredible man and father so he can continue growing both produce and happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Víctor, es un hombre de mucha fuerza física y espiritual, día a día trabaja arduamente para obtener una muy buena cosecha y es por eso que no desperdicia ni un instante del valioso tiempo que posee para preparar el arado y los instrumentos que utilizará para un mejor desempeño de su labor. Él es natural de Tarma y decidió quedarse en la tierra que lo vio nacer para progresar; gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado sostenerse y brindarle a su familia educación y bienestar. Con su trabajo mantiene eficientemente a sus tres hijos y este hecho lo impulsa aún más a seguir labrando la tierra. Víctor siembra papa y habas para ofrecerlos a los comerciantes mayoristas y es por ello que aprovecha al máximo el tiempo en el cuidado de sus tierras para que en la cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos de su arduo trabajo.Este ejemplo de trabajo diligente ha sido inculcado en cada uno de sus hijos desde muy pequeños para que se conduzcan adecuadamente por la vida.Su propósito es solicitar un préstamo para incrementar su producción con la compra de más semillas para su cultivo. Solidaricémonos con este increíble padre para que continúe sembrando a fin de que pueda cosechar muchas alegrías.

loans.use: Compra de semillas para optimizar su producción.

loans.name: Silvia Arlinia

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and spirit, Mrs. Silvia Arlinia is a woman who has been able to move ahead thanks to the sale of food.

Because of her economic status and her desire to provide for her children, Mrs. Pérez decided to initiate the sale of food in order to move ahead in life. She wanted to give her family everything they needed. In order to achieve this dream she teamed up with Ceprodel to receive loans so that she could begin to sell food.

After receiving these loans Mrs. Pérez has been able to overcome her economic situation. She has bought various products to elaborate her food for sale. She is an excellent cook and has expanded her set of clients in the market of The Station.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Silvia Arlinia es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo y con gran espíritu de superación ha podido salir adelante gracias a la venta de comida la cual tienen a su cargo.

Debido a la situación económica que atraviesa la señora Pérez y por el apoyo que debería de dar a sus infantes, la señora Pérez decide iniciar una venta de comida preparada por ella para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia que mucho lo necesitaba. Para poder realizar este trabajo realizo prestamos en ceprodel el cual los uso como capital de trabajo para comenzar a vender los alimentos.

Después de dar lugar a estos préstamos la señora Pérez ha podido superar su situación económica de manera que ha realizado compras de los productos para elaborar los alimentos para la venta y sin olvidar que por ser excelente cocinera ha aumentado su cartera de clientes en el mercado de La Estación.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is a young mother of a three-year-old daughter and an unborn son. She lives Casabe, a community of Santo Domingo, where she operates a small hardware store along with her husband.  Tita has been managing this business for more than three years. She has therefore gained a lot of experience, and she knows the rules of the market place. The entrepreneur buys the materials wholesale from some importers, which she then resells in her store. Currently, many customers visit Tita's shop every day and purchase a wide range of goods. Tita wants her business to keep growing in order to offer better services to the customers and increase her income. With her loan, she will buy an assortment of products to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase a wide range of products to stock up a hardware store.

loans.name: Muradkhan

texts.en:
Muradkhan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He owns an appliance repair shop. Most of his business comes from buying used refrigerators and reselling them.

Muradkhan has been in this business for five years. During this time, he has learned that used refrigerators are cheaper in the winter time. He is asking for this loan so that he can purchase some old, cheap refrigerators now and resell them in the summer for a large profit.

His uncle, who is fixing a washing machine in the photo, is a partner in business. Muradkhan is single.

loans.use: To buy refrigerators to repair and resell.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afiwa K. Epse Danklou was born on October 14, 1947 in Tchékpo in the Yoto Prefecture, Togo. She is married and the mother of five children. Her primary business is selling everyday necessities and drinks in her little shop that she has named "Chez Maman". Ever since she opened the shop in the year 2000, she has been able to help her husband who is presently retired to have enough income to cover their children's school fees.

This first loan that she is presently requesting is in the amount of US$ 1200 and will allow her to purchase 10 cases of frozen foods, thirty cases of canned drinks, and twelve cases of mineral water in 1.5 liter bottles.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Epse DANKLOU Afiwa est née le 14 octobre 1947 à Tchékpo dans la préfecture de Yoto au Togo. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de premières nécessités et de boissons dans sa boutique qu’elle a dénommée « CHEZ MAMAN ». Depuis la création de sa boutique en 2000, elle a toujours aidé son mari qui est un retraité dans les dépenses scolaires de leurs enfants.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter dix cartons de produits congelés, trente cartons de boissons en canettes et douze cartons d’eau minérale de 1,5litre de contenance par bouteille.

loans.use:
Expand her inventory of cans of drinks, etc.

Augmenter son stock de boisson en canette

loans.name: Rehema's Faraja A Group

texts.en:
Rehema, age 45, is married with 2 children (ages 19 and 14). She raises chickens for a living and has been doing this since 1998. She works daily from 5:00 AM to 8:00 PM at this job and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Rehema has taken 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to make cement blocks for construction on her chicken farm and for a tailoring business. Now she hopes for a new loan to continue having the blocks made.

In the picture, Rehema is on the right, wearing red.

loans.use: To continue making cement blocks for her chicken farm

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Fatuma A.. She is married and has three children aged from 7 to 14. In 2006, Fatuma established an auto parts business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and has applied for a new loan to buy additional stocks of spare parts in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Deme (Appui Mutuel) Group

texts.fr:
The Deme Group is made up of four women from Lafiala neighborhood of the town of Koutiala, who have known each other for years. They are 33 years old, on average, are married, and have at least 3 children.

In the interest of growing their businesses, these women became members of the micro-credit program SORO YIRIWASO two years ago. The amount of their loans has risen from US$ 120 for the first loan to the present sum of $240. They have varied businesses (sales of firewood, local cold drinks, take-out food sales, etc.) This loan will be used to purchase a truckload of firewood, sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of “fonio” (a West-African grain), and a considerable amount of ingredients for take-out food.

As they are very experienced in their fields, the products created by the women from the Deme Group are esteemed in the town of Kotiala. With the present loan, they expect to be able to generate a profit of US$ 180 on average. This profit will be used to make payments on the loan and to cover daily living expenses for their families.

In future, the Deme Group intends to have an individual loan of US$ 600 apiece so as to further expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Le Groupe Deme est un regroupement de quatre femmes du quartier Lafiala de la ville de Koutiala qui se sont connues depuis des années. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.

Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le prêt actuel. Elles mènent differentes activités (la vente de bois de chauffe, les boissons locales et glaces, la restauration etc..). Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter la contenance d‘un camion de bois de chauffe, des sacs de sucre, 2 sacs de fonio et une quantité importante d’ingrédients pour la restauration.

Très expérimentées dans leur domaine respectif, les produits des femmes du groupe Deme sont très prisés dans la ville de Koutiala. Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 80 000 FCFA. de bénéfice. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérets du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.

Dans l’avenir, le Groupe Deme compte obtenir chacun un prêt de 250 000 FCFA pour élargir leur activité.

loans.use:
Purchasing various items for their small businesses

Pour achéter différents articles pour le petit commerce.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina is 60 years old, was not able to go to school, speaks the Aymará language and understands Spanish. She is married and has five children, four of whom live on their own and one who still resides with her. She lives in the Ilave district in the El Collao province. Martina dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of sheep, pigs and cows which she buys and then sells at the market in Pilcuyo on Thursdays and at the Ilave market on Sundays. Her husband makes the purchases in the morning, and she sells them within a few hours. She belongs to the communal bank “22nd of September”, where she took an initial loan of 300 soles with which she purchased four sheep and two pigs. With this loan of 3,000 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will buy two bulls to raise and then sell. She tells us that being a member of the communal bank has taught her to run a business, has increased her income and she is very thankful for having been extended credit and is punctual about her payments. Her dream is to buy a car and to have a better quality of life with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina tiene 60 años, no pudo estudiar, habla el idioma aymará y entiende castellano, es casada y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son independientes y uno de sus hijos esta a su lado, ella vive en la Parcialidad de M. del Centro Poblado de Camicachi, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao. Martina se dedica a compra y ventas de ovejas, chanchos y vacas que los adquiere y vende en las ferias de los jueves en Pilcuyo y en Ilave los domingos. Su esposo los compra, por la mañana y ella los vende después de un par de horas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar cuatro ovejas y dos chanchos; Con este crédito de s/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en cuatro meses, comprarà dos toros para engorde que posteriormente serán vendidos. Nos cuenta siendo socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a trabajar, incremento su ingreso económico y esta muy agradecida por el crédito que se le dio y es muy puntual en sus pagos. El sueño que ella tiene es comprar un carro, para que pueda recoger la chacra y vivir mejor con su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (bulls).

loans.name: Mati

texts.en:
Mati is 49 years old, divorced, with 4 children aged 30, 21, 15 and 11 years old. She has sold charcoal and fish since 2003. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
 
Mati now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fish for her business.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina C. has already paid back her first loan from Kiva. She was the first member of her loan group to repay and she paid back well before the term. Mrs. C. purchased green vegetables with her first loan. She sells her vegetables in the town of Bholdhoka. Her husband, Mr. Puspa C., has no work, so her family's living conditions are still very miserable. She has not been able to send her children to boarding school. They all depend solely on the small vegetable shop.

Mrs. C. is a very hard-working woman. She wants to expand her business to earn more from her shop. So she is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 fb. She is very grateful to all the lenders who supported her by giving her the first loan.

loans.use: To expand her shop further

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda S. is 23 years old and is a farmer, growing rice. She can earn around US$2 per day. Chenda is married to Mr. Kuy Phanny, 25, who is also a farmer, and they have two small children who stay at home. For another source of income, she needs a loan of US$300 to purchase a machine to make sugarcane juice to sell at the primary school in her village. She lives in Taream Village, Chrey Vean Commune, Kampong Cham Province.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to make sugarcane juice to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị  Hải năm nay  44 tuổi, hiện cụi đang sống cùng chồng và  5 con tại xã Minh Phú huyện Sóc Sơn – Hà Nội. Năm 2000 chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.  Qua  8 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương  nhờ chăn nuôi hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Hiện nay công việc chăn nuôi lợn, gà, ngan  đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Với nguồn thu nhập này ngoài việc hoàn trả vốn gia đình chị còn có thêm điều kiện để chi tiêu  và mua săm thêm các trang thiết bị cải thiện cuộc sống của gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải is 44 years old. She is living with her husband and five children in the village of Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn District, Hà Nội (a.k.a. Hanoi). In 2000, she joined the fund and borrowed to invest in the business of rearing livestock. Because of their participation in TYM Fund for the past eight years and the good outcome of their livestock rearing business, her family's financial situation is better and continues to improve. Today, the business of raising pigs, chicken, and ducks provides the family with an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. With this income source, in addition to full repayment of their loans, the loan terms require the family to purchase household items to improve their living conditions. This loan cycle she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to expand her livetsock rearing facilities/business. *cannot find translation

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P., 62-year-old mother of two from Calumpang, General Santos City, is a dressmaker. Her husband helps her with sewing to finish orders quickly. “I dream of giving my children the best education that I didn’t have", she said. “By sending all of them to school, I am confident that my children will have a good future after school”, she added.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for making dresses. She believes that she needs to invest more in fabric to attract more customers and to augment her income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making dresses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bware in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is married to a local schoolteacher and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. 

Rose has run a grocery stall in Bware since 2002. She grows the vegetables herself on her small farm and also sells fresh milk to the local community and at Achutti Market. With the profits from her business, Rose pays the school fees for her children and is able to meet her household expenses.

Rose would like to expand her business and begin selling cereals and maize. She has applied for a loan of $150 which she will use to purchase the stock of cereal and maize.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and maize

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
DANILZA G. D. LÓPEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma N° 383 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 57 años D. edad, un hijo, es madre soltera, con 03 años D. socia en Manuela Ramos. 

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos D. pasamanería, vendía jugos, sandwichs, kekes, en su casa, el negocio seguía progresando.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una vitrina chica para poder mostrar sus artículos, golosinas, artículos D. pasamanería en general.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar y cree en ella, ya que es una mamá soltera que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Danilza G. D. Lopez belongs to the “Women United” cooperative bank located on Richardo Palma Street in the Callería district. She is 57 years old, the single mother of one son, and has belonged to Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300.00 Peruvian soles, with which she bought stationery and school supplies, sold juices, sandwiches, and smalle cakes in her home. The business continued to progress. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, she bought a small display case to show her merchandise which includes snacks and general stationery and school supplies. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence and believing in her, as she is a single mother who they’ve helped get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small display case in which to show her merchandise, generally stationery, school supplies, and snacks.

loans.name: Zamda

texts.en:
Zamda has been a bread and fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to the Wapendanao group loan (Group code 2008). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more sugar, flour, oil and fish for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zamda is 37 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 20, 15 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more fish, sugar, flour and oil for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan S. is 52 years old and she is a widow with 5 children. She sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a the loan for $675 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta es muy trabajadora y dulce, es madre soltera, pero eso no la limitó en proveer de lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos, a quienes no solo brindo un lugar para vivir sino que los educó haciendo de ellos jóvenes con preparación y valores. El duro papel de ser madre y padre para sus hijos la llenó de vitalidad, porque sin esa necesidad no hubiera logrado tener un puesto dónde vender sus platos de comida, ni los desayunos en los  mercados, pues desde que se separó inicio su trabajo, vendiendo en las calles y preparando algunos bocaditos, pero con el tiempo tuvo el proyecto de vender comida en los mercados y gracias a las sociedad que realizó con su hermana, con quien unió esfuerzos, abrieron un puesto de comida en el mercado de su localidad. Este trabajo la mantiene muy ocupada, pero contenta,  ya que sus anhelos y deseos lograron realizarse, basta seguir esforzándose para hacer de su negocio el mejor. Enriqueta tiene planeado independizarse y conseguir un local propio para  obtener mayores ingresos con el fin de terminar de educar a sus hijos. Su tiempo de permanencia en MFP es de 5 años, esta temporada la han ido ayudando a mejorar sus relaciones sociales y a contribuir en el desarrollo de las personas, pues como presidenta de su banco comunal ha estado impulsando y alentando a las socias a crecer en su economía. El  crédito de 1000 soles que solicita le será muy útil para la compra de vitrinas y otros muebles que requiere su puesto.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is very hardworking and sweet. She is a single mother, but that hasn't stopped her from providing for her four children, whom she not only provided a place to live, but also educated from their youth with morals. This tough role of being mother and father to her children filled her with vitality because without that she would not have succeeded in her work, selling meals and breakfasts at the markets. When she began her work she sold sandwiches in the streets, but over time has come to selling food at the markets, thanks to working with her sister, with whom she joined forces and opened a booth at the local market. This work keeps her very busy, but happy, now that her dreams have been realized so that she can make her business better. Enriqueta plans to become independent and have her own business location so that she can increase her revenue and finish paying for her children's school. She has been with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma for five years, and as president of her communal bank has been inspiring and encouraging her fellow bank members to expand in the economy. This loan of 1000 soles will be very useful for buying display cases and other furniture needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her business

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo T. est un boucher à Lomé. Agé de 35 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Kodzo exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Pour répondre aux besoins pressants de la population, il espère avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV acheter des bœufs, des moutons et des boucs pour l’abattage. Il souhaite aussi entreprendre l’élevage des chèvres et porc pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo T. is a butcher in Lomé. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He's been in this business for three years. To respond to the pressing needs of the population, he hopes to use this initial FECECAV loan to buy steers, sheep, and rams for slaughter. He would also like to take on the raising of nanny goats and pigs to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy steers, sheep,and nanny-goats for slaughter

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nhâm Nguyễn Thị (349981438) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has three adult children. Nhâm sells beef products in the local community and has been engaged in this business for over four years earning approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, Nhâm joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Nhâm is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie L. Sr. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Ocidental. He is 30 years old, married, and has three infants. Ronnie manufactures and sells homemade ice cream to local businesses and to community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Ronnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients to make homemade ice cream to sell. This loan will be his third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business and to pay for his family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making homemade ice cream

loans.name: Rehana Ibrar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Razia kosar baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy decorative embroidery materials for preparing decorative-embroidered dresses.

Safia baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her plastic-bag-making business.

Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Rehana baji, wife of I. H., has lived in Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fourteen years. Her husband runs a paint-selling business and has been doing this work for the past six years. Rehana baji helps him by preparing embroidered dresses. She saves her money in a committee and plans to invest in her husband’s business so that he is able to expand his business. She is applying for a loan to buy paint boxes to complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee R. is from the village of Purok 8C, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 27 years old. Haidee is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Haidee works in someone else's business venture, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Haidee has been engaged in the business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Haidee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Haidee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 8C, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mutalib

texts.en:
A. Mutalib has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 10 years. This business requires a lot of dedication for the fact that it demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true due to the fact that it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, while at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business Mutalib is able to maintain his spouse and his 4 children. It is because of this he is soliciting a loan through IMON International. The credit will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. Mutalib has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Maria es  casada tiene 50 años  tres hijos de 28, 27,26 años que trabajan.   
Maria  estudio  para hacer manualidades en tela, en madera y  pinturas, tenia un taller y personal a su cargo, pero lo dejo por que se dedico  venta de productos por catalogó, le puso tanto empeño que ella tiene a su cargo 60 vendedoras y la han nombrado ejecutiva de ventas.
Desde que Maria esta en Finca esta en Finca, a prendió a organizarse  en su trabajó y a llegar a sus metas en el negocio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de productos de bellezas por catalogo.
El sueño de Maria  es retomar su taller de manualidades y hacerlo mas grande.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd) Community Bank. She is married, 50 years old, and has three children aged 28, 27, and 26, all of whom are working. Maria has studied how to make handicrafts out of textiles and wood, and also how to paint. She used to have a workshop and assistants, but now she sells products from a catalogue. She put in so much effort that she now has 60 women selling the items and has been named director of sales. Since Maria joined Kiva partner Finca, she has learned how to better run her business and how to reach her goals. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beauty products to sell via catalogue. Her dream is to start up her workshop once again and expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Teddy Nanfuka’S Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, aged 4 and 8, who currently attend school. She rents a two-roomed house in a semi-urban area where she lives with three people. There is electricity but no piped water at the house, and her family eat three meals a day. Teddy also takes care of additional family members.

Twice a week, Teddy buys used clothing from Owino market. She then sells these clothes in Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. She sells a variety of children's and women's clothing, and has about 30 customers a day, seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses are business and domestic rent plus medication. Teddy has been in this business for the last ten years, and has been with Kiva partner MCDT SACCO for three years. She is now servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mate. She wants to use this loan to stock more clothes in preparation for the festive season. Teddy aspires to grow her business and own permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Messanh Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme fait parti des premières personnes qui très tôt se sont lancées dans l’activité de taxi-moto dans la ville de Lomé, au lendemain de la grève générale qu’a connu le pays. Il a donc débuté cette activité génératrice de revenus en 2000. Actuellement bien qu’il soit toujours conducteur de cet engin à deux roues, il dispose à son actif de 02 autres motos, qu’il a confiées à 02 conducteurs sous contrat. C’est pour acheter une troisième moto qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES dans le but d’agrandir ses capacités d’exploitation. Ce jeune homme n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Il a une très bonne capacité de gestion et compte sur sa rigueur et son pragmatisme pour rembourser le prêt dans les délais exigés.
texts.en:
This young man was one of the first people who, very soon after the general strike that the country of Togo experienced, set out in the moto-taxi business in the town of Lomé. He started this income-generating business in 2000. Now, still the driver of the two-wheeled vehicle, he also has 2 other motorbikes that he entrusts to 2 drivers under contract. He is asking for this money from WAGES so that he can buy a third motorbike, with the aim of expanding his operational capacity. This young man is unmarried and has no dependent children. He has great management capabilities and is relying upon his rigour and pragmatism to repay the loan within the given timeframe.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia O. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Artemia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Artemia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Artemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Artemia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offerings in her general store

loans.name: S. Jorge Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Jorge” esta representado por la señora Leidy Cecilia e  integrada por 12 miembros D. los cuales 9 son mujeres y 3 varones. En general los socios se dedican a la comercialización D. diferentes productos como ser  la venta D. comida rápida, empanadas, ropa, lubricantes y a la prestación D. servicios como empleadas, secretariado, educadoras y al servicio D. transporte público; la mayoría D. los socios trabaja en su domicilio o D. forma ambúlate en inmediaciones D. su barrio por lo que no tienen mucha competencia pero si desean agrandar sus negocios para poder dar a sus clientes una mayor comodidad y una mejor atención es por esta razón que se requiere el préstamo para poder utilizar los fondos en compras D. muebles para sus negocios, mercadería para su venta, insumos para su producción y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas eficiente. En cuanto a la experiencia muchas D. las socias no cuenta con experiencia en créditos solidarios pero están muy entusiasmadas por recibir la confianza D. una institución que las apoya y cree en que puedan salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The group "San Jorge" is represented by Mrs. Leidy Cecilia and is maD. up of 12 members, of which 9 are women and 3 are men. In general, the partners make a living marketing different products, such as fast food, empanadas, clothes, and lubricants, and some work in other services, as clerks, secretaries, educators, and public transportation employees. The majority of the partners work in their home or travel around their neighborhood, therefore they do not have a lot of competition. However, they desire to enlarge their businesses to be able to give their clients greater comfort and better attention, and therefore require the loan, to utilize the funds in the purchase of furniture for their businesses, merchandise for sale, materials for production, and tools to help them perform more efficient work. In regards to experience, many of the partners have no experience with credit, but they are very enthusiastic about receiving the confidence of an institution that supports them and believes they can get ahead with their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: A. Monique est née le 22 Septembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis dix huit ans que Monique vit dans le quartier Sodjéatinmè à Cotonou. Monique est mariée à KOUTON Zachari, un soudeur, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Monique n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis onze ans, et pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Monique vend des produits divers (boîtes de tomate, lait, sardine, petit pois, mayonnaise, pâte alimentaires, savons, bombons, biscuits, farine de maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Monique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits dans l'institution. Monique sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle
texts.en:
A. Monique was born on September 22, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 18 years, she has been living in the Sodjéatinmè district in Cotonou. She is married to KOUTON Zachari, a welder, and is the mother of three children who are all in school. The couple jointly covers family expenses. Monique has never attended school. For eleven years, to help her husband with the family expenses, she has sold a variety of goods (canned tomatoes, milk, sardines, peas, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, candy, cookies, cornmeal, etc.). She does so at her home. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She is a former ALIDé client who has already benefited from three ALIDé loans. She’s requesting another ALIDé loan for bolstering her business and for satisfying her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (packets of sugar, boxes of condensed milk, detergents)

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: La señora Meri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella  y son su impulso, para seguir adelante.Meri, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. Meri, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Meri, 48, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque" communal bank in the Sacanche district, Huallaga province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, two of whom still depend on her and are her motivating force to continue forward. Meri is an efficient woman who, finding herself in need to generate her own income, decided to set up grocery sales in her home. She began bit by bit and now finds herself greatly improved with a good selection of products available to her customers and housewives who find what they need. Currently she continues with the same business and she tells us that she does quite well. With this 1,000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, boxes of milk and preserved fish of various brands, home cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items, packages of soft-drinks in various flavors and brands in order to offer better customer service. Meri feels herself to be a fulfilled woman with what she has managed to accomplish. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and to reach her dreams and goals and other women who want to grow as busineswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase inventory.

loans.name: Robert Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Robert Edwin P. Pérez, tiene 20 años de edad vive en la Asociación de Vivienda Keiko Sofía Fujimori D-11.
Actualmente cuenta con un módulo de material noble y lo demás se encuentra por construir. Vive con su padre el Sr. Robert P. Matta de 41 años de edad quien esta separado de su esposa y con sus hermanos. Apoya con los gastos familiares.
Es soltero, trabaja como serenazgo ( vigilancia municipal) 8 horas diarias en horarios rotativos, en su horario de descanso trabaja en la mototaxi de su padre un promedio de 4 horas, él es una persona con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
En su trabajo es bien dedicado y ahí también su jefe inmediato da buenas referencias de su persona.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder sacar su brevete que le ayudará a trabajar mejor en el transporte además de no seguir trabajando como serenazgo este documento le ayudará para desempeñarse como chofer en cualquier unidad de transporte. Invertirá el dinero en arreglos de la mototaxi.
Tiene muchas ganas de superación, es emprendedor y sobretodo bien responsable.
texts.en:
Sr. Robert Edwin P. Pérez is 20 years old, single, and lives at the Keiko Sofía Fujimori Housing Association, D-11. His residential unit is well-built and made of solid materials. He lives with his father Sr. Robert P. Matta, who is 41 years old and separated from his wife. Robert Edwin has siblings, but they do not live with him. He helps contribute to the family expenses.

Robert Edwin works for the city as a security patrolman on an eight-hour rotating schedule. When he is not at this job, he drives his father’s motorcycle taxi for approximately a four-hour shift. His neighbors have provided him with excellent references. Robert Edwin is dedicated to his work and his supervisor has also provided a good recommendation.

He is requesting a loan so that he can pay to upgrade his driver’s license, which will enable him to operate any type of vehicle. As a result, he will be able to find better work in the transportation sector and quit his job as a patrolman. Part of the money will also be used for motorcycle taxi repairs. Robert Edwin has demonstrated that he is enterprising, responsible, and eager to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade his driver's license & pay for motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa has owned a barber shop since 2000. He also sells hair products like shampoos and gel, and perfumes. He is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Moussa knows how to treat his clients and does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his shop. Moussa decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and he learned it in an academy.

Moussa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to repaint his shop and purchase accessories. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To repaint his barber shop and purchase accessories

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Emapalado Ari de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, la Sra. Rogelia M.  participaba en  un grupo de mujeres como comision vecinal, las mismas se acercarón a la Fundación Paraguaya ya que se enterarón que otorgaba pequeños préstamos para mujeres, así con mucho entusiasmo decidierón participar del programa  son 20 (veinte) mujeres trabajadoras que quieren seguir progresando.
 El préstamo lo  invertirán en sus trabajos diarios que les sera de gran ayuda; ellas poseen  trabajos propios  como vendedoras de ropas,venta de zapatos, bijouteris, frutas y verduras, etc. y las mismas recibirán  un monto de 800.000, otras 500.000 y otras 300.000 gs. Para la compra de azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosinas, vaqueros, remeras, polleras, camisas, lenceria, queso, gallinas las mismas desean un progreso personal y de toda su  familia.
Cada una se dedica a una actividad diferente asi la señora es vendedora de verduras, ella tine 6 hijos y su marido no posee empleo fijo y se dedica a realizar trabajos por jornales de modo a que no poseen un ingreso fijo. 
La señora vende sus productos en las despensas del barrio y desea mantener su clientela y para ello debe ofrecer buenos productos.

Las demas integrantes se dedican a:
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the city of Caaguazú’s Emapalado Ari neighborhood. Rogelia M. participated in a women’s neighborhood association. They called upon Fundación Paraguaya when they learned that it gave small loans to women. With much enthusiasm they decided to participate in the program. They are 20, hard-working women that want to continue to make progress. They will use the funds in their different lines of work; it will be of great utility to them. Each has her own commercial activity, such as: the sale of clothing, shoes, jewelry, fruits and vegetables, etc. They will receive a total of 800.000; some 500.000 and others, 300.000 gs to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, pasta, sweets, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, lingerie, cheese, chickens. They all want to achieve both personal and family progress. Each member has her own type of work. Thus, Rogelia sells fruits. She has 6 children. Her husband is a day laborer without steady work so they don’t have a fixed income. She sells her products to neighborhood stores and she wants to keep her regular customers, therefore she must offer good products. The other members are involved thus: 1. Lorenza González de Franco, fruit and vegetable sales; 2. María Antonia E., Chipera (sells typical bread of the region); 3. Rogelia M., fruit and vegetable sales; 4. Claudia E. Galeano, clothing sales; 5. Lucinda M. de Farias, clothing sales; 6. Saturnina Nuñez de Galeano, fruit and vegetable sales; 7. Antonia C. de Barreto, clothing sales; 8. Máxima C., grocery store; 9. Justina Colmán, fruit and vegetable sales; 10. Maura Andresa Martínez, clothing sales; 11. Marizza Concepción R., fruit and vegetable sales; 12. Sonia Elizabeth O., clothing sales; 13. Cristina O. Beitez, sweets sales; 14. Circuncición F. de González, clothing sales; 15. Eugenia A. de Ayala, underwear sales; 16. Julia M., beauty shop; 17. Liduvina L., store; 18. Ignacia E., store; 19. Maria Marlene R., fruit and vegetable sales; 20. Elisa T., vegetable sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, lingerie, shirts, goods, flour, pasta, sweets, meat, fruit, vegetables, fabric, milk, chicken, shoes, plastic cutlery, costume jewelry, etc.
