loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora Luisa G. se dedica a la venta de perecederos tales como naranja agria, naranja dulce y limones las que son ofrecidas por ella misma en el M.. Ella inició este negocio desde hace 25 años y hoy en día ha logrado mejorarlo gracias a sus esfuerzos.

El crédito que ella está solicitando es para la compra de naranjas agrias, naranjas dulces y limones para continuar comercializándolas y de esta manera suplir las necesidades del negocio y por ende las de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa sells perishable goods such as seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons, which she herself sells in the market. She started this business 25 years ago, and to this day has been able to improve it thanks to her efforts.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons so that she can continue marketing them and, in this way, meet the needs of her business and hence also of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 28 years old, married to Jane Wanjiru, and they have two school-going children.  He has been operating a retail shop in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He also had a posho mill (grinds maize into maize flour) that got spoiled a while back and used to act as his secondary income business.
 
He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to buy a new mortar for his posho mill with proceeds from this loan so as to revive its services as a secondary business.

He also has a transport business on the side, operating his car as a taxi. In the future he wants to see this business grow and buy a mini bus for the same business.

loans.use: Buy a mortar for his posho mill

loans.name: Ope

texts.en:
Ope is 39 years old and married to a teacher. They have three children and their children are excelling in school.

Ope provides printing services to his customers in Ibadan. He is a hardworking man and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty.

Ope hopes to expand his business and is requesting the loan of N160,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Flordeliza's Group

texts.en:
Flordeliza G. is from the village of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Flordeliza is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Flordeliza is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov B., who lives in Roluos village in Takeo Province, was born in 1955. She is a duck breeder who earns money selling eggs. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Nam, is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support the family. With the rice field, they have a problem because it's time to do the farming. Thus, in order to improve production of rice, Mrs. Nov B. decided to ask for a loan to plow the rice field. 

Nov B. is the mother of two children who help their parents do the farming and duck breeding. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To plow the rice field

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a 32 year old single woman. She is supporting her cousin's son, 13, and two daughters, 8 and 5 years old, who all attend school. She has a small retail shop, where she sells sugar, bread, milk, eggs, potatoes, as well as homemade fried pastries such as mkati wanazi, mitai and mahamri. She has had her shop for ten years. Her customers are neighbors, children, and tourists, who often pass her shop on their way to the major tourist attraction in her city on the coast of Kenya. 

This is her first loan with Yehu and with the 20,000 KSH, she hopes to purchase sugar, flour, detergent and soap for her shop. If she manages a profit from her business, she will spend it on rent, the kids and their schooling. She hopes to someday earn something for herself and to start another business to support her when she grows old. Hajara describes herself as a simple and hardworking woman, who is trying her best to have a good life.

loans.use: Sugar, flour, detergent, soap and other items for retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groundnut seeds

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 46 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 5 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 40 años, empezó con el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su casa. Y está ubicada en su vivienda para ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos, compro víveres para el hogar, granos básicos, golosinas entre otros así puede ofrecer lo que sus clientes le solicitan y mantener su tienda bastante surtida. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos necesarios para materia prima. En el futuro quiere obtener otro medio de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is 40 years old and started her business so that she could help with her family’s household expenses. Her store is located in her home and she offers a wide variety of products. She buys household products, basic grains, and candy among other items to offer to her customers who request them. Concepción seeks to maintain a well-stocked shop. In the future, she wants to find another means of generating income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim C., 44 years old, is a villager who lives in Trapeang Phlu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband earns a small income through his motorcycle repair business.

In order to increase income to improve her family's living standard, Mrs. Nim C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a machine charger to support her husband's business. 

The couple has three children who are students and also help with their parents' businesses. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase a machine charger.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Juliet is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is from the village of Balatacan, Tangub city. She is 37 years old. Mary Ann is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Ann is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Aurelio Velázquez es casado, tiene cinco hijos tres mujeres y dos varones con domicilio en la compañía Moñairy.

   El señor Aurelio es una persona muy trabajadora él es agricultor, tiene un pequeño tambo, una despensa y pero su actividad principal es la fabricación de accesorios de cuero que vende, como zapatillas de cuero, billeteras y cintos en forma ambulante.

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros, gomas, cola de zapateros y remaches para la fabricación de zapatillas de cuero.         
                                                                     
   Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad, mediante ello su negocio está creciendo cada día, su sueño es seguir creciendo, brindando un buen producto a  la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Aurelio Velázquez is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons, who live with him at home in the neighborhood of Moñairy.

Sr. Aurelio is hardworking gentleman. He is a farmer, an innkeeper, and operates a grocery store. However, his main business activity is making leather accessories such as shoes, wallets, and belts. He sells these items as a street vendor.

He is requesting a loan to buy leather, rubber soles, shoe adhesive, and fasteners for making shoes. Sr. Aurelio is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for supporting his business, which continues to grow each day. He hopes that it will continue growing so that he can provide a better product to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, rubber soles, shoe adhesive, and fasteners for making shoes and other accessories

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 40-year-old wife and mother of three sons and one daughter: Du'a, Numan, Imad and Muhamamd who are 16, 15, 12 and 10 years old, respectively. Taghreed and her family live in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Since the deterioration of life in Rafah when power cuts off often during the day, citizens of Gaza Strip started using power generators to avoid such cut offs.

Taghreed and her husband thought of a skill that is needed under such conditions. Her husband completed a generator repair course and after two years of practice, Taghreed's husband became an excellent handyman in this field and decided to start his own workshop. Therefore he took a $1,500 loan to buy the repair tools he needed. Taghreed's husband appears in the picture in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase tools to make repairs

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela R. is from the village of Barcolan. She is 41 years old. Carmela is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.Carmela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Carmela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Carmela from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter S. is from the town of Banga. He is 42 years old and married. He has three children, who are 13, 11 and 4 years of age. 

Peter is a farmer. He plants rice, coconut trees and bananas. He and his wife sell their harvest to the market. Sometimes, they use some of their harvest for family consumption. Peter does his best to sustain his farm so he can earn better and provide for his family.

Peter joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peter has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Peter is requesting a new loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other inputs

loans.name: Vilma Emelina

texts.es:
Vilma Emelina B. Núñez es una ama de casa y comerciante de 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene seis hijos y reside en la Aldea La Puerta en la Comunidad de Lepaguare, Olancho. 
Inició a ganarse la vida vendiendo cosméticos, ahora ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano para camas y niños, aprendió su negocio después de observar que algunas de sus vecinas vendían ropa y les iba bien, entonces compró un fardo y obtuvo muy buenas ganancias y además le quedaron algunas piezas para uso personal. No tiene un horario de atención establecido ya que los clientes pueden ir a buscarla a su casa y también sale a vender cuando termina los quehaceres de su hogar. Una de las ventajas que tiene es que con las ganancias puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y una de sus dificultades es que como vende de forma ambulante está expuesta a cualquier cambio de clima. 
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará tres fardos de ropa de segunda mano y con eso su negocio estará mejor surtido y con las ganancias obtenidas no la faltaría el sustento diario a su familia. Su sueño es instalar una pulpería para tener otra entrada de dinero y  de esta manera obtener más ganancias para poder seguir dándole el estudio a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Vilma is a housewife and trader. She is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the hamlet of La Puerta in the Lepaguare community in Olancho.
She started out earning a living selling cosmetics, but now she sells second hand clothes for kids and bedding. She had the idea to start this business after seeing some of her neighbors selling clothes and doing well from it. So, she bought a bundle of clothes and got very good returns and also was able to keep some items for her own use. She does not have set work hours, but her customers can come and find her in her house and she also goes around the community making sales when she has finished the daily housework. One of the advantages of this work is that the income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. One of the drawbacks is that, as she sells her goods in the street, she is exposed to all types of weather. 
She will use this loan to buy three bundles of second-hand clothing and this will leave her business better supplied. The resulting income will enable her to keep supporting the daily needs of her family. Her dream is to open a store so she can have another source of income to support her youngest daughter's studies.

loans.use: To buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is a married woman who lives in Purok Tuhay, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a General Store and a Rice Retailer business. Her husband Francisco, who is 66 years old, works as a Driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. 

They have 3 children who are between 33 to 38 years old. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and rice to sell so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of business.   Teresita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)  is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Egidia

texts.es:
Egidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito D. Cabanilla, provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 40 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 02 hijos,  la señora  realizó estudios D. educación superior incompleta.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 04 años, su  préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. animales caseros.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar ovejas.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda D. abarrotes y tener mejores ganados.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Egidia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  She did not complete her primary education.

Egidia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which was used to increase the working capital of her business selling domestic animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles to invest in buying sheep.

Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store and better livestock.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the talks.

loans.use: To buy livestock such as sheep

loans.name: Consuelo Balvina

texts.es:
La Señora. Consuelo M. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, también tiene 4 ríos los mismos que  bañan a la ciudad.

La Señora. Consuelo es madre soltera de 2 hijos  que ya son mayores de edad y están  casados, vive con su hija que tiene 30 años, la misma que tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, con el trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Consuelo se dedica a la venta de animales pequeños, actividad que desempeña hace 10 años y ha aprendido este negocio gracias a su madre quien labora en esta actividad.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza y le gusta por que para recibir un crédito no necesita muchos papeleos,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unas vacas para su negocio. Su meta es tener mas ganado para la venta y así ir creciendo mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Consuelo M. is a member of the El Aguacate Comunal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca within a community of the same name. This is a beautiful city due to its culture and traditions. It is home to a variety of cuisines and also has four rivers that bathe the city.

Consuelo is the mother of two children who are now adults and married. She lives with her daughter who is 30 years old and has two children, ages 6 and 3. With work and effort Consuelo has been able to build her own house. 

She works selling small animals, which she has been doing for 10 years. She learned this business thanks to her mother who also makes her living this way.

This is the second loan that Consuelo is requesting and she likes the program because she does not need to fill out much paperwork in order to receive a loan. Her new loan will go towards buying a few cattle for her business. Her goal is to have more livestock to sell and thereby grow her business much more.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for six years.  Most of her customers are people from her area.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business.  She is hoping to start large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: George Oluoch

texts.en:
George has been in the quarrying business in Naivasha town for the past two years. He is 35 years old and is married to Lilian Achieng. They have three school-aged children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a member of KADET LTD. This will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of KES 25,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy an extraction site and boost his manpower.

In the future, George hopes his business will grow and get more tenders for supplying building stones to different institutions in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy an extraction site and boost man power.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To enlarge his bookstore

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
In the San Blas area of Carapeguá City, some low-income women learned of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program and decided together to receive information on this program. These women are active, hard working and dedicated to embroidery and textiles. 

They were searching for a little more support to promote their credit, increase their household incomes and improve their quality of life. They need this loan transaction to invest in their jobs and thus ensure sustainable growth that will make them succeed as a group and individually.

Mrs. Ramona M. is a well known weaver in her area and wants to buy more fabric, canvas and yarn for increasing her production of textiles, as customers continue to place more orders that sometimes cannot be filled because of the lack of supplies.

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread, needles, yarn, racks, paintings, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Unity Self-Help group under Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group so he can save money and access loans easily because the group members guarantee each other's loans.  

Joseph runs a green grocery to earn a living.  He also sells scrap metal and charcoal.  Previously, he worked as a welder for a living.  He hopes to expand his business to earn more income in the future.  

Joseph had previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya, and was able to improve his business with that loan.  He has requested another loan for  40,000 Kes to buy scrap metal and fruits.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals and fruits to sell

loans.name: Melba Begonia

texts.es:
Melba Begonia G. C. tiene 22 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el cónyuge y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Melba se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Melba Begonia G. C., 22, is living with her spouse and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She has two sons.

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Melba farms corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to have a business of her own.  She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
For the past six years, Dorine has sold clothing from her home to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her husband is a tailor. They combine their incomes to support the family. They have five children, one of whom still attends school. 
   
Dorine joined Yehu Microfinance because it offers loans requiring few legal conditions to people who might not qualify for traditional bank loans. With her loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes (khangas) to offer for resale. Dorine dreams of establishing a big retail shop for selling khangas in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes (khangas) to offer for resale

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 27 años, vive en compañía de sus padres en la propiedad de sus progenitores. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, mercadería que es ofrecida a personas conocidas y familiares, dejando a crédito, así asegura el pago total de las prendas que vende. Por otro lado también se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee terrenos que sus padres le heredaron, de esta manera logra obtener ingresos extras para su familia. Pero el negocio que más le agrada es la venta de ropa, permitiéndole tener ingresos mas frecuentes a comparación de la agricultura que tiene que esperar tiempo para ver las ganancias, además necesita de capital para invertir en insumos para fertilizar los terrenos. Seguirá continuando en estas actividades ya que se ha propuesto mejorar en ambas tanto en las ventas como en la producción. Es su crédito número 2  con MFP, para ella significa mucho pertenecer en su banco comunal porque le permite  estar con personas que considera de su plena confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, será invertida en mercadería como prendas de vestir y la otra parte en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old and lives with her parents on property that they own. She has been selling clothes for more than two years and offers her merchandise to acquaintances and relatives. Luz offers her products on credit and is assured of full payment for the garments that she sells. She also engages in farming and has land that her parents inherited. This enables her family to generate extra income. However, she enjoys managing her clothing business more because farming requires that one must wait some time before seeing any profit. In addition, farming requires capital to invest in supplies for fertilizing the land. Luz will continue in both business activities in hopes of improving her sales and her farm production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Being part of a Communal Bank has significant meaning to Luz because she has a group of people who have complete trust in her. The loan she is requesting will be invested in merchandise for her clothing business, but some of the money will also be used to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothing business and sacks of compost for her crops.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe Mayela

texts.es: La Sra. María  tiene tres  hijos   los cuales  representan lo mas  importante  en  su  vida , actualmente se  dedica a la venta de quesos y mangonadas,  en  esta  ocasión  ella  desea   realizar  la compra  de un  refrigerador   mas   grande ya  que  el  que  tiene   en la actualidad  es   muy  pequeño y  los  productos  que   ella   vende  ocupan  mucho espacio ,   ve  la  oportunidad  de ofrecer  un mayor  numero de  productos  a  sus clientes y   generar  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: María has three children who are the most important part of her life. Currently she works selling cheeses and mango popsicles. María would like to purchase a larger refrigerator because the one that she has now is very small and the products she sells take up a lot of space. She sees the opportunity to offer a higher number of products to her customers and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es: La señora Eleuteria vende café y comida en un snack que ella atiende. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: café, te, azúcar, y para elaborar la comida fideo, arroz, condimentos, etc. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de San José De Yunguyo de la ciudad de el Alto; es casada y tiene cuatro  hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Eleuteria sells and serves coffee and snack foods. The loan will be used to buy products such as coffee, tea, sugar, noodles, rice, and condiments. She lives in her own home in the the San José De Yunguyo area in the city of el Alto. She is married and has four children. This is her first loan with IMRPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy coffee, tea, sugar, noodles, rice, and condiments

loans.name: Imteyaz

texts.en: Imteyaz is a 30-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three daughters and three sons. Imteyaz's house needs plastering and painting after the winter season. Imteyaz, who is photographed in the picture above, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the repair expenses as her husband works in a factory in the city and receives a very decent salary, which won't let him cover the expenses all at once.

loans.use: to pay for plastering and painting her home

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 33 years old and married, with five children aged between 3 and 11 years old.  She has 8 years experience selling men's shoes. Her business is well-organized and she works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Saturday. Marie Chantal currently employs two people to help her.

Marie Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more men's shoes to sell. She will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more men's shoes  to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells Fante kenkey (foodstuff made from femented maize dough) at Abura. Her hand is placed on the pot she uses to cook the kenkey. She is divorced and has been producing kenkey for 15 years. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: At a village called Jukwa, Adwoa sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this trade for 5 years and has been through junior high school. She is divorced and has three children. As a single parent, she pays school fees, feeds and clothes her children. She wishes to invest the amount she is going to receive into the clothing business so that she can take care of her children properly. The new profit that will be realized will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to invest into the clothing business.

loans.name: Alfredo Javier

texts.es:
Alfredo Javier tiene 41 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 14, 6 años y 9 meses, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es mejorar la casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.


Le gusta jugar futbol y pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Javier is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children (ages 14, 6, and 9 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Alfredo is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan he is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. He plans to buy seeds and compost for his corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. His dreams include making improvements to his house and providing for his children’s education.

Alfredo enjoys playing soccer and spending time with his children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: 13 Lien Minh Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phong operates a food stall selling fish, shrimp and frogs. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs. Phong is 47 years old and married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 13 Lien Minh Hoang T. solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with four dependents.

In 2011, Phong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phong has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phong has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardships that Phong faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

In the future, Phong hopes to remodel her house, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

loans.name: Lorena Del Pilar

texts.es:
Lorena de 43 años nunca pensó que la separición de su esposo era un reto para ella, por eso decidió comprar mercadería de mujeres (AVON Y YANBAL) y empezar su negocio (Bazar), con el cual ha sabido salir adelante con su hija que estudia un colegio fiscal.

La peligrosidad en la zona es su preocupación, ya que ella atiende sola todo el día. Con un préstamo ella desea comprar mas mercadería como perfumes, ropa, bisutería, cuadernos, lapices e incrementar sus ingresos y por ende ampliar su negocio, y seguir solventado la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Lorena, 43 years old, never thought that separating from her husband would be a challenge for her. That is why she decided to buy women's merchandise  (Avon and Yanbal) and begin her business (called Bazar), which has enabled her to get by with her daughter who is attending public school.

She worries about how dangerous the area is where she staffs her business alone all day. With this loan she wants to buy more merchandise such as perfume, clothes, miscellaneous goods, notebooks and pencils and increase her income and in this way expand her business and continue to pay for her daughter’s education

loans.use: to buy perfume and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister).

Annet has a food stall. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality and the increasing prices of foodstuffs. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Jessica Maribel

texts.es:
Jessica de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jessica desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería de forma ambulatoria en las afueras del mercado de la misma zona, para este rubro no existe mucha competencia, por la ubicación de su negocio su clientela es fluida y con los ingresos que obtenga por la venta de sus productos podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para seguir comercializando a sus clientes, al incrementarse sus ganacias podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Jessica es unamujere alegre,reponsable que consu trabajo saca adelante a su familia y quiere que su hijo tenga estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Jessica, 33 years old, lives with her husband and son in their own home with all utilities.  It is located in the urban area of the Chepen district, which belongs to the department of La Libertad.  Farming, ranching, and tourism characterize the area.

For 5 years Jessica has sold hardware products as a street vendor outside the market in the same area, where there is not much competition.  Because of the location of her business, customer business if fluid, and with the income made selling her products she is able to cover her daily household needs.

She has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternative of 2000 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise to continue marketing to her customers. By increasing her earnings she will be able to cover the loan given and improve her quality of life.  Jessica is a happy woman; responsible with her work, she helps her family move forward and wants her son to have higher education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to implement her business.

loans.name: Sofia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del banco comunal Siete Estrellas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, eatá casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, son 10 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, los préstamos le sirven para comprar su mercadería y seguir implementando cada día más su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 docenas de truzas, 5 docenas de brasieres, 2 docenas de bóxer, 3 docenas de ropa interior para caballeros, 1 docena de fajas, 1 docena de modeladores para niñas.
Nos cuenta que segocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan, su esposo también aporta para los gastos básicos del hogar,  espera seguir trabajando  con Manuela Ramos, sus hijos ya son mayores y ninguno está a su cargo.
texts.en:
Señora Sofía is a member of the communal bank Siete Estrellas in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works for himself.

She sells lingerie. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years. The loans are used by her to buy merchandise and continue growing her business every day. 

With her new loan of 3,000.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy: 3 dozen briefs, 5 dozen brasieres, 2 dozen boxer shorts, 3 dozen pairs of men underwear, 1 dozen corsets, 1 dozen girls bras.

She tells us that being a member is giving her great satisfaction; she is seeing the fruit of her labour and she feels happy because she can help her children when they need it. Her husband also provides for basic household expenses. She hopes to continue working with Manuela Ramos. Her children are both adults and no longer dependents.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 20 years-old and lives with her mother and brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother helps her to manage the family business. Her brother is a high school student. She started her business in 2009 selling cellphones and their spare parts at the local market. 

She has collected sufficient business and work experience so that she sells cellphones and spare parts that are following market trends. She is planning to expand her business and open another shop at another market. She is a diligent, energetic and hard working woman who says "I like my job and I plan to expand my business in the future. In addition, I will also open another shop." She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to buy cellphones and spare parts and increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and spare parts.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a poultry farmer living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow with three children and the responsibility for looking after the family rests solely on her. 

Doreen has been in poultry business for six years. She started with local chickens; then bought 30 broilers and now has over 100 birds. She wants a loan to buy feed for her poultry.

Doreen dreams of building a house and enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Safaroy

texts.ru: Сафарой жительница Яванского района. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Сафарой более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Safaroy is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Safaroy has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  She breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont deux vont aux collège et un au lycée.En 2000 ayant  considéré les charges de sa famille,elle commence a vendre des poulets a bouillir en détail  au marche sur un étalage, après quelques années, avec ses benefices, elle ouvre une boucherie , poissonnerie et une alimentation et en 2010, elle reçoit le premier prêt de Hope, et avec ses differents prêts son commerce change réellement,ses ventes ont augmentes,son capital a largement évolué et elle rembourse sans difficultés et fait des épargnes considérables.

A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises,en ajoutant des cartons de poules a bouillir , des cartons de cuisses de poulets, des cartons de saucissons, des cartons de viande comme les queues de bœuf, l'arrière et l'avant ,quelques cartons de poisson soles,  des boites de tomates pelées, des cartons de macédoines.
Elle a l'intention d'ouvrir une chambre froide, comme une bonne mère de famille, elle s'occupe valablement de sa famille et travaille maintenant  en association  avec son mari.
texts.en:
This customer is 39 years old, married and mother to three children, two of whom are at secondary school and one at "lycée". In 2000 she began to sell chickens for boiling on a stall in the market in order to cover her expenses, and after several years she used her profits to open a shop selling meat, fish and groceries. In 2010 she got her first loan from Hope and with the various loans she has received her business has undergone a real change, her sales have increased, her capital developed significantly and she manages without any difficulty to repay her loans and save a considerable amount.

On receipt of her new loan she is going to boost her stock with cartons of chickens for boiling, chicken thighs, sausage and meat, such as oxtail, hindquarters and forequarters, as well as several cartons of sole, canned tomatoes and cartons of mixed diced vegetables.

She intends to open a cold storage room and as a good mother she looks after her family well and now works together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs, hindside, pork, sausages and fish.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, ciudad de  clima cálido y agradable y con una rica gastronomía, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Santo Rosario.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora rosa, tiene 56 años de edad, está soltera y tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 13 años que  estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana recorriendo con sus productos, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más sabanas, edredones y también ropa que piensa vender para  aprovechar la temporada navideña. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
  
Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Santo Rosaria meet every 15 days in the parish of Andrés De Vera in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, a city of temperate and agreable climate and great food. Here we met Señora Rosa who is 56 years old, single and has 3 children, 2 adult and one 13 years old who studies at school. Two of her children still live with her.

In order to get ahead, she sells sheets and duvets door-to-door and from her own house where she has a small locale. She travels around with her products 4 days a week, extending credit to her customers and she collects payment every 8 days. She has been doing this for a year and is doing quite well.
 
She is going to use this loan to buy more sheets, duvets and clothes that she plans to sell taking advantage of the holiday season. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it becasue with one of the loans she started her business.

Her dream is to have a large bazaar.

loans.use: to buy sheets, duvets and clothes.

loans.name: Ruta Tausolo

texts.en:
Ruta is a married woman, who is 55 years old, and has four kids.

Ruta owns and operates a business venture selling ice cakes and soft drinks. She has two years of experience in this business. Ruta needs a loan of WST 1500. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Ruta's second loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, and cool aid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like cloth and some spare parts for the sewing machine.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena cuenta 64 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella pero ninguno ya está estudiando su esposo se llama Emigdio es campesino.
Ella es comerciante ya tiene 4 años con su negocio de ropa doña Elena invertirá su préstamo en la compra de ropa de nuevos modelos de blusas, ella sale a vender a las colonias más cercanas y dice que le está yendo muy bien a doña Elena le gustaría establecer un local para allí vender su ropa por ahora solo está vendiendo fuera en los lugares más cercanos pero no descarta la oportunidad y cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elena is 64 years old, married, and has three children who are dependent on her. None of them are in school. Her husband Emigdio is a farm laborer.

Doña Elena is a merchant and has been selling clothes for four years. She will invest her loan in the purchase of new styles of blouses. Elena travels to the neighborhoods nearby to sell her goods and says that she has done very well. She would like to establish a shop where she can sell clothes, but for now she must go sell in the places that are closest to her. However, she does not rule out the opportunity of reaching her goal.

loans.use: to buy blouses.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Kiden is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Edilberta cuenta con 25 años de edad, vive unión libre con su pareja tienen 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando la primaria el mayor esta en 4° de primaria se llama víctor Javier y Lizeth esta en 3° su esposo se llama víctor es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende frutas y verduras ya tiene 4 años con el negocio sale a vender en su pueblo y también tiene establecido un lugar en su casa, dice que le va muy bien ya que invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: manzana, naranjas, lechuga, jitomate, chile, etc. Ella espera que le vaya muy bien en el negocio y así poder incrementarlo mas ya que le gustaría poner otro negocio.

Edilberta pertenece al grupo azucenas el cual esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Alberta, Demetria, Lorenza, Junvencia, Susana, Delfina, Alejandra, Aureliana, Constancia, Roxana, todas realizan una actividad comercial como venta de ropa, pan, refrescos, tamales, frutas y verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 25 years old and lives with her partner; they have 2 children who are in primary school.  The older child, Víctor Javier, is in 4th grade, and Lizbeth is in 3rd grade.  Her husband is named Víctor and is an agricultural worker.

She dedicates herself to commerce, selling fruits and vegetables.  She has 4 years in the business, and goes out to sell in her town and also has a site in her house.  She states that things are going well, and she will invest her loan into the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as:  apples, oranges, lettuce, tomatoes, chilies, etc.  She hopes that things go very well for her with the business so she can expand it more, and she would also like to open another business.

Edilberta belongs to the group Azucenas (Lilies), which is comprised of 11 members who are all hard-working women.  We will mention them here:  Alberta, Demetria, Lorenza, Junvencia, Susana, Delfina, Alejandra, Aureliana, Constancia and Roxana.  They all carry out some type of commercial activity such as the sale of clothing, bread, beverages, tamales, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables such as:  apples, oranges, lettuce, tomatoes, chilies, etc.

loans.name: Annim

texts.en:
Annim is 31 years old. She is married and has five children ranging from 3 to 11 years old. She is an aggressive and ambitious woman. For three years, she has been involved in a retail business where she sells airtime vouchers, cards and provides money transactions of the Safaricom company to repeat and walk-in customers. In addition, Annim runs a paraffin retail business to increase her income. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. 

She will be using the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy meat to start a new business of a butcher shop. In the future, Annim' s hope and dream is to run several butcher shops and venture into retail shops.

loans.use: To buy meat to start a new butcher shop business.

loans.name: Ndack's Group

texts.fr: le groupe a été crée le 14/05/2010 et est composé de femmes issues de différents quartier. Le groupe a été composé par affinité entre ses membres et sur la base de confiance elles sont venues adhérer dans BV. Leurs activités sont le commerce, la coiffure, la couture et l élevage. Khady  l'emprunteur en vedette est veuve âgée de 49 ans et mère de 6 enfants debout à droite de la photo avec le foulard, elle fait le petit commerce de poissons et de divers choses habits et chaussures en plus de cela elle fait de l'élevage ovine chez elle. Avec les bénéfices elle gère la scolarité des enfants, et elle fait de l'investissement progressif immobilier ( construction)car son mari est décédé
texts.en: This group was created on 14/05/2010 and consists of women from different neighborhoods. The group was formed by ties between its members and on the basis of trust they joined "banc villageois." Their businesses are retail, hairdressing, sewing, and breeding. Khady, the featured borrower, is a 49 year old widow and mother to 6 children. She is standing to the right in the photo wearing a scarf. She is a small retailer of fish and a variety of things, clothing and shoes. In addition to this she breeds sheep at home. With the profits she manages the schooling of her children and she invests progressively in property (construction) since her husband is deceased.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: fish, clothing, shoes and sheep.

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Exitosos Group

texts.es:
La socia Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Inversionistas Exitosos”, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y provincia de Cusco.

La socia Silvia tiene 58 años de edad,02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como casacas,chompas,polos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia es docente de profesión la socia enseña en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Cusco , la socia desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio y trabajo para que de esta forma la socia continúe apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como casacas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, reparar celulares, restaurador, contadores y docentes.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the community bank "los inversionistas exitosos" [Successful Investors]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco and province of Cusco. 

Silvia is 58 years old, has two children, and is married. She mixes into her daily activities the business of selling clothes, like zip jackets, sweaters, polo shirts, and among other items. She has worked in this business for a good amount of time, which is going well thanks to the efforts that she puts forth every day toward her business. At the same time, she is a teacher by profession. She teaches in one of the schools in the city of Cusco. She hopes to be able to move forward with her business and work so that in this way she can continue to support the family. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise like zip jackets. 

The rest of the community bank members work selling vegetables, repairing cell phones, running a restaurant, as accountants, and as teachers. 

The member who is in the corner of the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. 

Silvia is thankful for the loan and is committed to comply with her established payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like zip jackets.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro owns a bike shop and is a second time lender from Kiva. He is very grateful for the first loan that he received. All his payments were on time and he was able to repay without any inconveniences. Pedro is hopeful that he will receive a follow up loan so that he may continue to grow his business. When his parents ran the shop Pedro never seemed interested in joining the family business but four years ago he found himself without a job and saw the opportunity to join in. Now he runs the shop on his own and is inspired by the loans that he has received from Mifex and Kiva. He plans to buy a new air compressor for the shop and will continue to invest in tools that make him more efficient. His location on a main street allows his business to have great exposure and bring in a consistent flow of customers. Pedro has recently hired an employee, an adolescent without a home who he is lending a hand to.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Compressor and other tools for his shop

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy bakes foods such as pies of different kinds, bread, doughnuts, etc., and supplies schools and the general public. The number of schools wanting her baked goods is increasing. At certain times she is unable to supply these schools because she has no money for ingredients. She is seeking a loan of $850 from Kiva to enable her meet her customer's demands. She can keep simple records on sales and as such can pay back the loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor runs a small business where he offers tire repair services. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Igor has gained much rich experience in car repair and mechanical work. His gross revenue per month currently amounts to around $800, and his monthly net profit is about $500.

Igor has been working with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2004. He has gained a reputation as a responsible entrepreneur and a man of integrity. With financial assistance he has been able to purchase a workshop facility for his business. His tire repair business has been very profitable as there is always a need for good car mechanics that are knowledgeable in vehicle repair.

Igor is a Christian and he realizes that God has helped his business to be sustainable and successful. He is requesting a loan for $600 that will enable him to finish some reconstruction on his workshop facility and improve his quality of service. Igor believes that this financial assistance will give him the chance to provide professional service and best meet his customers’ needs. Additional generated profits will help Igor improve his family’s living standards and will allow him to make more investments into the further expansion of his venture.

В Ігоря є невеличка майстерня, він займається шиномонтажем. Він – одружений, в нього є син та дочка. В Ігоря – багатий досвід роботи механіком. Зараз його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 800 доларів, чистий прибуток - 500 доларів щомісяця. Ігор співпрацює з „Надією України” з 2004 року. Він – відповідальний та порядний. Завдяки фінансовій підтримці він зміг придбати майстерню. Бізнес Ігоря став дуже прибутковим, тому що завжди існує потреба в гарних механіках та спеціалістах з ремонту автомобілів. Ігор – християнин. Він розуміє, що Бог допоміг його бізнесу досягти стабільності та успіху. Він просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб закінчити ремонт у майстерні та покращити якість обслуговування клієнтів. Ігор вважає, що фінансова підтримка допоможе йому забезпечити професійний рівень роботи майстерні та задовольнити потреби клієнтів. Отримані кошти Ігор планує витратити на покращення житлових умов власної родини, а також вкласти частину грошей в подальший розвиток власної справи.

loans.use: To reconstruct his workshop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose M. is a trader who travels to other states to buy garri and sells it wholesale in her community. She is proud to be Lift Above Poverty Organization's client and says LAPO has helped boost her business. Rose is 35 years of age, married with four children. She hopes to get a loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri for resale

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

50 years old, Mrs A. Aku is a married, mother of five (5) children and has under her care three (3) other people. Her principal business activity is sale of paraffin oil in her locality. This activity gets enough incomes to her and allows her to contribute for a great part to the loads of the household.

Today, a very strong request for products of general food is felt and Mrs. A. Aku seized the occasion to also sell food in addition to oil sales. But she needs enough money to reinforce the activity. It is regularly in out-of-stock condition, and the customers are obliged to go elsewhere to make their purchases. To cure that and to satisfy her customers effectively, she requests a loan of $500 which will be used by her for the purchase and the sale of the products of general food.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Aku est mariée, mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Elle a comme activité principale la vente de pétrole lampant dans sa localité. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et lui permet de contribuer pour une grande part aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, une demande très forte de produits d’alimentation générale se fait sentir et Mme A. Aku a saisi l’occasion pour associer ce petit commerce à sa vente de pétrole. Mais elle a besoin d’assez d’argent pour renforcer l’activité. Elle est régulièrement en rupture de stock, et les clients sont obligés de se rendre ailleurs pour faire leurs achats. Pour remédier à cela et satisfaire efficacement sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: Achat et  vente des produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.name: Sinafea

texts.en:
Sinafea S. is a 19 year old mother in Faleu Manono who runs a very successful fishing business. Her husband works at Yasaki and she relies on him to make payments and help support the family. They have one child who is in school.

This will be Sinafea's fifth loan and she will use it for home improvement. She believes these loans will be the beginning of success for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing, nails, timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma and her husband are a couple characterized as a hardworking, entrepreneur couple. Their goal is to offer their four dear little ones a better quality of life. Currently they prepare and commercialize art crafts. This is a typical job at the Peruvian jungle. They are being successful due to their hard work, dedication and excellent details.

The wish of this enthusiastic couple is to acquire more materials to continue elaborating beautiful art crafts. They want to save enough from this generated income in order for their children to have an adequate education. This is why they strive and work tirelessly and at the same time provide support for their community. Your economical support will be a good investment in the hands of this couple.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma y su esposo, conforman una pareja de esposos que se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadores y emprendedores, a fin de ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro queridos pequeños. Actualmente ellos se dedican ala preparación y comercialización de productos artesanales, característicos de la selva peruana, que gracias a su empeño, dedicación y excelentes acabados están teniendo éxito.El deseo de esta entusiasta pareja es adquirir una mayor cantidad de materiales con los cuales podrán seguir elaborando bellas artículos; para que a través de los beneficios económicos que genere puedan ahorrar lo suficiente y sus hijos puedan tener una adecuada educación, razón por lo que se esfuerzan y trabajan incansablemente y al mismo tiempo brindan apoyo a su comunidad. Vuestro apoyo económico será una buena inversión en las manos de esta pareja.

loans.use: Puchase raw material to continue fabricating beautiful art crafts.

loans.name: Ángela Petronila

texts.es:
Angela Petronila M. M. is married. She attended through the sixth grade of primary school, and is not supporting any children. She has a business in her home which she runs together with her husband. She began running the business as a way to help her spouse support their family.

When they opened their business, the children were small, and they saw that it was necessary to begin investing in the business.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the last three years. She has show that she manages her loans well. They have been very opportune, helping her with cash flow problems in her business.

Now this business is, if not the strongest, at least among the strongest found in Chichigalpa.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela Petronila M. M. es casada, cursó hasta el sexto grado de primaria, no tiene hijos a su cargo, tiene ubicado el negocio en su casa de habitación, el negocio de ella lo lleva a cabo junto con su esposo, ella comienza a administrar el negocio para ayudarle a su marido a sostener la familiar.

Al iniciar el negocio sus hijos estaban pequeños y miraron la necesidad de comenzar a invertir en el negocio.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para solventar problemas de iliquidez en el negocio.

Actualmente este negocio si no es el mas fuerte es uno de los mas fuerte que están en Chichigalpa.

loans.use: Inversion en el negocio

loans.name: Thi Vien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vien, 37 years old, has 4 daughters who are all in school. Besides farming, Vien and her husband raise thousands of chicken and open a sundry shop to increase their family income. With the new loan of 150USD, Mrs. Vien would be able to buy more stuff to sell. She really likes to borrow from Binhminhcdc (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) because its procedure is simple, and comfortable. Furthermore, the microcredit officers go to each village to lend people the money and get their repayment, so Mrs. Vien does not need to go far to borrow money.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Viễn, 37 tuổi, có 4 con gái đều còn đang đi học. Ngoài công việc đồng án, vợ chồng chị Viễn còn chăn nuôi hàng nghìn con gà đẻ trứng và bán hàng tạp hoá để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với số tiền vay được (2006000đ) gia đình chị sẽ mua thêm hàng để bán. Chị rất thích vay vốn của Chương trình tài chính vi mô vì thủ tục đơn giản, thuận tiện; cán bộ lại xuống tận nơi để thu và phát vốn, chị không phải đi lại xa và vất vả.

loans.use: Bán tạp hoá

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is the proud mother of three grown children who are living independently and are successful. She has been married to her husband Jacinto for many years and together they have made their living raising chickens.

Six years ago they increased their business and were able to give employment to two other people in the community as well. Over the years they have formed a great clientele and are known for the excellent quality of their chickens.

Now they have expanded their business and also run a general store where they sell the chickens along with other food. Their small convenience store is also successful, however, Irene is looking to expand. She wants to use the meat that they raise to make Paraguayan delicacies to sell as snacks in their shop. With the loan, Irene will buy the necessary ingredients to make the food to sell.

loans.use: buying ingredients to make empanada and milonesas, along with general refreshments

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Hortensia Carrazco makes and sells delicious tortillas in her home in the Villanueva district of the city of Chinandega. Because of her experience in this business, she has gained many customers who are satisfied with the tortillas she makes everyday very early in the morning.

She urgently needs to purchase the ingredients necessary to make her tortillas, which is why she is turning to Ceprodel, confident that she will receive the loan that will allow her to improve her economic status and move her business forward. She has received 4 loans from this institution that have strongly supported both the improvement of her business and the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Maria Hortensia Carrazco se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas en su casa de habitación en Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con mucha experiencia en este negocio se ha ganado a muchos clientes que se sienten satisfechos de las tortillas que ella prepara todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.

La necesidad que atraviesa en estos momentos es la urgencia de la compra de la materia prima para las tortillas por esta razón acude a Ceprodel muy confiada creyendo que se le otorgará crédito que le permita mejorar su condición económica y salir adelante en su negocio. Actualmente ella posee 4 créditos con la institución que le han apoyado fuertemente en el mejoramiento de su negocio y en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Lloily

texts.es:
Señorita Lloily D. R. belongs to the communal bank called "Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin in Moyabamba. She sells candy made out of sugar cane and peanuts. She works from home. She sells her candy in different stores throughout the city.

She decided to follow the family tradition. Her mother also makes candy which is a familiar trade in this area. She only does this part-time since she goes to school to become a high-school teacher.

Wth this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic ingredients such as peanuts, sugar and plastic bags for packaging.

Llloily is a young woman full of goals and dreams. She dreams to one day industrialize this business and sell this type of candy throughout the country.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita LLoily D. Rodríguez pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, para luego ser distribuidos a las principales bodegas de la comunidad y otras provincias del departamento. Decidió iniciar su negocio por tradición familiar ,su mamá también se dedica a este tipo de actividad muy propio de la zona, comparte su tiempo estudiando en la universidad para ser profesora de educación secundaria. Con el crédito de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Llloily, es una mujer muy joven llena de ilusiones y metas por lo que sueña convertir este negocio en una industria y así poder comercializar sus productos con otras regiones del país.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Sarah M.. She is a widow and has three children aged 10, 20, and 30. In 2000, Sarah opened her general store and takeaway kiosk. Sarah now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, water, juice, oil, sugar, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or words in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, although I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool. All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of water, soda, juice, cooking oil, soap, and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a woman of humble origins who together with her husband participates in various jobs depending on the season. She has four children and she is teaching them her business. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. Betty is requesting a loan to assist her in selling crackers, snacks, canned goods and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Es una señora D. clase humilD. juntamente con su esposo realizan varias tareas por temporada, mantiene a 4 hijos a los cuales tambien les va enseñando el negocio es una señoara muy trabajadora y responsable. Solicta para mercaderia D. galletas, abarrotes, conservas y otros

loans.use: For the purchase and sale of crackers, snacks, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Ieng S., 37, is a fish seller as well as selling vegetables. She buys fish from fishermen and sells them in the market for profit. She earns around $4 per day.
