Her husband, Mr. Tav Pov, 37, is a fisherman and earns around $5 per day. They have three children and all of them are young and in school. They live in Roteang Village, Siem Reap Province.

Because of her fish and vegetable-selling business, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase more fish and vegetables to sell. With the remainder of the loan, she will fix her husband's fishing boat. The loan will allow her to increase the family’s income and improve living conditions. The picture is Mrs. S. and her husband.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and vegetables to sell and fix her husband's boat

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. is a 31-year-old farmer. She earns about $1.00 a day selling grilled potatoes in her village. Her husband, Mr. Nem Theam, is a wood-sawing shop worker. He earns approximately $1.25 per day. Mom has a child, who is a student, and they live in Koktlok Le Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Mom requests a loan of $625 to purchase a pump machine, and the rest of the money will go to purchase fertilizers to help increase the rice yield of their farming business. They hope this loan will increase their income and sustain their family's living.

loans.use: To purchase a pump-machine and fertilizer to increase the rice yield of the farming business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis S. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is a single mother with two children. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband’s income and support her family. One and a half years ago, she found a job and since then she has been working for the cell phone company “Beeline.” Today Nargis is planning to expand her business and to buy more SIM cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount. For this reason, she needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) that she will repay over a period of 12 months. The love of her children is the biggest reason for Nargis to make an effort to provide what they need. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this family. Thanks!

loans.use: Purchasing SIM cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. is 36 years old, and she is a farmer. Specifically, she grows rice for a living, but she also makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell from her house. She has been operating her business since 1990, and she currently earns approximately US$2.20 per day. Moreover, she is married and has three children, one of whom is a garment worker who earns approximately US$20 per day. Her husband, a 33-year-old man, breeds pigs and sells the pigs.

To generate more income, Mom is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 Riel (US$375) to purchase bamboo in order to make baskets to sell. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds would be used to buy pig food for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo in order to make baskets to sell and, if there are remaining loan proceeds, to purchase pig food for her husband's business

loans.name: Loun

texts.en: Loun S., 36, is a teacher and a farmer. Her husband works raising fish and farming as well. This couple earns around US$3 of profit combined each day. Farming by depending on the sky is unreliable and sometimes they face crop damage because of lack of water. To escape this problem, Loun S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a water pump. This machine will be used to hire to people for extra profit as well. Loun's husband is pictured in the photograph as the borrower was not available when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Chong

texts.en:
Chong T., 42, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling used clothes to earn a living and is able to make $7 a day. Her husband Kong Sron, 44, is a worker and makes $6 a day. This couple together has six children, one of who is married and lives away from home. The others are students. 

Chong T. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to increase her clothes inventory. This will allow her to get more clients. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To add clothes to inventory

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet O. is a 38 year-old woman living in Bware village in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is married to a local man who works in the armed forces. They have 5 children, all of whom are attending school. 

Linet O. sells cereals in Bware which she has done since 2006. She buys the stock from local farms, but when this is not enough she travels across the nearby border to Tanzania to purchase more. 

Linet says that it is due to her business that she is able to feed and educate her children, as well as pay for miscellaneous household expenses. 

Linet has applied for a loan of $300 in order to boost her business by purchasing maize. She plans to buy 20 bags of maize with the loan money, as now the price is low, and sell them when the price goes back up so that she can maximize her profit.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
LUZ ESTELA C. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertad N° 820, del Distrito de Callería, tiene 57 años de edad, madre soltera con 03 hijos, todos mayores de edad, socia de Manuela Ramos 08 años.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, arregló el local que alquila para comprar y vender artefactos electrodomésticos, en un jirón muy concurrido cerca al mercado con la ayuda de sus hijos sigue progresando.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más artefactos, fuera de servicios para luego ella arreglarlos y venderlos, ahora el negocio va bien creció más con la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en:
LUZ ESTELA C. P. belongs to “De la Amistad II” Communal Bank located in Libertad N° 820 Street in the Callería District. She is 57 years old, is a single mother with 3 children, all of whom are adults, and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 8 years. The first loan that she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she fixed up the stand located on a very busy street near to the market that she rents to buy and sell appliances. With her children's help it continues progressing. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought more appliances in disrepair to later fix and sell them. Now her business is going well and grew more with her children's help.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances in disrepair to fix and sell them

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: L., 30, has been fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake for a long time. He earns on average $2 per day. He is married to Rom, age 29, who works with him in the fishing business. The couple have three children. All three are teenagers attending school, and they live together in Siem Reap Province. L. presently faces a problem in that his fishing equipment often has broken. Therefore, he is applying for a loan in order to buy additional fish equipment like nets and traps, to supply his business operation.

loans.use: To buy additional fish equipment

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.en:
J. Fathullo is married and the father of three kids. He is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing wheat and vegetables. Fathullo leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home.

Fathullo would like to request a loan of 6000 Somoni, which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers that are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this amount will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Fathullo always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru:
Артыков Абдучаббор мужчина 49 лет, женат имеет шестерых детей, сам по специальности строитель .кроме своего основного дохода он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него 30 коз и пять больших коров. В день мониторинга скот отсутствовал, они были на пастбищах. Поэтому не удалось запечатлеть на фото вместе со скотом. Абдучаббор мужчина , который очень хорошо разбирается в породистых скотах.
По моральному облику видно , что займ будет использован действительно для увеличения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Abdujabbor A. is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has six children. By profession, he is a builder, but to supplement his main income, he raises and sells livestock. At present he has 30 goats and five large cows. On the day we visited, the livestock were not there. As they were out to pasture, it was not possible to photograph him together with his cattle. Abdujabbor has an excellent understanding of purebred cattle and is a man of character who will truly use this loan to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sale of cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school and her husband is a buyer and seller of diamonds. She lives with her family in a village called Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana. Grace is very hardworking and supportive to her husband in providing food and shelter for her household.

She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood which stocks items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She has been in this business for six years now. Grace belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya D. is 47 and a single mother with three children aged 19, 21 and 24. All of her children are Mongolian National University (the biggest university in Mongolia) students. Her family lives in a "ger" district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enhtuya runs an underwear sales stall at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business with 1.5 million tugrugs ($1 USD=1400 MNT) in 1999. With the profits, she covers all of her children's tuition and family expenses. Her working capital has been increased to 3 million tugrugs.

Enhtuya requests a loan to buy underwear at wholesale prices to increase her business inventory. Her hope is to buy a new condominium for her family. She is a hard working and loyal person who wishes the best for her children.

loans.use: To buy underwear at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Delia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Delia raises livestock. Her main source of income is raising pigs for sale. Delia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Delia joined PAGLAUM COOP to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php3,000 from PAGLAUM COOP. Delia is requesting a new loan of Php7000 which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Delia from PAGLAUM COOP.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the  future

loans.name: Mer

texts.en: Mer is forty-nine years old and works for a non-government organization in Takeo Province with a daily income of about $2.30. She is married and has three children. Her husband drives a taxi from the Province to the Capital City, and he can make as much as $151 a month. Due to the fact that her husband’s car, which he uses as a taxi, is old and often under repair, she wants to take out a loan of $1000 from Kiva to buy a new car. The car will be more useful to her husband and will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait le commerce de friperie, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2002, son ancienneté fait qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement son commerce, elle s’approvisionne au GHANA et au NIGERIA ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de meilleures marges bénéficiaires sur ses ventes. Actuellement elle veut augmenter  son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour commander au GHANA des friperies.
Elle est mariée et a 03 personnes à charges.
texts.en:
This is a woman who does commerce in second-hand clothing. She started this business in 2002. Her seniority in it means she has mastered it. She supplies herself from GHANA and from NIGERIA, which means she realizes some of the best profit margins on her sales. Currently, she wants to increase her stock of merchandise. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES for ordering used clothing from GHANA. She is married and has three people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Zuro

texts.en:
M. Zuro is the married mother of an enthusiastic family. She is a very hard worker, who rises early in the morning to feed her cattle. She works for the well-being and happiness of her two children. She wants to improve the setup of her business to increase her earnings. In order to satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, Zuro needs to buy more cattle to raise for sale. She is seeking a loan of $1200 USD for this. Let’s support this hardworking and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and is married with three children.  She has a business selling clothing, shoes and dairy products such as yogurt, cheese and butter.  Olga’s husband works at a business which provides cleaning and security services to other companies.  Olga and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.

Olga has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She used her very first loan of 300 Peruvian soles (about $100 US) to invest in dairy products.  She has since expanded her business ventures and now sends money to the Peruvian capital, Lima, to purchase clothing and shoes to resell in Pucallpa.  Olga will use this loan of 1500 soles (about $525) to invest in clothing and shoes from Lima as well as in her dairy products.

Olga’s goal is to have her own store out of her home where she can sell her products.  In this way she will not have to travel around to visit her clients; they will come to her.  Olga hopes to grow her business in order to help her children get a good education.

loans.use: Clothing, shoes, and dairy products for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 57 year old father of five and grandfather to three. He operates a carpentry business manufacturing household and office furniture. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 50,000 to add stock of timber, bolts, fittings and paint. He hopes to recruit his children to his business and convert it into a family business and install machines for efficiency. He describes himself as a focused team player.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane T. was born in 1963. She has graduated from the State Engineering Institute of Armenia. Gayane and her husband, Eduard, have a daughter who studies at the Yerevan State Conservatory. 

Gayane and her husband, who appear together in the photo, have a common business. The family has been renting a place at the largest Yerevan Fair since the very first days of its opening in 1992. They sell men’s clothing: suits, leather jackets, shirts, trousers, ties, and socks. Gayane needs $3000 to change the assortment of clothing that she sells from summer to winter wear.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal for bulk deliveries

loans.name: Los Cerros Group

texts.es:
El Grupo los cerros está conformado por tres mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Ana Clemencia A. que desde hace cinco años tiene una pequeña fritangueria, restaurante popular nicaragüense. Ella comenzó con la venta de cosa de horno  y con el tiempo creo la fritangeria.

Las otras integrantes son Erika N. da clases de inglés y tiene una pequeña pulpería y Yessica Alejandra R. que elabora ropa infantil y costuras. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios y esperan verlo prosperar.
texts.en:
The Los Cerros Group consists of three hard-working and enterprising women. They are Ana Clemencia A. who for five years has had a small fritangueria, which is a popular Nicaraguan restaurant. She began by selling anything made in an oven and eventually created the fritangueria. The other members are Erika N. who teaches English and has a small grocery store. Yessica Alejandra R. makes children's clothing and dresses. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses and hope to see them flourish.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain basic grains, meat, fruits, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Edward Abisalom Obongo

texts.en:
Edward opened his retail shop 5 years ago and has since built it up to generate profits of 35000 KES a month.The types of items he sells in his shop include sodas, detergents, maize, rice, tea, and sugar.

He is married to Maureen Akinyi, who lives upcountry with his family. He sends money back home to Maureen and their 1 year old child. Edward moved to Nairobi in order to better support them.

This is Edward's 5th loan from KADET. He will use it to open another retail shop. He has been saving for a while and this loan will supplement his savings and make this new shop a reality.

One day Edward hopes to venture into the real estate business.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To open another shop.

loans.name: Ma. De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Ma. De los Ángeles A. E. vive solo con su hijo que es una persona con capacidades diferentes, ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa semi-nuva establecida desde hace 15 años. Y esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de más mercancía pero de juguetes ya que se acercan las fiestas de navidad y para tener en venta.
texts.en:
Ma. de los Angeles lives with her son and is a woman with many different abilities. For the past 15 years she has run her own business selling gently worn clothing. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of additional merchandise, particularly toys for Christmas since the holiday season is coming up.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, especially toys, to sell

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.en: Maria Gregoria is 59 years old and is a vendor. She has eight children, all of whom are fully grown and independent. She worked in a market for 15 years, running her own stall. She decided to sell her stall and, together with her husband, invested in the purchase of property to open a bigger store. Now she works from home and from her store, and can sell double the amount of produce. She serves lunch to many of the workers that work in her neighborhood. Maria will use her loan to buy more ingredients and meat to make better quality food and better profit.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and meat.

loans.name: Kagongi B.t Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: M. Mable is 31-years old and married with four children aged 6 – 11, all of whom are in primary school. M. cares for five dependants. She has operated a hotel and bar business, and she sells cooked food, beers, sodas and wines. She would like to expand her business and turn her bar into a depot. She hopes to see her children attain the best of education for self sustainability and a brighter future. Mable is requesting a loan to purchase more food stuffs so she can increase her stock and profits. She is the leader of her lending group and a very friendly and hard-working lady.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Danelia Carolina

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad, la joven Danelia M. ha sido emprendedora porque ha desarrollado su negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el departamento de Masaya donde ofrece ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y a la vez ofrece productos varios como aretes, pulseras, perfumes y pinturas de uñas.

El crédito que actualmente está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de los productos como lo es la ropa variada con el propósito de ofrecerla y de esta manera generar los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.

Espera continuar desarrollándose en este negocio y llegar a ser una gran comerciante y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Danelia M., 25, despite her young age, has developed into an entrepreneur with her clothing sales business located in Masaya department. She offers women's, men's, and children's clothing as well as earrings, bracelets, perfumes, and nail polish. The current financing she is requesting will be used to buy stock items in order to generate income to improve her quality of life. She hopes to continue to develop in this business and to become a big merchant meeting her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás tiene 23 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años empezó a dedicarse independientemente a las tareas agrícolas, siembra quinua y arveja. Las habilidades que ahora tiene son debido a que desde niño las aprendió de sus padres. Su trabajo es más intenso durante la época de la siembra y/o cosecha, pues desde muy temprano prepara sus tierras de cultivo, abonando y fertilizando sus plantaciones, además de cuidarlas de posibles plagas. Posteriormente, debe esperar pacientemente el momento de la 
Cosecha. Para el futuro, Tomás quiere extender sus terrenos de cultivo para aumentar su producción.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es un socio con larga trayectoria en su banco comunal, pues ha demostrado un trabajo constante y responsable. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Tomás is 23 years old, lives with his mother and his siblings in his parents' house. Two years ago, he independently decided to start farming quinua (a grain) and peas. He knew how to farm because had learned from his parents. His work is much harder during planting and harvesting seasons, but since he was very young he has been cultivating the land - fertilizing his plants and ridding them of possible pests. Previously, he has had to wait patiently for the harvest. In the future, however, Tomás wants to expand his farmland in order to increase production. This is his fourth loan from MFP. He has a long history as a member of his communal bank and has demonstrated that he is a consistent and responsible worker. The money he is seeking now will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer for the next time he plants his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Marittes

texts.en:
Marittes N. is a 40-year-old hardworking mother. She and her husband, Raul, who is a fisherman, are blessed with three beautiful daughters.

Marittes recently joined ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines, to be able to have access to a loan which she will use to start a food-selling business. Income she will then make will augment that of her husband and therefore they will be able to support the basic needs of her children, especially their education until they graduate from college.

Filipino people are fond of eating. In a day, they have three regular meals and two snacks in-between meals. This is actually true, especially for those people who live in the provinces and work hard the whole day like farmers and other laborers - just like the people in the village where Marittes and her family live.

Thus, Marittes thought that the business she planned would be appropriate to the needs of the people around her. Some of the food items she is going to cook and sell such as “bananaque” (bananas deep-fried and sweetened) will be directly sold house to house during snack-break while others will be sold in front of her house.

loans.use: To start a food-preparation and sales business

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred M. is an entrepreneur and married man with three school children. He runs a business of keeping dairy cows in Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells milk at wholesale and retail to customers for domestic and business consumption, such as in cafes and hotels. He has been in the business for six years and the business income enabled him to buy four more dairy cows and meet the daily needs of his family. He needs a loan of 1,200,000 TZS to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jeffers

texts.en:
Jeffers is a 36-year-old married man with one child. He has a motor bike, which he uses for his own transport, and he offers motorbike servicing to other people. He goes from one place to another within the city of Nairobi, servicing motorbikes. He has been doing this kind of trade for the last year. He stays in Zimmerman estate where operates his business. He is strategically placed because Zimmerman is a highly populated region and there is more need for motorcycle services.

Jeffers was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET, having had no previous borrowing history. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy spare parts for servicing motorbikes, and to buy nine other motorbikes so that he can fully venture in to the taxi/transport industry. He will employ other people to manage the motorbikes for him.

He hopes to open and operate a garage and own at least 10 motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Amilyn's Group

texts.en: Amilyn M. is from the village of Minanga Sur, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 27 years old and is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Amilyn is married and has two school-aged children. She is just starting a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Amilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Amilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita M. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old. Esterlita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa N., 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. 

She sells groceries at home for a gross income of about USD 20 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

Sa N. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Eufemia vive en Healeah, es una mujer activa que ayuda a su esposo con las siembras que cultiva, en tiempos libres trabaja de albañil para surtir los gastos de la siembra, doña Eufemia  recibe una pensión del seguro por largos años que laboro. Con la cual cubre sus gastos. En alimentación, así como gasto en su salud ya  que es diabetes. Para ella no es fácil ya que todo esta con precios alto. Mediante estos financiamientos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que es el medio flexible de pago, con este préstamo podrá reparar el muro en la parte de atrás de su casa que esta en mal estado ante que se caiga todo y gaste mas , para esto comprara, piedra, arena, cemento y poder hacer la mejora para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Eufemia lives in Healeah. She is very active and helps her husband sow the seeds for the crops that they cultivate. In her free time she works as a mason to supplement the costs of sowing their crops. Doña Eufemia receives a pension for her many years of labor, which she uses to pay her expenses. She is a diabetic and has specific nutritional needs. Being a diabetic is very difficult for her as the cost of treatment is very high. Through the loans she has received she has been able to make improvements to her house and spread out her payments over time. With this loan she will be able to repair the wall behind her house, which is in poor condition, before it falls and costs her even more money. With the loan she will purchase rock, sand and cement to make the repairs to the wall and improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rock, sand and cement to repair the wall behind her house, which is in disrepair

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Cirila es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el barrio acuchimay a las faldas del cerro del mismo nombre, Cirila vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la plaza mayor de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza por las noches y también en la puerta de discotecas.
Cirila necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, chicles.
Los sueños de Cirila es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Violeta village bank. She's single with two children, and lives in the Acuchimay neighborhood on the side of a hill of the same name. She sells sweets at night from a cart in the main plaza of the city of Ayacucho, and also outside discotheques. Cirila is seeking a loan of 2500 soles to invest in the purchase of cookies, candies, and gum. She dreams of her children becoming professionals, and of having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candies, and gum.

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Rosario A. R. tiene 56 años de edad es casada con el sr. Lorenzo Funez. su esposo se dedica a vender las tajaditas y chicharras que ella fabrica, las vende en pulperias y mercaditos cercanos a su vivienda, ademas se dedica a vender verduras y algo de abarroteria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroterias para surtir la pulperia, tambien desea comprar platanos verdes y chicharras.
su mayor sueño en estos momentos es que que su esposo se le mejore ya que tiene problemas de salud.
desde hace poco comenzo de nuevo con el negocio de pulperia ya que por motivos de poca venta hace varios meses atras la habia cerrado, pero ahora tiene toda la confianza que su negocio va a crecer y va a salir adelante con el.
texts.en:
Concepción Rosario Álvarez R., 56, is married to Lorenzo Funez who sells the fried banana chips and fried pork rinds that she makes to grocery stores and small markets near their home; she also sells vegetables and a few groceries. She will use the funds to buy groceries to stock her store; she also wants to buy green bananas and pork skins. Her greatest wish is that her husband recovers from his health problems. A short while ago she reopened her grocery store which she had closed a few months ago due to low sales. Now she’s confident that the business will grow and she will make progress with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 42 years old and is married with two children who are 4 and 8 years old.

Cecile owns a small shop where she sells a variety of goods which include cooking oil and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Cecile is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and this loan will allow her to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs for sale. With the sale of these foodstuffs, as they are highly demanded by a large number of her customers, she will hopefully earn more profits. This, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and enable her to continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To buy variety of goods to sell including foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Siguidiale  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Siguidialé 2 sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités au début de l’hivernage. Les spéculations sont l’arachide, le petit mil, le maïs, le sésame et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJITA M. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare d’arachide et de mil.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Siguidialé 2 are married women who average 43 years of age and four children.  They lives for the most part in polygamous families in Koba, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to organize their businesses better at the start of winter.  The crops are peanuts, pearl millet, corn, sesame, and beans.  The group members are on their third farm loan.  The past loans have been settled.  With this new loan, DJITA M. intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining one hectare of peanuts and millet.  After the harvests, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of women and men in and around the village of Nangola and in the city of Dioïla. The group members plan on making an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies and equipment and paying hired hands

loans.name: Verjie

texts.en:
Verjie D. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Verjie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Verjie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Verjie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Verjie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verjie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Verjie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Verjie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El señor Erick Antonio, es padre  de familia tiene dos hijos menores de edad.   El trabaja en su casa de habitación como sastre en la elaboración de pantalones y camisas, trabaja con la ayuda de dos familiares, su producción la vende en el mercado semanalmente, pues la mayoría de sus productos se producen por encargo. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora. Con el financiamiento espera invertir en la compra de tela, agujas, tijeras, botones y otros productos para la elaboración de pantalones y camisas. De esta manera tendrá un buen inventario de tela y comprar una sola vez a la semana, lo que le ahorraría mucho ya que al comprar por mayor el precio es más barato.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio is a family man with two young children. He works from home as a tailor, making trousers and shirts. He is helped by two relatives and he sells his output on the market every week, as most of the goods are made on request. He has always been a very hard working person. He plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fabric, needles, scissors, buttons and other products for the manufacture of trousers and shirts. This will give him a good stock of fabric and will enable him to buy just once a week and save money, since wholesale prices are lower.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene  2 hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende frutas y verduras a los hoteles; La socia escoge la mejor mercadería en frutas y verduras y las lleva a los diferentes hoteles y restaurantes, en los que ella tiene contrata, ella provee a estos establecimientos. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para su negocio.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para proveer a los hoteles y restaurantes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Guillermina is a small businesswoman who sells fruits and vegetables to the hotels. She selects the best produce and delivers it to different hotels and restaurants that have contracts with her. Guillermina acts as a supplier to these establishments. She needs operating capital for her business, so this loan she requested will be used to buy products to supply to these hotels and restaurants.

Guillermina appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables to supply to hotels and restaurants

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Burgos. She is 53 years old. Erlinda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics  and apparel products from AVON and Natasha Company in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saleema's Group

texts.en:
Saleema, with hand raised, lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, famous for its agriculture, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms in the area named 561-EB, a few kilometer outside the city, where she lives with her family. She has an embroidery business at home. She learned this art when she was very young from her mother and now makes good profits from it. She and her husband work hard to improve the financial condition of their family. Her husband's name is S. H. and he operates a grocery shop in the market where he sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, rice, and flour 

Saleema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk for his shop. The bulk items will help him to compete in the market and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk for grocery shop

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a father of three sons who are under 18. Malek started a small poultry farm five years ago; he raises chickens to be sold to poultry shops in the city of Nablus, where he lives.

Malek wants to expand his project to accommodate the growing size of the current farm. Malek has gained good experience from five years of taking care of his own farm and would like to invest this experience in a better and more modern farm. Malek came to FATEN for a $1,000 loan to improve his farm and build better coops.

In the picture, Malek stands in his farm surrounded by the chickens.

loans.use: To improve his poultry farm and build better chicken coops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. lives in the Naguru neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Victoria has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years, and works six days a week. Victoria sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Victoria has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of second-hand clothes.     

She also generates additional income through tailoring. The main business challenge(s) for Victoria include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university. Victoria lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Rafiqa's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 52-year-old lady and comes from Lahore, a historic city of Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its culture and is Pakistan’s second largest city. She lives there in a small home, with her husband and two children, in an area named Green Town. She moved here after her marriage. Both her children are sons and work in the factory for a small income. They are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of Rafiqa and her husband.

Rafiqa's husband is a vegetable vendor by profession. He operates his shop in the market. He sells fresh and seasonal vegetables to his good number of clients and generates income for the family. He has been involved in this business for many years. Rafiqa shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a small grocery shop at her home. She uses a room in her house as her grocery shop, where she sells items to her customers’ demands.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery shop business. With the loan she will buy groceries in bulk to sell in her grocery shop. She is hopeful that, after an investment, her business will grow and her income will be increased. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that this will take her business to a better position.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo, de 24 años, es un valeroso hombre soltero, tiene 2 hijos: Yero, de 5 y Alexis, de 3 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Este joven y responsable padre de familia, trabaja arduamente en sus terrenos agrícolas, su principal producción consta de plátanos y café. Los que según menciona, hace ya 2 años, que viene generándole buenos ingresos, pues sus cultivos en campañas agrícolas son los mejores de la zona, logro que consiguió a base de capacitaciones para conseguir un buen grano de café. Mientras que sus frutos de plátanos, le proporcionan estabilidad, ya que cada 15 días, después de su cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad. Por ello más adelante desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, en las que pueda aplicar todo lo que aprendió. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y espera seguir saliendo adelante junto a su banco comunal. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 20 sacos de abono orgánico, y 2 mil plantas de café, para hacer su vivero con los que renovará sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 24 years old.  He is a courageous single man who has two children: 5 year-old Yero and 3 year-old Alexis.  They live together in their own home in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).  This young and responsible father works hard on his land.  His main crops are bananas and coffee.  He mentions that they have been making a good profit for two years since his crops, during the agricultural seasons, are the best in the area.

With training, Ricardo has managed to achieve good coffee beans, while his bananas provide him with stability as he harvests them every 15 days and then sells them in the town's central market.  For this reason, in the future he would like to buy more land to which he can apply everything that he has learned.

This is Ricardo's second loan with MFP and he hopes to continue getting ahead in life together with his community bank.  He will use his loan to buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer and 2,000 coffee plants for his nursery.  He will use them to renew his plantation crops.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and 2,000 coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cotton, lace and slippers

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita B. is from the village of Nipaan. She is 51 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Cristita operates a business selling fish in the local community and a nearby town. 

Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rona  raises hogs. Rona has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rona is requesting her second loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for hog raising.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Maman Fely exerce son commerce dans la boucherie /poissonnerie au abord du marché plateau. Mariée,  mère de 3enfants, elle a commencée au marché sur un étalage à vendre des poulets à bouillir en détail il ya 10ans.

Avec le prêt passé, elle à réaliser des revenus qui lui ont permis de rembourser sans difficultés car elle avait renforcé son stock.

Le prochain prêt, va encore contribuer à l’amélioration de son stock, elle va acheté 2cartons de viande arrière, 2carton des tripes, 3cartons des cuisses des poulets, 3cartons des poule à bouillir, 2catons de tige de saucissons, 1cartons des ailes de poulets, 1cartons des ailes de dindes, 1catons de foie de bœufs, 1carton de pieds de porcs.
Avec tous ces produits, elle pourra vendre et épargner pour atteindre ses objectifs :
Continuer avec HOPE, apporter son aide  en assistant son mari pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Maman Fely carries out her business in the butcher's/fishmonger's shop on the side of the Plateau market. She is married and mother to three children and she began selling chickens for boiling on a retail basis on a stall in the market ten years ago.

With the previous loan she was able to build up her stock and thus made an income which allowed to repay the loan without any difficulty. 

The next loan will again contribute to building up her stock, as she is going to buy two cartons of backside meat, two cartons of tripe, three cartons of chicken thighs, three cartons of chicken for boiling, two cartons of sausage links, one carton of chicken wings, one carton of turkey wings, one carton of ox liver and one carton of pigs' feet.

She will be able to sell all these products and save enough money to achieve her objectives, which are to continue collaborating with HOPE and to help her husband cover the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: Purchase of cartons of chicken thighs, backside, pork, sausages and fish.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: El  Sr G.  labora como secretaria es acompañada tiene  dos persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción zinc, perlines bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para construir un porche en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. G. works as a secretary.  She lives with a partner and has 2 dependents.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL, and she is grateful for the opportunity that this institution is providing her.  With the funds from the loan she will buy construction materials such as metal roofing sheets, beams, cement blocks, cement, sand, steel, gravel, braces, wire and labor to add a porch to her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es:
La Señora. María Z. es socia del banco comunal Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan, su gente se dedica  a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en artesanías, cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable y cordial.

Doña María tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 7 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil y con el sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura,  siembra hortalizas y verduras las que vende y también son para su consumo. Cría animales como: cuyes, pollos y chanchos, los que vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su meta es ampliar su casa para tener un cuarto para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Z. is a member of the community bank of Tocte, and lives in a town of the same name in the parish of Jadan.  Most residents of the region raise farm animals or work in agriculture or artisanry.  The town has lovely landscapes and local people are amiable and courteous.

Maria is 38, married and has three children aged 13, 7 and 5; her first daughter and her second son study nearby. Her husband is a construction worker and through his own effort built the family's home.  Maria works in agriculture, planting vegetables for household consumption and sale. She also raises farm animals such as: cuyes (guinea pigs), chickens and pigs, which she sells in her community.   This is the sixth loan that Maria has requested, and she plans to use the credit to buy additional farm animals.  Among her goals is to expand her family's home to assure that her children have their own rooms.

loans.use: to buy domestic animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 68 years old and married with 7 children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, softdrinks etc. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de un asentamiento muy humilde de  la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para salir de la pobreza extrema que aqueja a gran parte del país. Se compremetieron a luchar hombro con hombro para lograr los objetivos propuestos  y trabajar conjuntamente  con actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Adolfina G. es un ejemplo de sacrificio, ella realiza servicios de manicura y pedicura, de manera ambulante, es decir, va a las casas de sus clientes, no posee un lugar fijo de trabajo por eso a veces le cuesta mucho, pues no puede cuidar todo el tiempo a su familia y atender su hogar, pero sabe que solo con sacrificios podría sacarlos adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito de Kiva para poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios para su trabajo de manicura y pedicura como esmaltes, alcoholes, lijas, tijeritas, alicates, etc.
texts.en:
The "Maria Auxiliadora" communal bank was created through the union of various neighbors from a humble settlement in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members are all humble people who created the group to be able to get out of the extreme poverty that afflicts a large portion of the country. They have all committed to fight side-by-side to meet their goals and to work together on activities that strengthen their partnership.

Adolfina G. is a great example of personal sacrifice. She is a traveling vendor who goes to her clients' houses to provide manicure and pedicure services. She doesn't have a fixed work location and for this reason her work is difficult for her. She can't spend the time she needs to take care of her family and maintain her household, but she knows that these sacrifices can help her family get ahead.

Adolfina is asking for a loan through Kiva to be able to purchase the materials she needs for her manicures and pedicures, such as nail polish, rubbing alcohol, nail files, scissors, nail clippers, etc.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure materials.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: El señor Saturnino es artesano y confecciona chalinas, también es empleado publico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de telas así podrá aumentar la producción de sus chalinas (scarfs). Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero y tiene un hijo. Saturnino es cliente de Impro desde el año  2006 y se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en:
Mr. Saturnino is an artisan who makes scarves (chalinas) and also works as a civil servant.  He is need of a loan to buy fabric to increase his scarf production.  He lives in a rented home in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  He is single and has a son.

Saturnino has been a member of IMPRO since 2006 and is very satisfied with the loans he has received.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make scarves (chalinas)

loans.name: Verónica Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Verónica es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por el sector de Lazareto en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente es amable y cordial.

La Señorita Verónica tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia, su mamá es comerciante de ropa y su papá es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi.

Nuestra socia al igual que su mamá es comerciante de ropa usada, tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad, laboran solo 2 días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, el resto de la semana trabaja en su casa prestando los servicios de lavado de ropa.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. El dinero de su crédito lo va invertir en la compra de ropa usada.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the communal bank “Corazón de María” (Mary’s Heart) and lives in the Lazarete area of the city of Cuenca which is the third most important city in the country: the cradle of sports stars and writers.  Its people are cordial and friendly.

Verónica is 24-years-old, single, and lives in her parent’s home that they own.  Her mother is a clothing seller and her father is a taxi driver.

Our member sells used clothing like her mother.  She has a stall in a city market.  They work only two days a week from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon.  The rest of the week they work in their house offering a laundry service.

This is the first loan she will do with the communal bank which she was invited to by her mother.  She will invest the money from her loan in buying used clothing.

Her goal is to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Nidia Encarnacion

texts.es:
Nidia Encarnacion tiene 43 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con la hija vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Nidia se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, yuca y maiz un poco de platano, en tierras propias. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener ingresos suficientes para educar a la hija.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la hija y el esposo.
texts.en:
Nidia Encarnación is 43 years old, married and living with her husband and daughter in Agua Clara which belongs to Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and are also merchants.

Nidia farms cocoa beans, manioc, corn and a little bit of bananas on her own land.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and her sales take place in the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

The loan will help her buy farming supplies.  The loan has helped her in such a way that her crop yield has increased.  She has faced challenges like illness among the laborers and infestations and crop illnesses.  

Her dream is to have enough income to educate her daughter.  In her free time she enjoys going out with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Na God The Gee Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Na God the Gee” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ibrahim. Ibrahim is age 25; he was born in Kenema city. Ibrahim is single with one child who is attending primary school. Ibrahim sells slippers/flip-flops for both men, women and children. He has been running this business for eight years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy dozens of slippers to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a hard-working 42-year-old businessman. He has been selling milk for the last eight years. He supplements his income from this venture by running a shop. Previously, he was selling groceries. He is married and blessed with four children who are in school. In the next five years, he wants to be a major distributor of milk. He wants a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a milk can, empty egg trays and milk.

loans.use: To buy a milk can, empty egg trays and milk

loans.name: Rusenyi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Benard is a 41-year-old married man living with six children in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house and help his children to attain higher levels of education.

Benard operates a retail shop, which he started six years ago with 200,000 shillings. Now it is worth 2,500,000 shillings! Hardships he's encountered are price fluctuations and increasing house rent. His dream is to become a wholesaler. Benard needs this loan to buy sugar and soap to sell. 

Out of the 13 group members, only ten took the loan and three had to guarantee their group members, as it is a group policy.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is 49 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "ban-ban" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of "ban-ban" to sell.

Lorlyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling "ban-ban" for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending and gasoline retailing.

Lorlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of "ban-ban" (reeds) to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Paola

texts.es:
La Señora Jenny es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive por una comunidad  que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy amables y conservan su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Jenny tiene 22 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas, una de 2 años de edad y otra de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Jenny es empleada domestica actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años y trabaja solo los días que le llaman. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y ganado.

Es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y chanchos para seguir en el negocio.
 
Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Jenny’s a member of the “Corazones de Turi” (Turi Hearts) communal bank.  She lives in a community that belongs to Turi Parish.  This parish is noted for being the city’s scenic overlook.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  They are very kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Jenny is 22 years old, married and has two daughters.  One is 2 years old and the other is 8 months old.  Her husband’s a bricklayer.  She does not have a house of her own; they live with her in-laws and they all share household expenses.

This is the second loan she’s had with the communal bank and she will use this new loan to buy chicks and piglets to continue in business.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chicks and piglets.

loans.name: Futuro Dos Punto Cero Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Futuro Dos Punto Cero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran negocios, venta de ropa y venta de abarrotes, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ciudad de Santiago. 
Nelly presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta color negro y su cabello es corto y de color rubio. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 15 años, en un puesto que ubica en ferias libres. Su horario laboral es durante las mañanas, dos veces a la semana y también los fines de semana. Cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, algunos de ellos los conserva desde sus inicios.
En la actualidad quiere incursionar en la venta de ropa nueva.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el persa, de ésta manera prosperar en su negocio. 
Nelly vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 30, 29, 17 y 13 años de edad, más una nieta de 7 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles educación de calidad a sus hijos y nieta, para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que ella a través de su trabajo es un aporte económico para su hogar.
Nelly está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que se conocen desde hace años, puesto que son vecinos entre ellos. Estas reuniones le han permitido realizarse personalmente.
Respecto a las capacitaciones le han servido para especializarse y  administrar su negocio de mejor manera. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Futuro Dos Punto Cero", ("Future 2.0").  It is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields; amongst them are businesses selling clothes and groceries among others.  They all come from the community of San Bernardo in the city of Santiago.

Nelly is the president of the Communal Bank, who is seated in the front row of the photo.  She is the second from the right, and she is wearing a black jacket.  Her hair is short and blonde.  She has been working selling second-hand clothes for the last 15 years, at a stand located in the open markets.  Her work schedule is mornings twice a week, and also the weekends.  She has many customers, some of whom she has kept since the beginning.  

She now wants to start moving into selling new clothes.  With the loan, she will buy new clothes.  Her goals are to have a permanent location in the bazaar, and in this way to prosper with her business.

Nelly lives with her husband and her four children aged 30, 29, 17 and 13, plus a 7-year-old granddaughter.  Her dreams are to provide her children and granddaughter with a quality education, so that they may have a better quality of life.  Her motivation is to continue with her business, as it is through her work that she is able to make a financial contribution to her household. 

Nelly is very happy and grateful for the loans and the services offered through Fondo Esperanza.  In addition, she feels very comfortable with her group at the Communal Bank, as she has known them for several years and has neighbors among them.  These meetings have allowed her to achieve self-fulfillment.  In regards to the training, it's helped her to specialize and to manage her business better.
