Even though he died three years ago, his mark on her life will last forever.

Claudia has already received one loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and since then, her business has generated more income to support her family. She was able to buy a plot of land and furniture for her home. Her family even has their own motorcycle. Claudia is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 COP to invest in the purchase of yarn for making hammocks, satchels, and handbags. To continue moving forward, her goal is to have her own house and her own business location for either a craft shop or a drugstore since she has previous experience and pharmacy training.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn for making hammocks, satchels, and handbags

loans.name: Sao Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sao Rorn S. is 29 years old. She is a villager who lives in Ta Non village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokea Moeuy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mrs. Sao Rorn S. is also silk weaver who is able to earn a small income to support her family's living costs. Although they try to work hard with these businesses they still earn to little income to support the family's costs of living. Thus, in order to increase income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Sao Rorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has a child who is just 5 years old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Akuavi Massan

texts.fr: A. est une femme très dynamique, depuis 3 ans déjà elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de tissus pour la confection de chemises, pantalons et autres vêtements. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes mais elle réalise de plus grandes recettes en vendant à des personnes âgées qui manifestent régulièrement le besoin. vu la demande élevée de sa clientèle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de Tissus. elle est mariée et réside dans le quartier de adidomé à lomé.
texts.en:
Ms. A. is a very energetic woman. Three years ago, she got started in the commerce of cloth for making shirts, pants, and other clothing. Her customer base includes anyone, but she makes the most from selling to older people, who demonstrate a regular need. Given the high demand from her customers, Ms. A. is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying cloth. She is married and resides in the Adidomé district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes G. is a 54-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and by buying and selling rice and charcoal.  She also has a boarding house and shops she rents to earn money.  Mercedes lives in Yulo Avenue, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000. 

Mercedes is now borrowing PHP 10,000 for additional working capital for her businesses.  This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Mercedes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

---------------------------------------------
About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La Señora Amalia dedicada al transporte de taxi trufi ella requiere el crédito para la compra de un motor y realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo con el que diariamente trabaja y el que le otorga ingresos diarios para alimentar a sus dos pequeños hijos, siendo ella mujer no se puso ninguna pared para realizar este trabajo, al contrario se siente orgullosa de ser mujer y realizar un trabajo considerado que es solo para hombres., tubo que pasar varia humillaciones y burlas muchas veces por sus mismos compañeros de trabajo, pero ella es fuerte y supo salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Amalia works as a taxi-trufi (collective taxi van) driver. She needs a loan to buy a new engine and pay for the maintenance of her vehicle which she uses daily. The money she earns goes towards food for her two small children. Being a female taxi-driver has never been a barrier for Amalia; on the contrary she is proud to be a woman in a job which is usually considered for men only. She had to get past all the put-downs and jokes of her male colleagues, but she is a strong woman and knew how to come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an engine and upgrade the interior of her taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou C., 51, is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works in construction, making US$3 each day.

Two of Nou C.’s children are bakers and one is a garment factory worker. Nou C. is asking for a loan of US$400 to invest in her children’s bakery.

loans.use: To invest in her children's bakery

loans.name: Rosaleen

texts.en:
Rosaleen F. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Rosaleen is married and has two children aged 12 and 7. To make a living, Rosaleen raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosaleen also manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Rosaleen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosaleen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosaleen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Viviane Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 38 ans très dynamique. Elle a 2 personnes à charge. Elle est une cliente fidèle de WAGES. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 3 crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de fournitures scolaires. La rentrée scolaire a commencé au Togo, elle veut accroître son revenu et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock de marchandises avec 10 cartons de cahiers de 300 pages, 5 cartons de cahier de 200 pages, 3 cartons de cahiers de 100 pages. Et divers autres articles scolaires.
texts.en: Afi is a very energetic 38-year old woman. She has two dependents. She is a loyal client of WAGES. She already obtained three loans from WAGES in the past and repaid all of them well. She makes a living by retailing school supplies. As the new school year in Togo has started, she would like to increase her revenues. Therefore she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to stock up with then boxes of 300-pages notebooks, five boxes of 200-pages notebooks, three boxes of 100-pages notebooks and other miscellaneous school supplies.

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Elarian

texts.en:
Elarian S. is a 41-year-old from Centro Norte, Culasi Antique, Philippines married to Emelio S.. The fruit of their sweetest love are their four children. Her eldest child is already 14 years old while the youngest is 6 years old and all of them are still studying. Ice cream vending is their primary source of  income; this is where they get money for their daily expenses. 

Since all of their children are studying, they must strive hard in order to survive and meet the basic needs of the family. They wake up early in the morning just to prepare the ice cream because after their breakfast her husband sells that ice cream in the nearby neighborhoods. As food vendors, they maintain the quality of their products so that they gain more customers because they say, customers are very important in business.

Aside from ice cream vending, Elarian also makes salted and coated peanuts and she sells them to their neighbors and distributes to some stores. 

Elarian has been an active member of ASHI Antique North Branch since 2005. She maintains 100%  rate in repayment, attendance and project. She has also accessed incentive loans of ASHI such as House Repair Loan and Educational Loan because of her good performance as a member.

Her biggest dream is to improve their production and to send their children to school until college. She wants their children to become professionals someday. They also wish that someday their business will improve so that they can help their relatives and neighbors by providing jobs for them.

For her next loan in ASHI, Elarian is planning to buy a tricycle (three-wheeled transport vehicle), so that their products will reach to other neighborhoods and municipalities especially since the fiesta in some neighborhoods in Culasi is approaching. 

During fiesta and summer days, ice cream sells quickly; that is why they want to take this opportunity. She needs Php 30,000 in order to realize these dreams and if this request is granted, it would be a great help to them in providing for the basic needs of the family.

loans.use: buying a "tricycle" to transport their ice cream

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Gloria has been running her own retail shop since two years.         

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase rice and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gloria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Gloria hopes to become an accountant.  Gloria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her improve her future prospects and living standard.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboang Del Norte. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Sialupe Humantanga,una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, la localidad está situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio y la reparte en algunos establecimientos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que estas bebidas son bastante consumidas en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores de su localidad tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos para seguir preparando Chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juana, 47, is married living with her husband and one of her children in the Sialupe Humantanga sector, a rural zone of Lambayeque, located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes “Chicha de Jora” to sell (a typical beverage of the country that has been made since ancient times based on a special type of corn flour).  She makes the beverage at home and sells it there and also in various establishments in the city of Lambayeque.  The business is well received because these beverages are consumed quite a bit in the area, especially during various celebrations and festivities.  Besides, local workers habitually consume chicha before starting work because of the belief that it provides energy and vigor.

Juana wants to expand the business buying more ingredients to continue to make Chicha.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that will allow her to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy Chicha making ingredients.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia vive en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. 
La señora, es comerciante, vende ropa, víveres y perfumes, que los distribuye en mercados, oficinas y amigos al crédito; ella  cobra cada día, a la semana y al mes, dependiendo del acuerdo con su cliente.
Es separada y tiene dos hijas, de 14 y 12 años.
El crédito será destinado, para capital de trabajo (compra de Víveres, Ropa, y perfumes), para aumentar su stock de mercadería y vender más producto.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podrá mejorar su capital de trabajo, y también sus ingresos.
texts.en: Patricia lives in the Villa de San Antonio zone below the city of La Paz. She is a merchant and sells clothing, supplies and perfumes, which she distributes in markets, offices and to friends on credit. She charges daily, weekly and monthly depending on the agreement with her customer. She is separated and has two daughters, ages 14 and 12. This loan will be used as working capital (the purchase of supplies, clothing and perfumes) to increase her stock of merchandise and sell more products. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Impro. With this loan, she will be able to improve her working capital and her income.

loans.use: She needs more capital to buy more clothing, supplies and perfumes to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad O. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba. She is 48 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing rice to sell. The main source of income for the business comes from selling of assorted crops from her own farm. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 1999, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe LOLO (3 mariés et 1veuve) ont en moyenne 26 ans, 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames, au quartier BABEMBA, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus   tel AFOU T.. 
AFOU T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  35  pièces de pagnes  wax.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lolo group (3 married women and one widow) average 26 years of age, with three children, and live mostly in monogamous families in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their sixth collaboration cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, their goal being to meet customer demand. The previous loans have been well repaid. This women’s group sells fabrics, as, for example, Afou T. does. 

Afou T. plans to use her loan to purchase 35 sets of traditional “pagnes wax” fabric. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso and in Bamako.
She resells the “pagnes wax” fabrics  at the Medine market in Sikasso and out of her home, for cash, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 95,000 West African francs, to be used towards everyday family expenses.
Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Duo Vicion De Fe Group

texts.es:
Duo Vision de Fe:Eulalia P.: tiene 33 años tiene 3 hijos pequeños y con el apoyo de su esposo mantiene su negocio ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para veve,como baberos, colchas,camisas pantaloncitos,etc tambien ella destribuye en el mercado de su localidad y a otros lugares sercanos, su credito lo nececita para comprar materia prima.para poder elavorar su productos y asi poder destribuirlos.
Elica Marleni: ella tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos actual mente ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos su credito lo nececita para comprar un poco mas de mas producto en cosmeticos ya que se aserca el dia del cariño y es cuando vende su producto asi incrementar su ganancia para sostenimiento de su familia
texts.en:
Duo Vision de Fe (Vision of Faith Duo)

Eulalia P. is 33 years old and has three small children. She has the support of her husband. Eulalia sells baby clothes such as bibs, blankets, shirts, pants, and other items. She also sells at the local market and other nearby places. Her loan will be used to buy merchandise so that she can increase her inventory for distribution.

Elica Marleni is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She currently sells cosmetics. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetic products since Valentine’s Day is approaching. The sales of her products increase during this time. Her earnings are used to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Sokea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Dei Kraham village, Takeo province, fourteen people have selected Mrs. T. S. to be a village bank president. All the members of this group loan  will use their portion in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. T. S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, not to sell, but to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sarom Moav, is a motorcycle taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. Although they try to work hard, they can only earn a small income. Mrs. T. S. would, therefore,  like to ask for a loan to buy some piglets to breed to start a new business. She is the mother of five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a member of the communal bank "Sarita" at FINCA Peru. She is 26 years old and has a three year-old son. She sells vegetables in the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho.  Business has been slow in January and February but is finally picking up this month. She will be using her loan of 2,000 PEN to purchase squash and limes to sell in the market. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and enjoys the educational sessions that they provide. She would like to continue saving and buy a house one day.

loans.use: to purchase squash and limes

loans.name: Ariana

texts.es: Ariana B. G. es una señora muy emprendedora que desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa usada afuera de su casa, para no descuidar a su hijo pequeño que necesita de su protección por la edad que tiene. Para que las ventas de su negocio se incrementen necesita comprar mercancía de temporada para que este verano tenga más ventas.
texts.en: Ariana B. G. is a very enterprising lady who, for more than one year, has been selling used clothes outside her house.  She does this so that she doesn't have to neglect her young son who needs her care because of his age.  In order to increase her sales, she needs to buy seasonal merchandise so that she makes more sales this summer.

loans.use: to stock her business with used clothes

loans.name: Gnim

texts.en:
Gnim H. has been in the farming business in the province of Kampong Cham for a long time. She has always cultivated rice on farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a recycling buyer.  He buys all kinds of old things in and around his village and sells them to wholesalers.

Gnim H. and her husband have three unmarried children, all of whom still live with them. Gnim H. and her family face a problem in their living conditions, so she is now in the process of building a new house, but her cash reserves are insufficient. To solve this problem, Gnim H. is asking for a Kiva loan to help build her house.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Aida Rosalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Aida B. D. R. tiene 30 años D. edad, es casada y vive en el Barrio Primero D. Marzo D. la Ciudad D. Coronel Oviedo.
Aida es una señora muy sacrificada, se dedica a la peluqueria que montó gracias a un préstamo que realizó en una etapa anterior a esta, ahora solicita este préstamo para comprar más insumos como shampoo, cremas D. enjuague, fijadores y otros tantos materiales para su stock, porque tiene muchos clientes.
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya en busca D. apoyo y está muy contenta porque la institución le haya podido ofrecer la posibilidad D. solicitar un crédito, D. esa forma podría mejorar el servicio a sus clientes y dar un mayor ingreso a su familia, ayudándole a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Aida Benites D. R. is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Primero D. Marzo neighborhood of the city of Coronel Oviedo.

She has sacrificed much, and dedicates herself to hairdressing.  She started out thanks to a loan maD. previous to this one, and now she requests this credit to buy more supplies such as shampoos, conditioners, hairspray and other supplies as she has many customers.

She came to Fundación Paraguaya seeking support, and is very happy because the institution has been able to offer her the opportunity to have access to a loan.  This would allow her to serve her customers better and proviD. more income for her family, which helps her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy supplies for her business such as shampoos, conditioners and hairspray.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman es un cliente de 37 años de edad, casado y  con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Guzman y su familia viven en la  zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en el caserío Virgen La Purisima . El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla Guzman  es la  crianza y  comercialización  de animales. Guzman se gana la vida desde hace 6  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, él suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Guzman aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Además cuenta con ingresos adicionales, producto de actividades relacionadas a la agricultura. 

Guzman solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, a Edpyme Alternativa, cuyo destino será la  compra de calaminas y viguetas para la construcción de un corral  de mejores condiciones que  el actual. Guzman invierte en esto porque sabe que  la crianza y venta  de animales es un negocio con un amplio mercado de comercialización, a pesar de la competencia.
texts.en:
Guzman is a client who is 37 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. Guzman and his family live in the rural area of the district of Lambayeque, in the Virgen La Purisima settlement. This is a small community with approximately 200 families. 

Guzman's business is raising and selling animals. For the past 6 years, Guzman has earned his living raising and selling small animals in pens located behind his home. He usually raises pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks. When the animals have reached a good stage of development, he offers them for sale to wholesale buyers who regularly visit the area where he lives. Guzman learned this business from his parents; that is to say, he knows this profession to perfection. He also has an additional source of income from work related to agriculture.

Guzman is requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will be used to buy corrugated metal sheets and joists to construct a pen that will provide better conditions than his current one. Guzman is making this investment because he knows that raising and selling animals is a business with broad market opportunities, in spite of the competition.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and beams to build a pen.

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
Maylin is now 26 years old and married with no children yet. Maylin is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 6,000 per month. 

Maylin is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional breeding pigs and pig feed. Maylin has been operating a hog-raising business for almost four years.

In the future, Maylin hopes to improve their piggery by raising more pigs in order to help her husband earn income for the sake of their future and to satisfy their daily basic needs. She believes that through their patience and strong determination, they can improve their source of income together with their status of living. They are thankful for the financial assistance of the Kiva lenders who help them in their business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Balcón Florido” cuenta con 8 integrantes. Clinda es la Presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. queso D. forma artesanal. La comunidad en donD. residen los integrantes D. esta Alcancía Comunal  es alejada y al menos 3 horas D. viaje en carretera sin pavimentación, por lo cual a lo mas 2 veces a la semana sacan sus productos a la provincia.  Clinda junto a sus socios se dedican a la ganadería desD. hace 20años. Su dedicación y esfuerzo le ha permitido adquirir un terreno y actualmente lo esta pagando con su trabajo. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra  D. insumos como: sal, cuajo (pastillas para cuajar el queso) y moldes para la fabricación del queso,  además Clinda adquirirá Alimento balanceado para sus  vacas. Clinda esta entusiasmada pues por festividades en su pueblo le permitirá aumentar sus  ventas. La Alcancía Comunal “Balcón Florido”  es leal al programa y agradecen la nueva oportunidad D. financiar su trabajo
texts.en:
The communal bank "Balcón Florido" has 8 members. Clinda is the President of the group, she is engaged in the manufacture and sale of artisanal cheese. The community where the members of this communal bank live is remote and at least 3 hours trip by unpaved road to the province, so they take their products there at most twice a week. Clinda, together with her partners, has been engaged in raising cattle for 20 years.  Her dedication and hard work has allowed her to acquire some land and it is now paying off with her work. 

The loan money will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as salt, rennet (tablets for curdling cheese) and molds for the manufacture of cheese, additionally Clinda will acquire balanced feed for her cows. Clinda is excited because festivities in her village will allow her to increase her sales. The communal bank "Balcón Florido" is loyal to the program and welcome the new opportunity to finance their work.

loans.use: to buy salt, rennet tablets for making cheese, and balanced food for the cows

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
Jose Alfredo tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con la hija vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos propios.

Le gusta ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Jose Alfredo, age 43, is married.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Agua Clara precinct in the Chillanes canton.

The Virgen Del Huayco Communal Bank is comprised of 14 members.  It is located in the Loma de Guacalgoto precinct, 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members of the communal bank devote themselves to growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell either flour or animals.

Jose grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo, and he sells at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

The loan will help him to buy supplies for his crops. The loan has helped him in such a way that has increased his crop production. He has faced challenges like insect infestation and plant diseases.

His dream is to buy his own land.

He likes to be a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Book  Khol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Book khol est crée le 31 mai 2007. Il est composé de de femmes toutes habitant le même quartier et qui mènent la même activité. La dame en médaillon (membre du groupe) était absente lors de la prise de la photo.

Mariama debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main est la responsable. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de jus de fruits et de glaces au niveau de l'école du quartier. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de financer son activité par l'achat de produits et d'intrants pour la vente.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa progéniture et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Book Khol was created on May 31, 2007. It is composed of women who all live in the same area and who have the same work. The lady in the photo insert (group member) was absent when the photo was taken. 

Mariam (standing at the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells fruit juices and ice at the district's school. 

Her new loan will enable her to finance her business by the purchase of products and ingredients to be sold. Her goal is to help support her children and to boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials ("monkey bread", hibiscus flowers), sugar, and ingredients for juices; and water and plastic pouches.

loans.name: Marilin

texts.es:
Marilin es una joven madre de 24 años de edad. Ella vive en casa propia junto a su novio e hijo en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Marilin se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchi-pollo y salchi-papas, estos son pequeños platos de comida hechos a base de hotdog picado y mezclado con pollo o con papa. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio y atiende a una clientela ya establecida, los fines de semana.

Marilin tiene muchos deseos de superación y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra de insumos para realizar sus platos de comida.

Marilin es una clienta conocida para nuestra entidad, este sería su segundo crédito y el primero lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Marilin is a young 24 year old mother. She lives in her own house with her boyfriend and son in a small rural community that belongs to the district of Tambogrande – Piura.

Marilin works making and selling chicken and sausage and fries and sausage. These small dishes are made with cut up hotdogs mixed with chicken or with french fries. She does this activity in her own house and serves her already established clientele on weekends.

Marilin really wants to get ahead and that is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in buying ingredients to make her food.  

Marilin is a client who is known to our agency. This would be her second loan and she paid off the first one on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 years old while the youngest is only 8. Isabel's husband works as a fisherman.

Isabel runs a tailoring business. She makes school uniforms and provides general alteration & tailoring services to the people in her commmunity. Isabel earns about 7000 PHP per month doing her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase needles, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials. Isabel hopes to earn better and be able to pay her children's school fees and buy school materials.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Manos Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Manos del Sur”, está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran negocios de todo tipo, venta de antigüedades, costuras, productos congelados, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Julieta integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al medio del grupo, vistiendo un sweater color verde y una bufanda del mismo color, además su cabello está suelto. 
Ella se dedica a entregar el servicio técnico en reparación de celulares, desde hace 5 años. Julieta estudió técnico en informática, lo que le facilita en su trabajo, por los conocimientos que tiene. Ella trabaja en un local que arrienda de lunes a domingo en un horario de 9ºº a 5ºº de la tarde. Los repuestos para celulares los compra en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito Julieta comprará repuestos para celulares. 
Sus metas son expandirse en su negocio.
Ella vive junto a su hija de 10 años de edad y sus sueños son terminar sus estudios universitarios en la carrera de psicopedagogía. 
Julieta está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo esperanza, ya que es una ayuda integral que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y aprender nuevas estrategias en administración. 
Comenta que la relación con las demás socias le ha permitido conocer nuevas experiencias y grandes personas. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Manos del Sur” (Hands of the South) consists of 19 entrepreneurs who engage in different fields, which includes all types of business such as selling antiques, sewing, selling frozen foods, and other trades. All of them live in the city of Puerto Montt.

Julieta is a member of the Communal Bank. In the photograph, she is standing in the middle of the group. Julieta is wearing a green sweater and a scarf of the same color. She is wearing her hair down. Julieta has been providing mobile phone repair services as a technician for five years. She studied information technology, which has helped her perform her job due to the knowledge she acquired. Julieta works from a rented shop Monday to Sunday, between the hours of 9am and 5pm. The mobile phone parts that she uses are purchased from a distributor in the city of Santiago. With this loan, Julieta will buy mobile phone parts.

She lives with her 10-year-old daughter and her dreams include finishing her university studies toward a degree in psychology. Julieta is very pleased with and grateful for the services that Fondo Esperanza has provided. This vital source of support has allowed her to invest in her business and learn new strategies for managing it. She says that her relationship with the other members has allowed her to gain new experiences and meet great people.

Puerto Montt is a city in southern Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. The attractions of Puerto Montt include its beautiful green landscapes. The beaches are rarely visited. It is also known for its cuisine, particularly its reputation for seafood and shellfish, and its handicrafts. Puerto Montt is also the gateway to the Grand Isle of Chiloé, which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone parts.

loans.name: Jenny Luz

texts.es: L. Sra. Jenny es casada, tiene 03 hijos D. 15,12 y 9 años D. edad, L. Sra. Jenny se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) en su pequeña tienda, ya lleva en el negocio más D. 4 años; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento D. su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra en condiciones precarias; su sueños es contar con una bodega granD., y tener todas sus comodidades en su vivienda para elL. y sus hijas. L. Sra. Jenny está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Jenny is married and she has 3 children aged 15, 12 and 9. She has been running a small grocery store (selling rice, sugar, oil, etcetera) for more than 4 years. As she is currently living in precarious conditions, she has requested a loan to invested it in the improvement of her house. She dreams of owning a big shop and of equipping her house with all basic comforts for herself and her children. Jenny is deeply grateful for the loan she has been granted.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Myrian; tiene 27 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia se encuentra embazada, ella espera a sus primer hijo o hija aún no sabe el sexo de sus bebe; La socia se dedica  al negocio de mueblería la socia tiene su taller de confección de mueble, ella es la que diseña los muebles y ve los acabados finales como el tipo de tela a usar y los cojines, los aplique que le darán a los diferentes muebles de sala y comedor, la socia requiere el crédito en esta ocasión para invertir en la compra de materiales para su taller, ella está pensando en la compra de telas, botones, broches, cierres, apliques y otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Myrian belongs to the “Comuzone II” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Myrian is 27 years old, married, and currently pregnant. She is awaiting her first child, although she doesn't know the sex of the baby yet. Myrian is a furniture maker and has her own furniture-making shop. She designs the furniture and sees it through until it's finished, even selecting the type of cloth to use and the cushions, including the decorative applications for the different types of living room and dining room furniture.  

Myrian needs the loan on this occasion to invest in the purchase of materials for her workshop. She is thinking of buying cloth, buttons, fasteners, zippers, decorations, and other items.

loans.use: buy materials for her furniture-making shop, including cloth, buttons, fasteners, zippers,decorations, and other things.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 42 años, es conviviente con su pareja con quien es madre de seis hijos de 24, 22, 20, 17, 15 y 7 años, que aun viven con ella y aun cuatro dependen de ella para su alimentación y educación, ella tiene una casa propia donde vive junto a sus seis hijos y su pareja. Lucila tiene como trabajo el de la venta de comida, sal por las tardes a la vereda de su casa donde con la ayuda de sus hijos coloca una mesa larga, la parrilla, el asador y las bancas, después atiza su carbón e inicia con la jornada de venta de asados, Juanes, tacacho, etc, como es de buena sazón tiene muchos clientes que le son fieles por que siempre les da con una pequeña yapa, lleva trabajando ya un año y esta contenta por que le esta yendo bien y así puede generar ganancias en su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que por las mañana puede utilizar su tiempo para otras actividades que también son fundamentales para sus ingresos, tiene clientes todos los días ya que esta ubicada en un lugar muy accesible para el publico, espera mas adelante poner su restaurante y así empezar a ser mas formal. Este será el préstamo numero 13 con la institución MFP, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que es mucha ayuda para lo que ha logrado hasta ahora, tiene un lindo grupo y como es una socia antigua tiene un respaldo grande de las demás socias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, alquilara un local para que empiece a vender menú y así empezar a ser parte de la formalidad a parte de empezar a generar mas ingresos durante el día.
texts.en:
42-year-old Lucila lives with her partner.  She has six children aged 24, 22, 20, 17, 15 and 7 who still live with her.  Four of them are still dependent on her for their food and education.  Lucila owns her own home where she lives together with her six children and her partner.

Lucila sells meals for a living.  She goes out to the sidewalk outside her house every afternoon and, with the help of her children, she sets up a large table, grill, spit and benches.  She stokes her charcoal and starts her day selling roasted meats, 'juanes' (a Peruvian chicken dish), 'tacacho' (a Peruvian dish of fried plantain mashed with pork rind), etc.  As her food is very tasty, she has a lot of customers who are loyal to her business and she always gives them a little extra.

Lucila has been working in this business for a year and she is happy because it is doing well and she is able to make money for her household.  What she enjoys about her work is the fact that she can use her time in the mornings to carry out other activities which are also essential for her income and she has customers every day as her business is located in a place which is easily accessible to the public.  She hopes, in the future, to set up a restaurant and thereby start running a more formal business.

This will be Lucila's 13th loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to continue working together as it is very helpful to her and has helped her to achieve all she has up to now.  She has a lovely loan group and, as she is a long-standing member, she has a lot of support from her fellow group members.  Lucila will use the 2,500 soles she has requested to rent premises so that she can start selling meals and working more formally, as well as making more income during the day.

loans.use: to rent premises for her business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
This is Esmeralda, 61, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nolasco, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, Esmeralda is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Esmeralda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esmeralda dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to get married and have their family some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana Elizabeth tiene veintiún años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar plantas de cacao, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, veneno para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para venderlos a un buen precio.

El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en el mejoramiento de los cultivos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son  la competencia,  plagas y enfermedades.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música en especial los vallenatos.
texts.en:
Diana Elizabeth is 21 years old.  She is single and has three children.  She lives with her children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

Diana is a member of the Cevallos community bank which is located in San Francisco, in San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish, in Ventanas.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cacao.

Diana is a farmer who grows cacao. She makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan.  She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, liquids, and insecticides to maintain her cacao crops and sell them at a good price.

This loan will help Diana to invest in improving her crops.  The challenges that she faces are competition, pests and diseases.

In her free time, Diana enjoys listening to music, especially Los Vallenatos.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, liquids, and insecticides to maintain her crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 46, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines.  She and her husband, Ramon, have four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Elizabeth operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicures, pedicures, etc. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Elizabeth dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional supply of products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Sengeli B Group

texts.en:
Roselyne joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roselyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Roselyne was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Roselyne will invest in a cow and build a house.

Roselyne is the facilitator of Sengeli B group. Roselyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sengeli B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roselyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a hard working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional cloth and other materials for her dress making business. Molly has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from her sari-sari store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Molly dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз житель района Хамадони. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У них пятеро детей. Навруз занимается торговлей. Он продает яблоки. Этим видом бизнеса занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Navruz is a residents of Hamadoni region. He is 32 years old, married and has five children. Navruz sells apples. He has been in this business for four years. He is taking out the loan to buy fruits.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: David Jesus

texts.es:
David es un joven soltero de 19 años , se desempeña como DJ presta servicios de animación musical y canciones seleccionadas. David es un joven responsable, honesto y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, empezó en el negocio hace 2 años y gana un promedio de S/. 290,00 soles semanales, el joven tiene el deseo de progresar y superarse para que en un futuro llegue a ser un profesional . Con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva de S/. 2500 soles , lo invertirá en la compra de equipos musicales.

Uno de sus sueños es formar su propia empresa de animación musical y artes musicales para que llegue  a ser un empresario exitoso, su asesor cree que es un buen  cliente y que podrá pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
David vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
David is 19 years old and is single. He works as a DJ, providing a musical entertainment and song-selection service. David is a responsible, honest and very hardworking young man who really wants to get ahead in life. He started working in this field two years ago and earns an average of 290 PEN per week. He wants to progress and better himself so that he can become a professional in the future. He will invest Kiva’s loan of 2500 PEN in the purchase of musical equipment.

One of his dreams is to set up his own musical entertainment and musical arts company and eventually become a successful businessman. His advisor considers him a good client and believes he will be able to pay the instalments on his loan punctually.

David lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007), its grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peru's traditional national drink, pisco. This region, with its hot, arid climate, is where David lives and runs his business.

loans.use: to buy musical equipment.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Augusta; Continua con su negocio propio y la administracion de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia compra la por mayor y vende al por mayor productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos, la socia desea ampliar su negocio e incrementar productos de libreria para la epoca escolar, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de panetones, vinos, champan y los productos de primera necesidad para implementar sus tienda.
texts.en: Augusta is continuing in her own business and managing her grocery store.  She buys primary use products, like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and noodles in bulk and wants to expand her business and increase her stock of bookstore items for the school year.  She wants to invest the money from this loan in pants, wines, champagne, and primary need products to stock her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 29-year-old businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is a single mother of one child.  She has been running a second hand clothes retail stall for the last three years and she is doing great. 

This will be Monica's second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers.

loans.name: Rosas De Visalaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VISALAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por catorce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dominga es la Presidenta, ella se encuentra en el centro del grupo vestida con manta cafe y esta contando el dinero. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: pesca, venta de carne, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, venta de carnes, venta de queso y papa, venta de cerveza, venta de carne y verdura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dominga es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de carne, da a conocer que este negocio lo esta trabajando desde sus 18 años siendo 40 años de trabajo en esta área, emprende este negocio mediante el incentivo de su amiga Candelaria.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de carne) mismo que comprará de las ferias provinciales del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido, todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rosas de Visalaya is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer. Pertaining to the regional office of Copacabana, it comprises fourteen members and is managed by a Board of Directors. Dominga is the Board President. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, such as fishing, selling meat, selling fish, a neighborhood store, selling cheese and potatoes, selling beer, and selling meat and vegetables. The loan they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs.

Dominga is one of its members and says this is the first time she joins Pro Mujer. She has joined through a promotor of the institution, who went to her house to invite her. She currently has a business, a store where she sells meat. She says that she has been working in this business ever since she was eighteen, so she has been working in the same field for forty years. She started her own business by her friend Candelaria's incentive.

The loan she is now taking out is to expand her business. She will purchase meat from the regional markets in the department of La Paz and later make daily sales by order. This way of working allows her to generate resources in order to support her family as much as possible, for she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the trainings regarding health and loans.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Anihouvi Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ANIHOUVI II est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouavi Diane Regina(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Akouavi Diane Regina a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Akouavi Diane Regina n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Akouavi Diane Regina exerce comme activité la pédicure-manucure de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Akouavi Diane Regina s’approvisionne en vernis dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Akouavi Diane Regina ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ANIHOUVI II, sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des vernis à ongles.

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen V. is 36 years old. During his whole life he has been in restaurant business. 15 years he has been a waiter in some of the most popular summer resorts on northern sea coast of Bulgaria – Golden Sands, Albena, Balchik, Kranevo.

Two years ago he has decided to open his own coffee shop in his native home town Silistra. When he first found the place where his coffee shop now is it was seedy and untended. Rumen has put much efforts to make this place one of the most popular and cosy cafes in the town.

Now the café is overcrowded and Rumen has many regular and devoted clients. Since the coffee shop is very small and has just 6 tables Rumen is considered to set up an outside space which will be very useful during summer months. And that is the initiative for which he applies for this 1000 USD loan.

loans.use: to set up an outside space of the cafe

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married with one child who attends school. She also takes care of the children of his deceased sister and brother. She is educated up to level 12. She started her clothing business in 2001 with funds from a merry-go-round. The business has been able to generate income for her family’s needs.

Given the loan she wants to buy goods in wholesale and sell them at retail. The loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
José Antonio is a married father of five and is very active and enterprising. Three years ago, after realizing that his salary could not cover his family's expenses and the education of his children, he decided to start his own business, selling jerseys and T-shirts. Thanks to the help of his friends he was able to get his start, and little by little with a lot of effort and hard work he was able to acquire more customers and sell his products to sports teams, schools and offices.

Currently, José needs a loan of $250 to buy merchandise with the hope of offering his customers a wider variety and covering his growing demand. He plans to repay the loan within three to six months. José is counting on your support to help grow his business and keep his family moving forward. He is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor José Antonio es casado y tiene cinco hijos, él es un hombre muy activo y emprendedor, al darse cuenta que con su salario no podía solventar todo los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace tres años, vendiendo camisetas deportivas y de vestir, gracias a la ayuda de uno de sus amigos pudo iniciar y poco a poco con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y surte a equipos deportivos, escuelas e instituciones.

En estos momentos, José necesita de un préstamo por $250 dólares para la comprar de mercancía, con la que espera poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y de esta cubrir su demanda, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. José cuenta con tu apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia, y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy jerseys and T-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto is single and works as a artistic sign maker. Since he was in school he had a passion for drawing, and his teachers always asked to make posters for school events. Roberto started his job two years ago when a teacher of his recommended him for a job, and then he started taking on more and more clients and places to work. With this job, Roberto helps to his parents with family expenses.

Roberto is requesting for a loan of $100 to purchase materials needed to make his signs. He does not ask for payment before he finishes the job, and he has a lot of work at the moment. He plans to repay this loan in 3 months. He appreciates your support.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Roberto es un hombre soltero que se dedica a la elaboración de rótulos, desde la secundaría él tenía pasión por el dibujo y sus maestros siempre lo empleaban para realizar los dibujos en la escuela para días festivos. Roberto empezó con su oficio hace doce años cuando un maestro lo recomendó para hacer un trabajo y empezó a realizar este tipo de trabajo en algunos negocios de la localidad y eso le ha ido sirviendo de referencia para obtener más clientes. Con su trabajo Roberto ayuda a cubrir los gastos en su hogar.

Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 100 para comprar materiales para poder elaborar sus rótulos, ya que el no pide anticipos por los trabajos que realiza y ahora esta teniendo muchos contratos, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en 3 meses. Él te agradece mucho por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase art supplies

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in Tsévié, Mr. Komlan A. gave up his studies in secondary school due to lack of means and launched himself in the sale of CDs, cassettes, and DVDs. Single and without children, he takes care of one little brother and his mother. Very skilled in the management of his business, he repaid his two first loans without default. Now he requests a new loan of $850 which will resupply his shop with new videos and DVDs. Through this he intends to boost his sales to best improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Komlan a arrêté ses études au niveau secondaire par manque de moyen et s’est lancé dans la vente des cassettes et de disque CD Vidéo. Célibataire sans enfant, il a à sa charge un petit frère et sa mère. Très doué dans la gestion de ses affaires, il a su bien rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans incident. A présent, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $850 qui servira à ravitailler sa boutique en nouveaux CD et cassettes vidéo. Par ceci il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of CDs/cassettes/DVDs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
This woman is married with three school-aged children (one in primary school and two in secondary school). From a young age, Patricia has fought to earn a living in different activities.

At the beginning, she had a small grocery store in her home. Later, she dedicated herself to the artesian manufacturing of mattresses in her home which she and her husband sold in the street, but the loading and transport of the mattresses became very difficult and sales were not good. Six months ago, her husband gained employment as a driver and decided to open a modest food establishment which is maintained completely by Patricia.

The business consists of a small table, six plastic chairs, and a small artesian-made stove.

Thanks to her efforts the business has been growing gradually, to the degree of improving the infrastructure of the small dining room and hiring two workers who help in the kitchen and attend to clients.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Spanish (Original) Esta señora es casada, tiene un total de tres hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar, los cuales estudian dos en secundaria y uno en primaria. Desde muy joven, doña Patricia ha luchado por ganarse la vida en diferentes actividades.

Al principio tuvo una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, más tarde se dedicó a la elaboración artesanal de colchones, los cuales elaboraba en su casa de habitación y su esposo se dedicaba junto a ella de la venta de forma ambulante, pero cada vez más la carga familiar se hacía más difícil y las ventas no eran muy buenas. Desde hace poco más de 6 años, su esposo consiguió empleo como conductor particular y deciden poner un modesto puesto de comida, el cual era atendido completamente por doña Patricia.

El negocio contaba con una mesita y seis sillas plásticas, además de un pequeño fogón elaborado artesanalmente. Gracias al esfuerzo realizado el negocio ha venido creciendo paulatinamente, al grado de realizar mejoras en la infraestructura del pequeño comedor y actualmente cuenta con dos trabajadores que le ayudan en la cocina y en la atención al cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains for the production of foodstuffs sold daily

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María's husband just loved the "hojarascas" (a kind of dessert) and therefore Luz María started to search for recipes so she could make them for him. Nevertheless he and the neighbors liked the ones she made so much so somebody suggested she should sell this kind of products as her seasoning was excellent, and that is how she got started offering them to friends, and little by little the business grew and now she is selling "hojarascas" to the stores in her neighborhood.

During winter this kind of dessert becomes more popular and therefore Luz María is asking for a loan of $750 which she plans to repay in 6 months. The funds will be used to buy material in order to meet the demand as orders have grown and she is now a wholesaler. With your support doña Luz María can start selling bigger quantities of her products and also help her family prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Al esposo de Luz María le gustaban mucho las hojarascas y por lo tanto Luz María comenzó a buscar las recetas para poder hacérselas a su esposo, sin embargo ya que comenzó a elaborarlas le gustaron mucho y a sus vecinos también fue por ahí que a una persona se le ocurrió decirle que iba a ser buena idea que ella vendiera este tipo de productos porque tenía muy buen sazón. Y fue como comenzó a ofrecerle a sus amistades y después se fue pasando la voz. Actualmente ya surte hojarascas a tiendas que están por su casa.

Sin embargo por ser temporada de invierno este postre se antoja más y es por esto que Luz María está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y el dinero le servirá para poder comprar más material y así hacer los pedidos que tiene puesto que son ya por mayoreo. Con tu ayuda Luz María podrá comenzar a vender en mayores cantidades sus productos y también podrá ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase material to prepare products for wholesale.

loans.name: Iim

texts.en: Iim is a 28-year-old woman. She has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice, and many other things. She can earn US$ 44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Iim is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to buy more goods for her shop. Her husband, A., has no fixed job, so she has to work hard for the family's needs and her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her little general store

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
S. Umeda is 26 years old and the mother of one daughter whom she is raising alone.

Together with her partner Umeda runs a jewelry store, a business which she has been in for the past 12 years. As a teenager, Umeda always wanted to become a jeweller and today, she is is producing earrings, rings of silver and gold. As a rule Umeda purchases the input materials from the population. 

Umeda is requested a loan of USD1000 to purchase material for making jewellery, such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Umeda is a repeat client of IMON with a positive credit history, and she is confident that she will be able to pay back this loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones and reagents required for producing jewellery.

loans.name: Timotea Sinforosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Timotea is a widow with two children to take care of. She currently finds herself in a difficult position because she has to be both father and mother to her children and also dedicate herself to her job selling clothing in the market La Terminal in the district of Leon. Before beginning this business, Mrs. Timotea sold clothes as a sort of traveling saleswoman, on the streets. However, the revenue from this system of selling was insufficient to support her family. Confronting this problem, she decided to collect more quantities of clothing to resell in the market. She seeks out the cheapest or most affordable venders of clothing in various places in her district so as to make a better profit when reselling them. To date, she has finished 14 loans with CEPRODEL which has helped her to collect enough money to purchase clothing from her venders and furthermore, in ways, has improved the quality of life in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Timotea es una madre viuda y con dos hijos que mantener. Actualmente atraviesa una difícil situación por el hecho de que hace el papel de padre y madre y además se dedica a la venta de ropa en lo interno del mercado la Terminal en el Departamento de León.

Antes de iniciar este negocio en su local la señora Timotea se dedicaba a realizar las ventas en la calle al aire libre pero sus bajos ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Partiendo de este problema, decide muy firmemente comenzar a adquirir mas cantidades de ropa para comercializarla por lo que realiza cotizaciones en varios lugares para seleccionar al proveedor que mas barato le venda la ropa.

Hoy en dia ha realizado un total de 14 créditos en CEPRODEL que le han sido de sumo apoyo ya que ha adquirido la ropa de sus proveedores y además ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico is an inter-city public service driver (trufi) in La Paz El Alto. This job is his only source of income which he uses to support his two children and wife. He lives in the Zona Villa Tejada Tringular in La Paz city. The loan he is requesting will be used to to purchase a car, enabling him to work and support his family. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation which has been carried approves his application

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Federico es transportista de servicio público (trufi) inter ciudad La Paz El Alto, dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposas. Su domicilio es en la Zona Villa Tejada Triangular de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado para el movimiento de su movilidad (compra de motor), el préstamo le permitirá seguir trabajando y sostener a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Federico.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A CAR

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Xuyến, 40 years old, has been with the TYM Fund for 10 years. She lives with her husband and their three teen children. Her husband farms and she goes out to buy scrap material to recycle. It is a hard work but that earns her a steady income and she can fulfills the weekly repayments comfortably. The daily income is 6-7USD. The family’s economy gradually improves. Their children have a little more for their education. She would like to apply for a loan of 575USD to buy more material.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Xuyến, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đến nay đã được 10 năm. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 người con đều trong độ tuổi vị thành niên. Chồng ở nhà làm ruộng còn chị Xuyến chọn công việc thu mua phế liệu. Công việc vất vả nhưng giúp chị có thu nhập thường xuyên để trang trải những chi phí trong nhà và trả tiền tuần. Trung bình mỗi ngày chị thu nhập khoảng 6-7USD. Kinh tế gia đình dần được nâng lên, các con chị Xuyến cũng được học hành đầy đủ hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 575USD để có thể mua được nhiều hàng hơn. Chị hy vọng sẽ tăng thêm được thu nhập hàng ngày của mình.

loans.use: Buy wasted material

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Nely M.. She is married, and has five children aged between 7 and 23. In 1992, Nely established her crop wholesaling business. Nely requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and groundnuts. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This serves as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Ashurmo.

texts.ru:
Ashurmo Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. She lives with her family and is 43 years old. She has a husband and has 3 children. She is a housewife and is engaged in animal sales, like many other citizens in the countryside. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She wants to buy another bull to fatten up and to sell it closer to Autumn for more money. This will give her additional and her family additional earnings. To buy this bull she needs to receive a loan and that is why she has asked Kiva for help. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.
