Зиеева Ашурмо жительница города Вахдат . Живет со своей семьей. Ей 43 года , она замужем и имеет троих детей. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством , как и многие жители сельской местности. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Хочет купить еще одного бычка , для того , чтобы откормить и ближе к осени продать по более высокой цене. Это даст дополнительный заработок для нее и ее семьи. Для того , чтобы купить бычка ей нужно получить кредит и поэтому рна обратилась к нам. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Sayaad Agha Ali

texts.en:
S. Agha is a shopkeeper. He has a retail shop. He works together with his brother. Now he wants to open another shop for himself to work alone and start a new business. He has a good number of customers in the area where his shop is located. He would love to grow his business more.

Agha has requested an individual loan in the amount of 50000 Afghani (US$ 1075) with a term of 18 months. He wants to complete his stock and buy more goods to retail like baskets, shampoo, chocolate. He is sure that he can further his business and repay the loan.

Agha is very happy with this loan. He hopes that he will become stronger in his business to become one of the great business dealers in the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy more goods to retail

loans.name: Ndeye Marème

texts.fr: ndeye marème M. est une jeune femme mariée qui vit chez sa mère au quartier grand thiès .pour améliorer ses revenus elle s'est lancé dans le secteur avicole depuis plus d'un an .c'est dans le but de renforcer son activité qu'elle solicite cette somme  pour acheter des poussins .
texts.en:
Ndeye Marème M. is a young, married woman who lives with her mother in Grand Thiès neighborhood. To improve her income she has been doing business in the poultry sector for more than a year. In order to strengthen her business she is seeking this loan to buy chicks.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks for poultry business

loans.name: Nory

texts.es:
Nory es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.

Nory es soltera y tiene 23 años, Nory es la mayor de 7 hermanos y vive con sus padres a quienes apoya en el sustento del hogar. Nory vende hoja de coca al por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el paradero de Huatatas que se encuentra a la salida de la ciudad de Ayacucho a otros distritos, su producto lo compra en el mercado Nery García actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, en algunas oportunidades dependiendo de la demanda de su producto viaja a las ferias.

Nory necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hoja de coca. Nory sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener un puesto de venta adecuado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nory is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank which means “Let’s Grow” in Quechua.

Nory is single and is 23 years old. Nory is the oldest of 7 siblings and lives with her parents who she supports in paying household expenses. Nory sells coca leaves wholesale and retail as a traveling salesperson in the Huatatas area, which is at Ayacucho’s exit to other districts. She buys her product in the. Nery García market, an activity she carries out with her mother’s help and sometimes travels to agricultural fairs depending upon demand.

Nory needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves. Nory dreams of expanding her business, having an good quality market stand and that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nory needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn S. is a 49-year-old farmer growing rice in Dorn Sok Village. She earns around US$2 per day. She is married to Mr. Ngin Khoun, 43, who is a fisherman. Yorn has five children, one of whom is married and does not live at home. The other four live at home, and two of them help with fishing, and the other two are in school. To improve the family's living condition, Yorn needs a loan of US$1100 to purchase wood for building a suitable house for her family.

loans.use: Yorn would like to purchase wood for building a house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Shahnaz Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is 43 years old and a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her first two sons are mechanics and run a motor workshop. Her younger son works in a factory. Her daughter memorizes the holy book Quran-e-Pak. Shahnaz baji has a decorative embroidery business. She does this work to give her daughter a good future. She is very much attached to her daughter because her sons are settled in their own works. Shahnaz baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local thee-wheeled motor vehicle). She is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her sons' motor workshop.

She is a group leader of a few more women in her locality. Noor Fatima baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw and Sumera baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repair tools for motor workshop

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. es cocinera profesional habiendo aprendido este oficio desde muy jovencita y hoy en día se dedica a este elaborando diferentes tipos de alimentos los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo.

Todos los días ella elabora los platillos y los vende a sus clientes que le visitan y según dichos clientes, ella es una excelente cocinera en su sector.

La razón por la cual la señora Rosa ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is a professional chef who learned her trade when she was very young. Today she devotes her time to making many different types of food, which she sells out of her home in the town of Somotillo. Every day Rosa prepares and sells dishes to the customers that drop by. According to those customers, for their section of the city, Rosa is an excellent cook. The reason Rosa has come to Ceprodel is to request a loan that would permit her to buy ingredients for the preparation of food. It is important to stress that this loan will be of great benefit and she will be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Channy Sorm, 30, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have one young son. Besides their son, his parents are living with them.

Chea has been driving a motor taxi for 16 years, a skill he learned by himself. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. In the future, the couple wants to create their own business selling fruit. Now Chea is requesting his first loan of $700 which he will use to build a fence around his house and to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To build a fence and to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Dzifa G. est une jeune femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de poissons et de produits divers au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroître la taille de son commerce et lui permettra de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Dzifa G. is a young woman of 50 years of age, married and the mother of 5 children. She is a reseller of fish and assorted products in the market place at Avetounou, a village located about 100 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. This loan will enable her to increase the size of her business and to better respond to the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Ighalo

texts.en:
Ighalo O. is 35 years old and married with four children. He repairs and sells second-hand refrigerators. The demand for his second-hand fridges is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

He hopes for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more second-hand fridges to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand fridges to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda R. is a 55 year old mother of three. She works very hard to save money for her daughters’ education. However, only her eldest daughter graduated from college and landed a job. Her second daughter marriaged early and has kids, while her youngest daughter stops her studies when she's in primary school. Her husband is a fishpond caretaker. She acquired her knowledge in making Chinese steamed buns when Angeline, her eldest daughter, introduced the procedures. She was able to improve the cooking recipes to meet her customers varied taste; the business has been extremely successful. She applied for this loan to buy ingredients such as bread, flour, refined sugar, brown sugar, yeast, plastics, pork, and potatoes. She needs to buy those stocks in bulk in order to get a cheaper price. She hopes that she will be able to cope up her orders and make a stall out of her income. She hopes to build a working place and employ some of her neighbor in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingedients for Chinese steamed buns (siopao).

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина успешно погасила свой предыдущий займ и собирается немного освежить ассортимент своих товаров. После последнего займа Тахмина взяла в аренду магазинчик сделанный из пластика и алюминия и теперь может смело оставлять товар ночью на хранение тут же в магазине, а также летом условия для торговли стали лучше, так погода в Таджикистане очень жаркая. Тахмина подает новую заявку на КИВА и собирается погасить новый займ в течении 2 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tahmina successfully paid off her previous loan and plans to slightly refresh her product assortment. After her last loan Tahmina rented a small store made from plastic and aluminum and now can safely leave her products at night in the store, and in the summer too the sales conditions became better as the weather in Tajikistan is very hot. Tahmina has put in a new application on KIVA and plans to pay back the current loan over 2 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab I. is 30-years-old, divorced, and has a 10-year-old child.   She also cares for two additional dependents. 

Zainab  has owned a small general store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Nia njema  group loan. Zainab works eight hours a day and makes a monthly profit of $30.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock . She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items, to add her current stock.

loans.name: Josue Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio C. L. de 22 años de edad Reside en Cojutepeque, junto a su padre y su esposa, la cual se dedica a la cosmetología. El tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de celular y reparación de estos mismos. José Antonio solicita un préstamo con el fin de aumentar los productos que comercializa, debido a que desea ampliar su negocio con nuevos artículos como cuadernos y ropa. El desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que espera brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
José Antonio C. L., 22, lives in Cojutepeque with his father and his wife who is a cosmetologist. He has a business selling parts and repair for cell phones. José Antonio is requesting a loan with the goal of adding to the products that he sells, wishing to increase his business with new items such as notebooks and clothing. He wants to be able to improve his business, in order to provide a better life style to his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with new items

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing a very succulent ground nut

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. A. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Norma sells beauty products from Avon, Esika and Unique. She also sells sewing materials and makes and sells beaded jewelry.

Norma has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years and used her first loan to purchase sewing materials and fabrics. Norma will use this loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles to expand her line of products for sale. She plans to purchase gift items such as soaps, hair elastics and some clothing items.

Norma is 63 and lives with her husband, her mother and her niece's 7-year-old child, whom she is raising. Norma has five of her own children, all of whom have moved out of the home. Norma must spend a lot of her time and money caring for her husband, who was incapacitated following a stroke. She has had less time lately to sew and make her jewelry products as a result. Norma has been happy working with Manuela Ramos and feels that she has been well supported by the organization. She is also pleased to have a lot of savings through Manuela Ramos’s mandatory savings program.

loans.use: To purchase gift items for sale, such as soaps, clothing and hair elastics

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa M. sells secondhand clothing at Abura. She is a widow and has seven dependants. She is responsible for taking care of the children. Adwoa received a junior high school education. She has been selling secondhand clothing since 1999. Her loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothing for resale. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothing for resale

loans.name: Seata

texts.en:
Seata T.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau Fou 4. She is married and has five school-age children. Seata has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

Seata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Seata has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Seata is now requesting a new loan of 1250 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Seata plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. (0)

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr: Diariatou S. a 38 ans, est mariée avec 7 enfants en charge. Elle fait du petit commerce de poissons secs, arachide et divers légumes. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diariatou S. is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling dried fish, peanuts and various vegetables. She hopes to build up her business to better contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dried fish, peanuts and vegetables

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora Anita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 50 años y es madre de 07 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella.

Anita, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. Sus principales clientes choferes y moradores. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 8:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos desvicerados, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Anita, se siente muy bien y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Jukudu

texts.en:
Jukudu R. is currently in the business of selling products at a salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more hair materials to sell. Jukudu is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is an administrator. She has two children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase cold drinks and soft drinks to sell in the salon shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more hair materials  to sell

loans.name: Marizela

texts.es:
Marizela tiene 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo y sus tres hijos, por los cuales trabaja arduamente y son su razón de vivir. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, actividad que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. En todos estos años ha ganado experiencia en el comercio, realizándolo con mucha alegría, ya que el trabajo se le hace muy digno y también muy rentable, pues tiene buenos clientes, los cuales son muy fieles a su puesto debido a que ella los atiende con una sonrisa en el rostro. La parte difícil de su negocio radica en el clima, ya que en verano el calor es insoportable y el invierno muy crudo, pero felizmente Marizela ha sabido sobrellevar estos inconvenientes, saliendo adelante por el bien de su familia. Además de ser muy carismática con los clientes también es muy querida por sus compañeros en el mercado, ya que sus bromas y gran corazón hacen de ella una buena y amistosa compañera. Para el futuro quiere tener un negocio más surtido y más grande para así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es su primer crédito individual en MFP y cuando trabajó en bancos comunales siempre fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos y piensa seguir siéndolo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita implementará su puesto con más mercadería para lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marizela is 32 years old, and lives in her own house next to her husband and their 3 children, for whom she works hard and they are her reason for living. For 8 years, she has been selling vegetables, an activity that has become her principal source of income. Every year, she has gained experience in trade, doing it happily, since the work gives her dignity, and is also very profitable. She has good customers, who are very faithful to her place, due to that she serves them with a smile on her face. The difficult part of her business is the climate, since in summer the heat is unbearable and in the winter it is very harsh. But luckily, Marizela knows how to endure these inconveniences, getting ahead for the wellbeing of her family.

Besides being very charismatic with the customers, she is also beloved by her colleagues in the market, since her jokes and big heart make her a good and friendly colleague. For the future, she wants to have a bigger and better stocked business,so that she is able to improve the quality of her family's life.

This is her first individual loan with MFP and when she worked in community banks, she was always very punctual with all of the payments and she thinks she will continue doing so. With the money she is requesting now, she will set up her place with more merchandise in order to attain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Digna

texts.en: Digna tills her 1-hectare rice field with patience. She is 46 years old and has been married for 24 years to her husband Cristituto. They have 2 children, the elder of whom is 17 years old. Like other farmers, she thinks that adequate funding is needed to ensure a good harvest. In 2008, she became a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said that even now, she still experiences the goodness the MFI brought to her life. Digna is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 8,000. This loan will go to farm products and payment for the laborers who helped at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farming products and pay laborers

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es un hombre de 47 años, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos, con los que vive, junto a su esposa en su casa propia.

Por muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra: papa, olluco, oca y cebada en chacras de  tierras comunales de su pueblo, con la ayuda de su esposa. Pero adicionalmente, hace unos años, viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de papas en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad, los días miércoles de preferencia, ya que ese día bajan todos los agricultores a la ciudad con sus productos, por ello es muy concurrida. 
Desde que se dedica a este negocio siente que su economía es mucho más dinámica, ahora Teófilo no solo espera sus cosechas, sino que también compra de sus vecinos para revenderlas a otros precios en el mercado.
Teófilo se siente un padre feliz por lo que hace,  y a la vez está contento porque sus hijos no pasan carencias económicas.  Si sigue trabajando de este modo piensa alquilar un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad para cuando sus hijos crezcan y mejore su calidad de vida.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo viene trabajando con mucha responsabilidad y más aun como secretario de su banco  comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra y venta de papas, así como para adquirir fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 47 years old and lives in his own home. He is married and the father of 4 children.

For many years he has been engaged in agriculture, growing crops such as potatoes, ulluco, oca, and barley in the community fields of his town. His wife helps him with this work. In addition, he has spent a number of years buying and selling potatoes at the city wholesale market. Teófilo prefers to go to market on Wednesdays since that is the day when all the local farmers arrive with their produce, thereby generating a lot of activity.

Since becoming a potato trader, Teófilo feels his financial situation has received a tremendous boost. Not only can he rely on his crops, he can also buy his neighbors’ harvests to resell at a higher price in the market. As a father, Teófilo is very pleased with what he has achieved. He is glad that his children do not have to experience financial difficulties. If he continues working in this manner, he will be able to rent a vending post at the city market so that his children can grow and improve their quality of life.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. During his time with the Communal Bank, Teófilo has demonstrated great responsibility through his work as the group secretary. The money he requested will be used to buy potatoes to sell, as well as chemical fertilizers for his own crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional potatoes to sell & fertilizers for his own crops

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia BRIGIDA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y es padre y madre para sus tres hijos. El mayor tiene veinte años y estudia para ser técnico electricista en el Instituto Superior “Senati” del Cusco. Los menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Nuestra socia tiene su restaurante llamado “Nuevo Horizonte” donde prepara desayuno , almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica a la enseñanza. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, para la alimentación, mensualidad del colegio de sus hijas y para aumentar el capital del negocio.       
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the “Hatun Soncco” communal bank. The name of the communal bank comes from the Quechua language: "Hatun" means "big" and "Soncco" means "heart," so that the name translates to "Big Heart." Brigida is 44 years old and a single mother, serving as both father and mother to her three children. The eldest is 20 years old and is currently studying to be an electrical technician at the Senati Institute of Higher Learning in Cusco. The younger children are still in school. They live in the Imperial City of Cusco. Brigida divides her time between her work in the home and her business selling food. She operates a restaurant called “Nuevo Horizonte” [New Horizon], where she offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has carried out this work for several years, and it has gone very well for her, thanks to all of the effort and dedication she puts into it. She is a determined and entrepreneurial mother, and she is strongly focused on her children's education. She currently needs a loan for education, nutrition, school fees for her daughters, and to increase the capital available for her business. Brigida expresses her appreciation for the opportunity provided to her in this manner, and she has committed herself to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding food sales by preparing more meals during the Christmas holidays

loans.name: Margarita Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Margarita Esperanza P. S.  es de 24 años de edad, casada vive con su esposo y tiene un hijo ella reside en el lugar conocido como Paraje Pacoc, del Cantón Xantún, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala C.A. actualmente ella se dedica prestando sus servicios como Maestra de Educación Primaria según su necesidad ella se acerco a las instalaciones de la Asociación ASDIR para poder adquirir un préstamo debido a sus ingresos que no son suficientes ella desea obtener una computadora portátil así poder mejorar y facilitar su trabajo así poder dar un mejor servicio en su área de trabajo, y su comunidad mejorando a un más sus ingresos mensuales para obtener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita Esperanza P. S. is 24 years old and married. She and her husband have one child. They live in the place known as Paraje Pacoc in the district of Xantún, which is part of the town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Central America.

Margarita currently serves as an elementary school teacher. She has approached Asociación ASDIR to obtain a loan because she does not have sufficient income to purchase a laptop computer. This will help improve and facilitate her work, enable her to provide better service at her job and to her community, and allow her to increase her monthly income for a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda T. is 44 years old and manages a small rice field in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  She has one child who is 26 years old who also helps her run her farm. She has been tilling the farm for 15 years now.  

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to ensure the quality growth of her crop. She hopes that with her loan she will obtain maximum harvest in her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Hormiguitas” esta representado por la señora Maria Isabel y se encuentra a la conclusión D. su tercer ciclo, toma la determinación D. hacer un intervalo antes D. iniciar su siguiente ciclo después D. agruparse nuevamente las clientes antiguas como nuevas deciden volver a conformar el banco comunal con el mismo nombre “Hormiguitas”  y por sus antecedentes deciD. mantener la antigüedad como también la categorización para las clientes antiguas. Los socios tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. celulares en tiendas establecidas, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. ropa americana en las ferias D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, elaboración D. tejidos D. lana, confecciona polleras y faldas para su comercialización y la promoción D. cosméticos D. diferentes líneas. Como se pueD. advertir, los clientes D. este banco comunal se dedican al comercio en diferentes rubros, los cinco rubros ya detallados tienen mucha competencia en el mercado, pero a la vez también cuentan con mucha demanda. El crédito lo utilizaran para invertir e incrementar su capital en sus diferentes negocios ya que para ser competitivos y poder responder a la demanda tienen que estar bien surtidos y así en el futuro ver sus diferentes negocios consolidados y totalmente rentables. Las clientes que son antiguas tienen un buen comportamiento, están consideradas como uno D. los mejores bancos comunales por su puntualidad, responsabilidad y cumplimiento en la realización D. sus pagos en los anteriores ciclos y también se pudo advertir que tuvieron el cuidado en la selección D. las nuevas integrantes del banco para que continúen con esa imagen que tienen, además los clientes no demuestran antecedentes negativos en las consultas realizadas.
texts.en:
The “Hormiguitas” Communal Bank is led by Sra. Maria Isabel and has completed its third loan cycle. They are determined to take a break before starting their next loan cycle. This group is a mix of long-time clients and new ones. The more experienced members decided to keep the same name of their previous group (“Hormiguitas”) as a way of maintaining their history. All of the members have different businesses such as selling mobile phones from established storefronts, grocery sales, selling American clothing at the fairs in Santa Cruz, weaving crafts maD. of wool, manufacturing skirts for retail, and promoting cosmetics of various lines. Other members of this Communal Bank have businesses in different fields. They all experience competition in the marketplace, but they also have high demand for their products and services.

This loan will be used to increase the capital for their different business so that they can be more competitive and meet the demand by being well-stocked. In the future, they hope to see their different businesses fully established and completely profitable. The members are experienced clients who have a good disposition. They are considered to be one of the best Communal Banks because of their punctuality, responsibility, and thoroughness in completing their payments in previous loan cycles. They also took great care in selecting new members to the group so that they could maintain their good image. Also, the members do not display any negativity when conducting their meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. For the past two years, she has been running a shop, where she sells cereals, maize and beans. With this 30,000 KES loan, she plans to purchase beans and cereals. She hopes to open a wholesale cereals shop someday. Esther describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase beans and cereals

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La Sra. Ubaldina vive en la localidad de brecha 7 Platanillo, ubicado en el municipio de la guardia, su actividad principal es la venta de pan de trigo en su propio domicilio, su esposo hace unos meses fue encontrado muerto y fue un golpe fuerte para toda la familia superar la muerte del Padre y esposo por lo tanto quedo como única responsable de llevar adelante su hogar, tiene tres hijos todavía a su cargo los cuales estan en edad escolar, por lo tanto tiene que trabajar en su propio domicilio para así ayudar a sus hijos que también trabajan para apoyar a su madre, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Ubaldina es ver a sus hijos profesionales, es una persona responsables y trabajadora. Con el dinero del credito comprara harina de trigo por mayor y otros productos para la elaboracion del sus ricos panes.

La Sra. Ubaldina esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ubaldina lives in the neighborhood of Brecha de Platanillo, located in the town of La Guardia. She sells wheat bread out of her home. A few months ago her husband was found dead. The loss to the family of their father and husband was a stunning blow. Ubaldina was left alone to maintain her home and support the three school-age children who help her. One of her wishes is to see her children become professionals.

Ubaldina is a responsible and hardworking person. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy wheat flour in bulk and other products for making her delicious breads. She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour in bulk & other ingredients

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree S. is a 24-year-old single parent to her two children aged two and four years old. She faces the challenge of raising her children alone and provides them with the basic things they need every day. 

Since this is the case, Desiree wants to have a stable source of income. With low educational attainment, she believes that the only way she can attain this is by growing her own business since she cannot get employed in any government or private office. 

Fortunately, she heard about ASHI and the services it offers to poor women. After she was recognized as an official member of the institution just recently, she requested a loan to start up a fish-selling business. 

She expects that the profit from this business that is just getting started will be small. However, it would be of great help to Desiree and her children. Someday she wishes that, through Kiva and ASHI, she will be able to request for a much larger loan in order to achieve her vision of a grown business.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati P. is 45 and married with 4 children (ages 5 - 12).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Vasati has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vasati needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Vasati joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Vasati's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.
http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
EL SR. FLORENCIO F., TIENE 63 AÑOS, ESTÁ CASADO Y TIENE 3 HIJOS YA ADULTOS. ÉL SE CARACTERIZA POR SER MUY TRABAJADOR Y EMPRENDEDOR, Y ES ASÍ COMO ÉL Y SUS COMPAÑEROS DENOMINARON SU GRUPO "LOS EMPRENDEDORES I", FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES, QUIENES ELIGIERON AL SR. FLORENCIO F. COMO PRESIDENTE D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA.
HACE ONCE AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CALZADO EN UN MERCADO, DOND. PUDO ADQUIRIR UN PUESTO PARA TRABAJAR. 
AL PERDER SU TRABAJO, INCURSIONA EN EL NEGOCIO D. LA PREPARACIÓN D. ALIMENTOS Y APERTURA UN CHIFA AL PASO, EL CUAL ATIEND. POR LAS NOCHES.
GRACIAS A ESTOS NEGOCIOS HA PODIDO BRINDARLE EDUCACIÓN Y PROFESIÓN A SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ TECHAR SU CASITA, PARA LO CUAL ESTA ESFORZANDOSE MUCHO MAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. CALZADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU STOCK.
texts.en:
63-year old Sr. Florencio F. is married and has three adult children. He is known for being very hardworking and enterprising--that's why he and his colleagues call their group "The Resourceful Ones". There are ten of them in the group. Sr. Florencio F. was chosen to be president of the board of directors. For eleven years ago he has run a stall selling shoes in the market, but then he lost his job and started a business preparing food. He opened a Chinese restaurant in the street which he runs at night. Thanks to these businesses he has been able to proviD. his children with an education and jobs. His next goal is to put a new roof on his house so he is working hard to get this done. The loan will be used to buy shoes to increase his supply.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Nanso Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Shalo S. is a focused 32-year-old happily married man. He has six children, with only four going to school on the grounds of his modest earnings.

S. has subsisted on a low-earning fishing and retailing business for the last two years in his area of Nanso, Buziika, and Lugazi. He mostly sells fish, sugar, salt, paraffin, soap and oil. In a month he excitedly says he makes more than 300,000 shillings and is looking forward to making even more with the acquisition of this loan. Behind the excitement however, he knows he has responsibility that he owes to his children, especially those not at school.

With no previous business experience, S., to all intents and purposes, got started in his business on a low-key note with persuasion from his brother who was also inclined towards doing business. From then on he did not rest on his laurels as he knew he had to work hard to see success within his grasp. With this determination, his business turned a new leaf. The benefactors are his first two children: he managed to provide for their education.

With this loan, S. is optimistic that his businesses will see a new lease of life as he intends to buy fishing nets and additional retail stock. He also wants to fully educate all his children.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and additional retail stock

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: La señora Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora, con 46 años de edad, desde joven ha trabajado para sobresalir adelante con su familia, ya que es de poco recursos económicos y con lo que gana de salario como conserje es apenas para la canasta básica, procreo cinco hijos, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan para lograr las mejora a su pequeña casa, el trabaja como jardinero su salario es bajo, pero es fijo. Con el crédito anterior logro levantar un pequeño muro para reguardar mas su propiedad, con este financiamiento comenzara hacer las paredes de concreto, comprara los materiales necesario  para llevar a cabo la construcción y poder terminarla a largo plazo ya que todo esta en altos precios. Y tiene que levantar la casa toda de concreto, así como hacer divisiones, embaldosar, ya que es de tierra para una mejor higiene y gozar de un un techo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old and a very hard-working mother. Since she was young she has worked to be successful to benefit her family, which has few financial resources. The salary she earns as a custodian is barely enough for her family's basic grocery needs; she has five children. She and her husband struggle to improve their small house; he works as a gardener and receives a low salary, but it is a steady job. With her last loan, Teresa was able to build a small wall to shelter her property. With this loan, she will begin to build concrete walls by buying the materials needed to complete the construction and to be able to finish it in the long term, since the prices are high right now. She needs to build the entire house from concrete, divide the rooms, and lay down tile. The house is made of earth, and these improvements will make conditions more hygienic.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for concrete walls such as rocks, sand, and cement

loans.name: Ma. Gertrudes

texts.en: Ma. Gertrudes B. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Capinyahan, Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by engaging in a general store, pig fattening, and an ambulatory business of ready-to-wear clothes and dry goods. Her 51-year-old husband, Nestor, is a government employee. They have three children who are between 11 and 22 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Ma. Gertrudes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her three businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 40,000 from her business activities. Ma. Gertrudes is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and ambulatory business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 10,000 as her 11th loan, which she intends to use on her general store. Ma. Gertrudes is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es:
la sra. Miriams Ildilcia C. O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacioon la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "LOS GEMELOS".
tambien vende ropa, calzado, articulos de plastico para la cocina.
con los ingresos que le genera este negocio contribuye a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y juntos sacan adelante a su famlia pues tienen dos hijos que cursan la secundaria, uno de los retos como padres de familia es heredarles una preparacion universitaria a sus hijos si Dios a si lo permite.
Han mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia.
con las ganancias piensan hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O. sells basic goods and groceries in her store, called "Los Gemelos". It is located in a room in her house. She also sells clothing, footwear, and plastic tupperware. With the income she earns from her business, Miriams helps her husband pay household expenses and together they support their family. They have 2 children who are in secondary school. As parents, they face the challenge of preparing their children to go to college, God willing. They have improved their family's quality of life, and with the rest of their earnings they hope to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, butter, blouses, soccer shoes, toilet paper, beans, tortillas, salt, coffee, and cookies.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique was born in 1986. She is married with one child who is 3 years old and one dependant. Monique's husband helps her so that they give good service to their customers. Monique sells various products such as rice, sugar, salt, and so on. This business is profitable as her community needs foodstuffs from her shop. Monique has four years of experience in this business. Her hours are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day, except for one day in the week.

Monique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more products. This expansion will help Monique to attract more customers which will be one way of earning more profit.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is to use the loan funds to finish construction of his house and also to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

Richard is a 36-year-old man with two children aged 7 and 12 years. He lives in his own house and has a dream of educating his children and also acquiring more land.

Richard is a carpenter, a business he has done for fourteen years. He first did crafts then went into timber. At the moment, he is sharing the carpentry shop with others but he hopes to have his own soon.

loans.use: To finish construction of his house and to purchase timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly C. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old and married with 7 children. Most of her children go to school. To make a living, Shirly farms rice and has been doing so for over 8 years. She also grows hogs as an extra source of income.  Shirly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now requests her second loan, for 8000 PHP, to purchase fertilizer and livestock feed.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and livestock feed.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio san Francisco de la cuidad de Caacupé.
Son mujeres muy trabajadoras, muchas de ellas cabezas de familia.
Las Señoras están muy agradecidas a la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias al crédito y a las constantes capacitaciones que reciben de la institución, aprendieron a ahorrar, pueden hacer crecer su negocio, y logran así mejorar su calidad de vida, y la de su familia.
Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo número 16, poseen una antigüedad de  5 a 6 años aproximadamente. 
La elaboración y venta de chipas es otras de las actividades muy comunes de muchas familias de la zona de Caacupé, así la señora la Victorina se dedica también a la fabricación y venta de chipas. 
Esta es una actividad que ella practicaba con su familia desde muy joven y actualmente es la actividad que mantiene a su familia ya su marido y también la ayuda para esta actividad. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de almidón, grasa, queso,  y otros ingredientes que utiliza  para la elaboración de chipas.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the neighborhood of San Francisco in the city of Caacupé. They are hardworking women, many of them the heads of their families. They are very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya because, thanks to the loan and the constant training that they receive from this institution, they have learned to save money and are able to grow their business. This helps them achieve a better quality of life for themselves and their families. The members have already finished their 16th cycle; they've been around for about 5 or 6 years. The production and sale of chips is a common activity among many of the families in the Caacupé zone. Victoria makes and sells chips. This is an activity that she has practiced with her family since she was very young and it's currently the activity that maintains her family and husband, who also helps in the business. She's requesting this loan to buy starch, grease, cheese, and other ingredients that she uses to make chips.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese and starch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios P.'s main source of income comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in her community. She is 51 years old, widowed and has six grown-up children. She is from the village of District II. Remedios has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials needed for the service. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide a manicure service

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey is 38 years old and is married with six children who are between 2 and 13 years old.

Jean Marie Vianey is well-known in the business of selling hens and he has been in this business for about two years. His business hours are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Jean Marie Vianey needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional hens for sale so as to increase his market and his income. With the additional profits, he will build a poultry enclosure in which to keep his hens.

If successful, Jean Marie Vianey really hopes that he will keep reinvesting with the goal of creating some other sources of income which, in turn, will allow his business to be stable.

loans.use: To purchase additional hens to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria C. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Victoria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. 
In 2007, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital and for mortgage land redemption. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anthony Kiprotich

texts.en:
Anthony Kiprotich K. is 33 years old. He is married and the father of one child, age six years old. He is a businessman who sells clothes and cushions on a busy street in Silibwet, a town on the outskirts of Narok town. He has been running this business for the past year.

Anthony learned about KADET from friends who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to increase his stock by buying more clothes and cushions to sell. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent a permanent shop for his clothing sales and he plans to open another shop to create employment for other people. In the future, Antony wants to own a house and run his shop on his own premises. Anthony says he is hardworking and only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing scrap materials in bulk

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia F. is a married woman who lives in the village of Babajuba Junob in Dumaguete City in the province of Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a business distributing herbal products. Her husband, Rogelio, who is 57 years old, works as an X-ray Technologist to earn his living, and he also helps in his wife's business activities.

Antonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5500 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use in purchasing herbal products to sell. She plans to continue saving up for the future education of her niece and nephew.

Antonia F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase herbal products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Yuri is one of the entrepreneurial people from the group Esperanza y Fe (Hope and Faith) 1, 2 & 3. She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is building her house.  She plans to continue enjoying her profession of teaching, especially teaching children.

Yuri is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 12 years, starting out with her own savings. She operates a small school where she teaches kids early in their childhood.  Yuri plans to use this loan to invest in her business, buying books, chairs, notebooks, and other school supplies. She will use the profits to invest in the school by building a new classroom.  Her dream is to have her own school with more courses. 

This Esperanza associate started the program for the benefits to her business.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally.  Many of the group's Dominican clients recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

Yuri's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and unreliable running water that is not safe to drink.

loans.use: To buy books, chairs, notebooks, and other school supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Francisco; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de maestro de construcción civil, el socio también tiene un pequeño restaurant que administra su esposa y también está construyendo su casa, el socio quiere terminar de construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construir como cemento, piedras y pinturas. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisco is a member of the communal bank, "Jose Carlos Mariategui." The bank is located in the Urubamba district of Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. Francisco is 47 years old, lives with his wife, and has six children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his work teaching civil construction. He also has a small restaurant which his wife runs. 

Francisco is in the process of building his house and would like to finish building it. He has requested this loan in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, stones, and paint. Francisco is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as cement, stones and paint.

loans.name: John Mokato

texts.en:
John Makato P. is 26 years old, married to Mary P., and is a father of three who all are schooling.  John is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET LTD from credit officers in their adverse marketing. This will be his first loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

John hopes to practice large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Kare Amandi

texts.es:
la sra. Kare Amandi G. tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica la fabricacion de collares, pulseras y aritos.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en la colonia Sagastume. Kare elabora aritos, cadenas, pulseras con materiales de plata, acrílico, piedras de rio y piedras finas, tiene tres distribuidoras a quienes les elabora el producto y ellas se encargan de venderlo, así mismo cuenta con clientes fijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales, accesorios, plata, perlas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Kare Amandi G. is 27 years old and makes necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. Her business is located in her home in the Sagastume subdivision. Kare makes earrings, necklaces, and bracelets out of silver, acrylic, river stones, and precious stones. She has three distributors who make the product and are responsible for selling them. Kare has established customers.

This loan will be used to buy materials, accessories, silver, and pearls. She needs the income to move her family forward.

loans.use: Purchase materials, accessories, silver, and pearls

loans.name: Tatiana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tatiana, ella tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una niña de cinco años de edad la misma que este año empieza su primer año de estudio. Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Lebel y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos, lleva un año que se dedica a esta actividad y dice que le va bien en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catalogo. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank “Virgen De Monserrate” meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture. In addition, the city is located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

It is here one can find Sra. Tatiana. She is 23 years old, married, and has a five year old daughter who just started her first year of school. Her husband works as a mason.

Tatiana is a housewife who earns her own income by selling clothes through a catalog. She also sells products made by Lebel and Sayson (brands of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Tatiana works on the weekends, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week. These products are shipped to her home and she acquires clothing at a distribution center. The products she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics. Tatiana has been in this business for one year and says that she has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing by catalog. Tatiana is in her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the fact the payments have been easy to make. Her dreams include having a larger business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Tsogt

texts.en:
Tsogt, 49, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Darhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in their own apartment that they have owned for 24 years. Tsogt's wife and older daughter are employed.

Tsogt began a taxi business in 2004 with his own car. He supports his family with the profit that he makes from the business and his daily net income is 30,000 MNT. He is trying to save some money to buy a new car as his current car is getting out of date. Tsogt is a hardworking and polite person who says, " I am planning to buy a new car since I want to expand my taxi service business more." Tsogt is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Las Entusiastas De La 3Era Etapa De La Era Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Jeremiana  tiene 3 hijas en edad escolar, es madre soltera  y  trabaja con Edaprospo desD. hace 4 meses,  Jeremiana  es integrante  del grupo “LAS ENTUSIASTAS D. LA 3ERA ETAPA D. LA ERA”, grupo conformado por 7 integrantes que le pusieron este nombre porque en el grupo todos son entusiastas y alegres. Jeremiana  trabaja desD. hace 20 años bordando pero a raíz D. que su esposo la dejo ella empezó a vender sus bordados a domicilo es asi que hoy en día brinda servicios D. bordado gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  ha  logrado darles a sus hijas educación y  una mejor calidad D. vida. Su sueño es comprar más maquinas computarizadas para tener productos D. bordado D. primera calidad. Con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería, hilo,  agujas, telas,  para implementar su negocio . Sabemos que jeremiana  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran

DATO 
La señora felicita Salgueda  D. polo negro se encuentra  como pasiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Jeremiana has 3 school-aged daughters.  She's a single mother and has worked with Edaprospo for 4 months.  Jeremiana is a member of the LAS ENTUSIASTAS D. LA 3ERA ETAPA D. LA ERA, a group of 7 members who chose that name because they're all enthusiastic and happy-go-lucky.  Jeremiana has maD. embroidery for 20 years and she started her embroidery business after her husband left her.  She works at home and the business has paid for her daughters' schooling and provided them all with a better quality of life.  Jeremiana wants to buy computerized equipment for making higher-quality embroidery.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies--thread, needles, material--for the business and, in turn, increase her income.  We know that she will meet her goals with a lot of hard work and a little bit of help from us.

INFORMATION
Sra. Felicita Salgueda, in the black sweater, is attending as a passive member.

loans.use: to buy supplies for service business

loans.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 20 años; es un joven soltero y trabador. Pues cuida de su papá Juan, su mamá Doris y sus 5 hermanos, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Como hijo mayor, desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad, comenzó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Sus padres necesitaban su apoyo en la agricultura, que es su principal actividad económica, desde entonces le brindaron un terreno donde comenzó a sembrar arveja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha, pues ve recompensado el arduo trabajo que desarrolla. Además comenta que siembra en baja escala por ello en temporadas de cosecha de café en la selva, viaja para trabajar como peón en las diferentes haciendas cafetaleras. “Tengo que trabajar en otros lugares para poder ahorrar dinero”, menciona. Su mayor deseo es convertirse en gran agricultor y sembrar en extensas hectáreas de terreno. Por ello trabaja sin descanso, esperando pacientemente el momento en el que pueda invertir con su propio capital.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan. Esequiel, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “super”, el cual muy pronto cosechará. Por ello con el crédito tiene pensado comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Esequiel is 20 years old.  He is single and a hard working young man.  Esequiel looks after his dad Juan, his mom Doris and his five siblings in their own home which is located in the small village of Bellavista Huaracayo.  As the eldest son, Esequiel started working for himself as soon as he came of age.  His parents needed his support in their farming which is their main business activity.  His parents rovided him with a plot of land where he started growing peas.

What Esequiel most enjoys about his work is harvest time as that is when he sees all his hard work rewarded.  He also tells us that he grows crops on a small scale.  This means that during coffee harvest season in the jungle, he travels in order to work as a laborer on other people's coffee plantations.  "I have to work in other places in order to save money", he says.  Esequiel's greatest wish is to become an important farmer and sow his crops over many hectares of land.  In order to achieve this goal, Esequiel works without rest, waiting patiently for the moment when he can invest with his own capital.

Esequiel is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful to MFP for the opportunity that they have given him.  Esequiel currently has a crop of 'super' variety potatoes growing which he will harvest very soon.  He will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 52  años de edad, es casado y tiene 1  hijo aun dependiente. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias. Cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua. 

Desde hace más de 20 años, gana la vida criando y comercializando animales menores. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Realiza esta actividad en el terreno cerca de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Adicionalmente, cuenta con ingresos adicionales brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi que es su propia. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Por ello, desea invertir su crédito en el arreglo en el interior de su domicilio.  Con esta inversión, podrá hacer arreglos a su casa lo que mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Vicente ha manejado préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos.
texts.en:
Vicente, 52, is married and has one dependent child.  He lives in his own house in the rural part of Morrope District, a district populated by humble, hard working people dedicated to farming.  It’s located in Lambayeque Province over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  His community is small; it has approximately 100 families.  It has both electricity and running water.

For over 20 years he has earned his living raising small farm animals to sell.  He feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that visit his area frequently.  He carries out these activities on a piece of property near his house.  He learned this line of work from his parents which is to say, he knows it to perfection. In addition, he earns extra income providing public transportation services with a mototaxi that he owns. 

His house is currently in a deteriorated state.  Because of this he wants to use the loan to do some interior repairs.  With this investment he will be able to do some home repairs that will improve his family’s quality of life.  He has, therefore, thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.  Vicente has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and he has established a good repayment record.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Pann's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members.  Mrs. Pann is the village bank president.  She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

Mrs. Pann is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family.  With this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for pig breeding.  Aside from pig breeding, she is also a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow different vegetables. 

Mrs. Pann was born in 1953, is widow with a child who is a student who also helps the mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig breeding.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida de 37 años de edad, es soltera, vive solo en su casa propia,l a cual cuenta con los servicios  de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en Nueva Arica, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo .
Elida se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales  (gallinas, pavos, patos y cuyes), los  corrales donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada.y plantas naturales (alfalfa).  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo,  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado Elida es de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de más animales y sus alimentos, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo  le ayudara  a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Elida es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la  vida y tener lo que desee.
texts.en:
Elida is 37 years old, single, and she lives along in a house which she owns. It is equipped only with running water and with hydro. It is located in Nueva Arica, belonging to the province of Chiclayo. The primary business activities in the region are agriculture, farming, and tourism.

Elida raises and sells livestock (poultry, turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs). The corrals where the livestock are kept are located in the rear section of her property. She feeds them a balanced diet and natural plants (alfalfa). When the livestock have reached an optimum size and weight she sells them at the different markets in the city of Chiclayo, thereby earning an income to acquires the products that she needs for the home. 

Elida requests a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase livestock and feed, with the goal of fattening them to sells them at a good price. This will help her repay her loan and it will also help her improve the quality of her life.

Elida is a hardworking woman who is responsible and dedicated. She ahs always known how to improve her life and to have what she wants.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older daughter, aged 21, goes to a college while the younger one, aged 15, is in secondary school. Her husband is the governor of a Bag: the smallest administrative unit in rural areas of Mongolia. She manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business after graduating from her training in 2001. Since then she has managed to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. She is a friendly woman who says, "With the loan I want to have my own workshop and new equipment". She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase some salon equipment

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado  y vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la siembra del frijol y asistirlo en su etapa de crecimiento. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo en buenas condiciones. El quiere sembrar esa área y poder asistirlo bastante para obtener posteriormente buenos resultados y así poder salir adelante con los pagos del préstamo y mejorar el nivel de vida de mi esposa e hijos.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 36 years old, married and living with his five children and his wife who are his main priority in life.  He intends to use the loan for his bean crop, to help it during the growing stage.  He has a field in good condition that is apt for growing this particular crop.  He wants to plant it and provide much care to obtain the best results later and be able to repay the loan and improve his wife’s and his children’s standard of living.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to tend to his bean crops.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hrmosa 1 Group
