texts.es: Duo Vista Hermosa 1 : Este grupo esta conformado por dos señoras las cuales se dedican a la centa de ropa nueva y ropa tipica,Doña Vicenta se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva bariada desde hace barios años.ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sus clientes han aumentado y tiene la nececidad de mas capital por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva,Doña Francisca Tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica ella nos cuenta que es un negocio que le gusta nucho porque la gente la conocen y le compran por mayor ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y estar mejor economicamente en un futuro.
texts.en: Duo Vista Hermosa 1 : This group is made up of two women who sell new and traditional clothing. Vicenta has sold a variety of new clothes for several years. She tells us that she is happy because her customers have increased and she needs the capital. That is why she is asking for the loan to buy new clothing. Francisca also sells traditional clothing. She tells us that she really likes the business because people know her and they buy from her wholesale. She is asking for this loan to buy traditional clothing. Their dream is to have a larger locale and to be better off financially in the future.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Group

texts.fr: DON DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Faustin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Françoise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants. Françoise a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a deux ans environs que Françoise fait le commerce des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Françoise s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DON DE DIEU.
texts.en:
DON DE DIEU is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's president, Françoise (with her hand raised in the photo), is 30 years old and married to a teacher by the name of Faustin. They have two children, all in school and still in their care. Françoise and her husband live together with their two children. She has a secondary school education. 

For about two years, Françoise has been doing commerce in rechargeable phone cards. She is supplied from Benin. This business enables her to support herself and her children. Seeking to satisfy her customers, she, along with the others members of the group DON DE DIEU, is requesting a loan for the first time.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Liz Yocelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Yocelin; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende en una carreta donde vende caramelos, chupetes, galletas y refrescos en el distrito de Poroy, ella vende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ahorrar para que estudie la carrera profesional de sistemas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas y para pagar algunas mensualidades de sus estudios.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Liz Yocelin belongs to the "Mama Simona" community bank in the district of Cusco, Peru. She is 19 years old and single. She balances her household responsibilities with her business selling snacks. She has a cart from which she sells caramels, lollipops, cookies and refreshments in the district of Poroy. She works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. Liz hopes through the business she can save to study for a professional degree. She is requesting the loan to purchase snacks and to pay off some of her school expenses. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and to pay off some of her school expenses.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is a garment worker. Her husband is now is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi). The couple just has one baby. 
Sochea is staying with her parents, brothers and sisters in a village along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is applying for a loan because she wants to build her own house and live separately.

Photo: Sochea is standing under her parents’ house with her husband.

loans.use: To build her own house to stay in

loans.name: Lorda

texts.en: Lorda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorda has been in this business for 10 years. Lorda requested a 29,500 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She would like to save money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr Francisco acudió a nuestra Institución para solicitar un crédito ya que requiere dar acabados exteriores a la barda que construyo con su crédito anterior y ahí mismo colocar una losa de concreto, esto es en la parte trasera de su vivienda, manifiesta el sr Francisco que tiene la intención de acondicionar bien su casa ya que es el patrimonio de sus hijos y poco a poco ira acondicionándola para que su familia este cómoda en ella.
texts.en: Sr. Francisco approached Credituyo to request a loan because he needs to perform the finishing touches on the security wall that he built using the funds from his previous loan.  He also wants to install a concrete slab at the back of his house.  Sr. Francisco says that he intends to do a good job of equipping his house since it will be an inheritance for his children.  As improvements are made gradually, his family will become more comfortable living their home.

loans.use: to perform the finishing touches on a security wall and to install a concrete slab at the back of his house.

loans.name: La Independecia De Chivarreto Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina es soltera, tiene 25 años D. edad, es graduada D. maestra D. educación,  se dedica a impartir clases en una escuela, a la artesanía y a la crianza D. animales domestico, inició la crianza D. animales criando pollos, lleva 5 años D. experiencia en la crianza D. animales.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra D. ganado vacuno y cerdos, ya que espera agrandar su granja D. animales domésticos, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la crianza D. animales, venta D. verduras, atención tienda D. consumo diario y al bordado D. blusas.
texts.en:
Señora Catarina is single and 25 years old.  She graduated as a teacher, and teaches at a primary school.  She also works doing handicrafts and raising domestic animals.  She began raising animals by raising chickens, and has five years of experience in raising animals.

She decided to organize a group to request a loan that will be used for the purchase of cows and pigs, as she hopes to grow her farm of domestic animals.  

The other members of the group work raising animals; selling vegetables; tending to a shop selling everyday products; and embroidering blouses.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Zholdoshbek

texts.ru: Жолдошбек – 41-летний фермер, живущий со своей семьей в селе Жерге -Тал (север Кыргызстана).  Он воспитывает 5 детей школьного возраста  – трех сыновей и двух дочерей.  В 1993 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Жолдошбек начал бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  Стартовав с начальной суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS), Жолдошбек сумел развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Также жена Жолдошбека  - Айнагуль торгует в маленьком продуктовом павильоне , приносящий дополнительный доход семье. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Жолдошбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жолдошбек планирует направить на постройку большого дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Zholdoshbek is a 41-year-old farmer, living with his family in the Zhergetal village (Northern Kyrgyzstan).  He is raising five school-age children: three sons and two daughters.  In search of sources of income for his family, Zholdoshbek started a business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1993.  Starting with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS), Zholdoshbek was able to develop his farm to have a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  Also, Zholdoshbek's wife, Aynagul, is involved in retail sales at a small food stall, and this brings in additional income for the family.  To further develop his business, Zholdoshbek requested a loan in the of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  He plans to use the profits from this loan to build a big house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saphina

texts.en:
Saphina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Saphina has been working hard to manage her farm, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Saphina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to rent land to be used for farming and will help Saphina to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Saphina hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Saphina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Saphina’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to rent land to be used for farming

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia tiene 60 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 de ellos son independientes y la socia solo vive con uno de 18 años de edad; la socia se dedica la la venta de verduras, ella compra verduras ala por mayor y las vende en uno de los mercados en Cusco, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras para aumentar su negocio y poder mejorar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the 'Imasumac II' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria is 60 years old, married, and has eight children, seven of whom live independently.  She only lives with one of her children who is 18 years old.  Maria's business is selling vegetables.  She buys vegetables wholesale and sells them in one of the markets in Cusco.  She needs this loan to invest in buying vegetables in order to increase her business and improve her profits.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables.

Maria is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying vegetables

loans.name: Shahadeh

texts.en:
Shahadeh is a 38-year–old man who married his wife in 2004 and had four adorable children.

Three years ago, Shahadeh opened a small store for mobile telephones sales, and through the years, he added many other services such as fixing mobiles, selling mobile accessories, and selling scented oils and perfumes.

Shahadeh has now applied for this loan so he can buy a few of the latest models of cell phones and renew the storefront.

loans.use: To add the latest models of cell phones and renew the store front.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
In a bid to expand his farm, Peter got a loan to buy a heifer for rearing. A commercial farmer, Peter wants to construct a residential house for his family and dreams of owning his own cattle farm.

Peter intends to use the loan to buy another heifer for rearing.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for rearing

loans.name: Patty Noreen

texts.en:
Patty Noreen is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Malibababag. She is a responsible child. She raises hogs in order to acquire an income and help shoulder her school expenses. She is in college. Patty Noreen raises hogs to fatten and breed. She has been doing this for 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP for each hog disposed.

She wants to improve her hog-selling business and is in need of additional capital so she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability. She is asking for 15,000 PHP. 

In the future, she would like to strenghten her business and continuously acquire profits from it.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability.

loans.name: Tepalua

texts.en:
Tepalua, 48, is married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Tepalua needs a loan of $1500 Samoan Talas (WST) to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 US per week) to make improvements to her house.

Tepalua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tepalua's second loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Comfort. She is married, and has a one-year-old child. She has two additional dependents who live with her. In 1997, Comfort established her Palm Oil and Gari (cassava) business. She began her business because she is not educated and found business to be the only means of livelihood.

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She has asked for a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Comfort needs the loan in order to buy more palm oil for her business.

In the future, Comfort plans to build a house to live in and to send all her children overseas. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Antonio se dedica al oficio de albañil es una persona  casado y tiene tres hijos que actual mente estudian. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material necesario y  iniciar un negocio de venta de tacos afuera de su casa por las noches, con la apertura de su puesta de tacos Don Francisco Antonio tendrá el apoyo económico de su esposa quien se ayudara a tender el negocio y así no descuidar a la familia y tengan más beneficios económicos.
texts.en: Señor Francisco Antonio works as a bricklayer. He is married and has three children who are now in school. He is applying for a loan to buy the necessary materials to set up a business selling tacos outside of his house in the evenings. With the opening of his taco stand, Don Francisco Antonio will have the economic support of his wife, who will help him tend to the business, and thus without neglecting their family they will have more economic benefits.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for the taco stand.

loans.name: Joseph Otieno

texts.en: Joseph, 36 years old, is married and has three children ranging from 5 to 13 years. He describes himself as a hard-working man. He has been involved in poultry business for the last 11 years. He sells eggs and chicken to retailers. His business challenge is a shortage of chickens. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more chicks and broilers. Joseph wants to expand his business in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy chicks and broilers.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’habits de façon ambulante, Madame Adjo est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 12 et 07ans qui sont tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle a commencé par faire cette activité il y a 08ans pour prêter main forte à son conjoint électricien bâtiment dans les charges du ménage. Elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (robes et collants). Elle veut épargner le profit, agrandir l’activité et permettre à ses enfants de mieux scolariser.
texts.en:
Adjo works as a street seller, selling clothing. She has two children aged twelve and seven, both of whom are at school. She started her business eight years ago to help her husband, a building electrician, with the household expenses. 

Adjo has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise (dresses and panty hose). She wants to save her profits, expand her business, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Kleria

texts.en: Kleria, aged 23, is a young entrepreneur from Iringa district, Tanzania. She is the mother of one child. Kleria volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches local students about life skills for 2.5 hours each week. She requests a loan from Kiva to open a grocery store where she can sell cooking oil, sugar, salt, flour and kerosene. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladwell wants to buy different types of spices.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has one child who attends school. She is educated to level 10 and left early due to marriage. She started her shoe business in 2003 with capital of $220 that was given to her by the husband.

She previously took a loan out from Krep and successfully repaid it. Since the first loan helped her improve her income greatly so she could take care of her family’s needs, she now wants another loan to expand her business and generate additional income.

The loan term is for 12 months and she is capable of repaying the loan as she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say N. is 38 years old and runs a small restaurant in Phnom Penh selling mostly pork rice, porridge, and some soft drinks.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, and her husband earns $3/day working as a soldier.  Together, the couple has 2 children, 1 of whom is a student and the other an infant still.  She will use this loan to repair her kitchen and also to purchase some utensils for her restaurant.  In the future, she hopes to save enough money from her restaurant business so that she can open a grocery store.

loans.use: To repair kitchen and to purchase utensils

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana has been selling clothing for 12 years. She began her business when she was confronted with the need for an extra income in order to improve her family’s standard of living. She is married and has three children, who are 10, 13, and 16 years old. In the beginning, one of her sisters obtained clothing for her, but eventually she went to Moroleón, en Guanajuato, to get it for herself. She has now incorporated the making and selling of school uniforms. Due to the favorable payment plan she offers, she has had a lot of demand and supplies two schools in the town of Linares, Nuevo León.

In order to cover the orders she has for this new school year, Juana needs a loan of $925.00. She will use it to buy the fabric she needs to make the school uniforms. She will return the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business. You can help this family, thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 10, 13 y 16 años de edad. Al principio una de sus hermanas le conseguía la ropa pero después ella misma fue a adquirirla a Moroleón, en Guanajuato. Ahora ha incorporado la elaboración y venta de uniformes escolares, gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrece ha tenido mucha demanda y surte a dos escuelas de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo León.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene para este nuevo ciclo escolar, Juana necesita un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la compra del material que necesita para la elaboración de los uniformes escolares, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, tu puedes ayudar a esta familia, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making school uniforms

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa, a mother of five, does not want her children to suffer in the future. She helps her husband in doing their plantation so they can sell their produce to get money. All of her children are attending school and they both give them their support. It is her husband who works hard to maintain their plantation.

Temukisa appreciates the help of S.P.B.D. for lending the money to back up her business financially. She is responsible for selling their products at the new market where most people go for shopping. Temukisa earns more than 500 Tala ($200 US) a week from her sales and with that she is able to meet her family's needs as well as her loan payment.

loans.use: To buy, knives, boots, weed spray, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Sukhian

texts.en: I am Sukhian B. from Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. I am 31, married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. My husband is a rickshaw driver and he owns a rickshaw. He uses this rickshaw to offer public transportation services. He now needs $175 for the maintenance of his rickshaw, because its condition is deteriorating. We need this loan immediately because the rickshaw is our major source of income.

loans.use: Repair rickshaw

loans.name: Miwonougnui

texts.fr:
A tailor by trade, Mr. Miwonougnui A., 31, was born in Vogan (Togo) . He is married and the father of three children. With his limited means, he has a rented workshop where he presently is training some 15 apprentices. With this great number of people dependent on him, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can purchase new machines and enlarge his workshop. This will make things easier for his apprentices as well as for him. Achieving these goals will have a positive effect on his output.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Tailleur de profession, Monsieur Miwonougnui A. est né à Vogan et âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Avec son moyen de bord, il dispose d’un atelier qu’il a loué et a actuellement une quinzaine d’apprentis. Devant ce grand nombre, il demande un prêt de $1000 pour acquérir de nouvelles machines et agrandir son espace d’activité. Ce qui mettra également à l’aise ses apprentis. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement.

loans.use:
Purchase of new machines and enlarging his workshop

Achat de nouvelles machines

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mrs. Rin D., age 34, is a mother of four children. She doesn’t run any business beside staying at home cooking food and taking care of her three school-age children. Her husband works as a middleman buying bananas in a large quantity from the growers to resell for a profit, making on average around $18 each day of income. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order increase the business’s inventory of bananas and expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of bananas.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs Norma León Bedón belongs to the Community Bank “Kid Manuelito”. She sells food at the riverside of the Santa River, where people work extracting sand, gravel and cement, amongst others. Her business is located in the city of Huaraz, in the Ancash district.

With a prior loan, Norma had bought main ingredients for her food like rice, oil and sugar. With this new loan of 175 USD, which she will pay in 4 months, Norma will continue to invest in ingredients for her business as noodles and rice.

She is 38 years old, has 4 little children and her husband is a driver. The main objective of their work is to be able to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma León Bedón, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito”, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos, en las canteras del Río Santa donde las personas trabajan sacando hormigón, arena fina, ripio y otros. Este negocio se ubica en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior ella compro artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite para la preparación de alimentos. Con este préstamo de S/. 500 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la comprara de productos para su negocio como: arroz, fideos, etc

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, 4 hijos pequeños, es casada su esposo es chofer eventual ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like rice and noodles

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.en:
“Micaela Bastidas” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altitude ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level), the cold, the difficulty to grow crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Micaela Bastidas” is located the community of Choclococha in the district of the same name, province of Acobamba. The main activities of the population are the growth of corn and potatoes and most of the population also is dedicated to raising bulls, cows, sheep and smaller cattle.

The bank has been formed recently with 11 female borrowers and therefore has no history yet. It has only just started to create history in its community! The expectations working with FINCA Peru are very clear: increase business and save. For all members, the main use of the savings they will be generating as of now is for investing in their businesses or for the education of their children, whether to buy school uniforms, supplies, books or paying the fee for entering primary or secondary school.

Most women have small businesses that require small loans; therefore, almost all members have a 200 soles loan, with the exception of two women, who each have loans of 500 soles. The total of the loans is 2,900 soles among the 11 members.

One of the group´s members, Tomasa L. Auccapiña, sells bread at the local markets. Another small business she runs is a small flour mill for wheat and other cereals. With her 200 soles loan she will be able to buy more supplies for her small store. When asked about her future, she says that her dream is the education of her children so they can be professionals and keep studying. And another dream is for her store to grow so that she will be able to move to a bigger city to run a bigger store there. With her (future) savings, she will buy more merchandise for her store. Already she has learned to be more nice in her store, to treat clients well, and to be more hygienic. She also learned about the importance of saving.

Marina M. C. has another story. She has a small oven to make bread. She sells the bread at local markets and sometimes in town, in her small grocery-store where she also sells fruits. With her loan of 200 soles she will be able to buy more supplies for her business. Her dream for the future is simply to live a good life with her family and her children. She will use her savings to buy more merchandise, sell more, and then save more. Her expectations working with FINCA Peru are to learn to work harder and be more responsible.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Bính, 55 years old, lives with her husband and their youngest child. The oldest is married and moved out. She joins the TYM Fund in 2002. The family raised pigs and farmed a rice paddy. The income was modest at 300USD a year, less than a dollar a day. When she joins the Fund she changes to making gloves and her husband sells agriculture products. The income is much better at 220USD a month. Therefore, the family’s economy is improved. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest in her business, buying material for making gloves and agricultural goods for selling.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Ngô Thị Bính, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và người con út, con đầu của chị Bính đã có gia đình riêng. Trước khi vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chủ yếu là nuôi lợn và làm ruộng, thu nhập chỉ khoảng 300USD/năm. Sau khi vào Quỹ, chị Bính chuyển sang may găng tay còn chồng con chị lấy hàng nông sản về bán phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng. Thu nhập của cả gia đình hiện nay là 220USD/tháng. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển, việc hoàn trả tuần cũng thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị Bính làm đơn xin vay 1200USD mua vải và hàng nông sản.

loans.use: Buy fabric and agricultural product

loans.name: Selestina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Selestina R.. She is single, and has one child, aged 10. In 2000, Selestina established her rice and clothing business. Selestina has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha T., age 28, grows cucumbers in her plot of farmland and sells them to a nearby market. Tha gets up early in the morning to pick cucumbers from her field, clean them, and send them to the market to sell, all of which generates around $3 per day. Her husband also contributes about $6 per day to the household by working as an electrician. The amount of income she and her husband make is just enough for her entire family, of which there are six members in total (her two little children, her mother and her brother).

Because inflation in Cambodia is out of control, everything is very expensive now, even the motor-taxi her husband uses to commute to work every day. (Gasoline has risen to $1.40 per liter from less than $1 per liter).

In order to save money on transportation each day, Mrs. Tha would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and save paying for a motor-taxi each day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en:
Chausiku owns and operates her own shop in Zanzibar. She is 40 years old and divorced with one 18 year old child. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her store. She can earn a monthly profit of about $50.

Chausiku has been in business since 2002 and now hopes for a loan to buy more materials for her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more materials to expand her businesses.

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Alba Rye works in the business of meats sales, in the municipality of El Viejo, in the city of Chinandega. This is a hard-working woman who has managed to succeed thanks to her many efforts in her business.

One of the needs she has come across today, is the urgency to acquire the economic resources for the purchase of meat from her suppliers. For this simple reason she looks to Ceprodel to obtain the loan and thus improve the livelihood of her business and continue providing sustenance in her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de carne es el negocio al cual se dedica la señora Alba C. en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Esta dama es una persona muy trabajadora y ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en su negocio.

Una de las necesidades que ella atraviesa hoy en día es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de la carne a sus proveedores. Por esta sencilla razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta forma mejorar la condición de su negocio y continuar llevando el sustento a su mesa en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Haydee es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Haydee tiene una casa de material rustico muy amplia que esta ubicado en el Distrito de Carmen Alto. Haydee junto a su esposo realizan trabajos en telar como pasadizos, frazadas con diseños y figuras de la cultura Wari, para lo cual cuenta con 3 telares y 2 operarios que son sus cuñados, Haydee se encarga del teñido, hilado de las lanas, sus ventas lo realizan en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también realizan los trabajos a través de pedidos.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas y también fierros para la construcción de su casa. Haydee sueña con construir su casa de material noble, ofrecer sus productos a distintos lugares y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Amor y Verdad Communal Bank (a group loan). She is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a very large, rustic house in the Carmen Alto District. She and her husband make loom weavings like blankets with designs or partterns from the Wari culture. Haydee owns three looms and employs two of her in-laws as weavers. Haydee dyes the wool and makes yarn from it. She sells her wares in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, and also fills custom orders.

Haydee needs a loan of 3000 soles ($1,025), which she will use to buy wool for weaving and iron rods for the construction of her home. Haydee dreams of building her house from solid materials, of selling her wares in different places and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving and iron rods for home construction

loans.name: Rubina Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji is the wife of Mr. S. and lives in a small area named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last six years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband is a driver by profession. He has been driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the last ten years. Rubina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy her own auto-rickshaw.

Rubina baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Taji baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy  C. is a villager in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support the family. His wife, Mr. Pov Srey Neang, is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

Although he and his wife have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Thus, Mr. Vuthy  C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding, and he hopes to increase his income after he sells the cow. 

Mr. Vuthy  C. is 23 and does not have any children. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 30 years old and the mother of two school-aged children, is currently in the business of transporting and selling charcoal with her husband.  She is requesting a loan to expand the business.    

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Charité

texts.fr: Née en 1962 à Lomé, Mme K. Charité est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Très dévouée et dynamique elle a réussit à s’adonner à la vente de pain assaisonné avec la mayonnaise, la salade, le beurre, des œufs devant les établissements scolaires. Une activité qui lui réussit très bien compte tenu de l’hygiène et la qualité du service. Afin de continuer à fournir un service de qualité non douteuse et varier ses ingrédients, elle sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra de renforcer son chiffre d’affaires et mieux s’occuper des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Lomé, Ms. Charité K. is a married mother of three. A very devoted and energetic woman, she has succeeded in dedicating herself to selling bread seasoned with mayonnaise, salad, butter, and eggs in front of school houses. This business has been a successful one for her, given the quality of her service and hygienic practices. In order to continue providing unquestionable quality service and to vary her ingredients, she is requesting financing. This will enable her to boost her sales figures and to take better care of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breads

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mr. Sreng Vong is a villager in Lvea village in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land and  cultivates rice. His land is infertile and he does not have enough money to hire a laborer to work his field. He requests a loan to hire a few laborers to work on his field and purchase fertilizer for the soil. 

Mr. Sreng Vong  is a 55-year-old father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and three are attending a local school. His wife, Mrs. Duong Torn, is a housewife.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa J. is single mother who lives with her daughter in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing. They don't have their own yard, so they built their ger in her sister's yard. Her daughter is handicapped, but despite this she helps in her mother's business as much as she can. Baigalmaa graduated from college as a construction mechanic, but never worked as mechanic. Her first retail business was cigarette sales. She was in the cigarette business from 1997 until 2000. Then she switched into the dairy products business at the local market. During the summer, she sells only "airag," or fermented mare's milk. She gained a lot of experience while working in the dairy business. Baigalmaa wants a loan to buy a larger volume of dairy products, including airag, since almost every household uses dairy products during the upcoming lunar New Year celebration.

loans.use: To buy dairy products for the upcoming lunar New year celebration

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fruit, like pawpaw, oranges, and coconut. She needs a loan in the amount of N60000 to purchase more fruit to sell. She says thank you to all that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: la Sra. Catalina L. R. se dedica a esta actividad, teje mantas de vicuña, alpaca y huanaco, desde hace más de 20 años, ella tiene un hijo con problemas de salud, que aún lo mantiene economicamente, ya que los mayores tienen sus propios hogares, el esposo viaja constantemente al campo por ser agricultor.La Sra, Catalina trabaja con Emprender desde el año 2006, saca montos pequeños a plazo largo debido a esa actividad del tejido, ya que ella compra lana en bruto y procede al hilado y luego al tejido, además los gastos que ella tiene con su hijo enfermo, es una cliente bien puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina L. R. has been knitting woolen cloaks of vicuña, alpaca and huanaco for more than 20 years. She has a son with health problems who she still supports financially, since the older ones have their own homes. Her husband travels constantly to the fields for agricultural work. Catalina has been working with Emprender since 2006. She takes out small amounts for a long period on account of her knitting work, since she buys the wool in large lots and then proceeds with the spinning and later the knitting. In spite of the expenses that she has with her ailing son, she is a very punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: "I am happy because I have a complete family. God has really given me a responsible husband who works so hard to provide our family needs," says Rosita B., 54-year-old mother of three children. "My husband owns a small parcel of land that he inherited from his parents. Now, it’s not so hard to feed and clothe our family because we are all working together," she added. Rosita is asking for a loan from CEVI to help her husband buy fertilizer, herbicide and seed for his farm. The loan will really help her increase the yield and income as well. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide and seed

loans.name: Simprosa

texts.en:
Simprosa J. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 64 years old. Simprosa is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Simprosa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Simprosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Simprosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simprosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Simprosa is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Simprosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ljubica

texts.en: Ljubica Đ. was born in 1964 and she comes from Srebrenica. Ljubica is not married. She is a dressmaker, by profession. Ljubica repaid one loan from WWI with which she had invested in materials for sewing. Ljubica has been in this business for a long time and has repeat clients. Now she wants to improve her business by buying a new sewing machine. She requested for the loan from WWI in amount of 700 KM to by a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 60 years old, married and has five children. Three are in school and two are independent. She trades in maize in the local market of Sefwi, a town in the western region of Ghana. Her major difficulty is with funds to support the business. She requests a loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales. With her 21 years experience in trade, she hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education and give them a better future and more career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Искандаров Мирали проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мирали имеет хлебопекарню, где более 6 лет занимается производством национальных лепешек. Ему в этом также помогает его семья. Кредит просит для закупа сырья и обновления печи.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mirali I. lives in the Huroson district. He is married with three children. Mirali has a bakery where for more than six years he has been involved in the production of national flat cakes. In this manner, he is able to support his family. He is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients and update his ovens.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and update ovens

loans.name: Mamaioa

texts.en:
Mamaioa N.  is a 71-year-old woman living in the town of Ulutogia.  She is married and has 8 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Mamaioa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mamaioa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2003, Mamaioa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mamaioa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Mamaioa is now requesting a new loan of 3500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mamaioa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 33 years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cosmetics. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Georgina procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang S. est une femme de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de bétail et de produits alimentaires. Cet activité  lui permet de mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mbayang S. is a 58 year-old married woman and the mother of 10 children. She trades in livestock and foodstuffs. This business enables her to meet better the family expenses.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of livestock and foodstuffs

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en: Sadaina is a 37 married with four children aged between 6 and 16 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Sadaina resides and owns a one roomed house where she is staying with six people. There is electricity no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Kitawuluzi. Sadaina works seven days a week. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo one the busiest places in Kampala city and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She pays monthly rent of 70000/=.  She sells and works to all categories of people Sadaina has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise .Sadaina  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start a whole sale shop.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her retail shop like suagr soap and salt

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01  hijo, vive en el Sector Central, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para cría, el que será vendido en la feria semanal, la señora Yola también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías en miniatura para apoyarse.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y ayudar a su hijo.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is a farmer. He develops his land for rice crops. He wants to improve his living condition. Despite many challenges in farming, he is still eager to succeed in life. 

In 2008, he joined CEVI and still enjoys being a member. He said that he learns a lot from the Biblical Reflection. He is also grateful, not just for the financial service, but for the savings and microinsurance as well. He is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. He will use this loan to fund his farm and hopefully have better income on his next harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
Belarmina M. is from the village of Bonbonon, a barangay of Iligan City on the island of Mindanao. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. Belarmina grows a variety of vegetables to sell like okra, string beans and eggplant. She has been farming for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Belarmina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services (this will be Belarmina's second loan from HSPFI). She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through this loan to grow her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow.

loans.name: Hipolinaria

texts.es:
La señora Hipolinaria es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada,  tiene 06 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta. 
Hipolinaria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores y a la venta D. abarrotes.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en la compra D. 3 ovejas, las que vendió después D. engordarlas..
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar artefactos para luego vender.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, ser mayorista y generar mejores ganancias.
Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los bajos intereses y el plan D. ahorro
texts.en:
Sra. Hipolinaria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao District. She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children. Hipolinaria did not finish her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Hipolinaria buys and sells animals, as well as groceries. She says her first loan was in the amount of 500 soles and was used to buy 3 sheep for fattening. The animals were eventually sold.

Hipolinaria is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase appliances to sell at a later time. Her vision for the future is to become a wholesaler so that she can generate better earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the low interest rates and her savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances to sell (radios, televisions, etc.)

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una socia dinámica, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 26 años y se dedica a la venta de menús desde hace dos años, actividad que realiza junto a su mamá.
Forma parte del Banco comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles  los que invirtió en productos para su restaurante.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sillas, mesas y una refrigeradora de segundo uso. 
La meta de Luz es tener una fuente de soda e implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Luz is a dynamic partner who lives in the district of Campo Verde, in the region of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and has made a living for two years selling food, alongside her mother. She has been a part of the communal bank "Las Nazarenas" for a year, and the first credit that she received was 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in products for her restaurant. Currently she needs a loan of 1200.00 nuevos soles with which she will purchase chairs, tables, and a second-hand refrigerator. Luz's goal is to have a soda fountain and set up her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and a second-hand refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Shodiyaoi

texts.en:
Shodiyaoi is a widow and the loving grandmother of two grandchildren. Shodiyaoi owns a successful clothing sales business at the market in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about ten years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Shodiyaoi tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Shodiyaoi has requested a loan of $1,200 USD to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Shodiyaoi will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase product inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa heredada de sus padres. Desde hace 7 años, junto a su esposo, su principal actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, y para ello alquilan un auto, pues no cuentan con uno propio.
Cada día, su esposo recorre los diferentes puntos de su ciudad ofreciendo este servicio, mientras que Evelyn se encarga de la correcta administración de los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Adicionalmente, tiene un establo que acondicionó en su casa para la crianza de vacas y toro. Con ambas actividades, logra suplir los estudios y alimentación de sus pequeños hijos.
El mayor deseo de Evelyn es tener su propio carro, para que sus ganancias sean mejor aprovechadas. 

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo de permanencia (casi 5 años) en su banco comunal ha demostrado ser responsable en la devolución de los créditos. En esta ocasión, seguirá demostrando su responsabilidad en el pago a tiempo de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de repuestos para la reparación y mantenimiento del carro que vienen utilizando.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 26 and lives with her husband and 2 small children in the house she inherited from her parents. For 7 years, along with her husband, she has had a business offering a taxi service. They rent a car for this because they don't have one of their own. Every day, her husband frequents different places in the city to offer this service, and Evelyn is in charge of administering the income to cover their family's economic needs. Additionally, she has a stable at her home in which she raises cows and a bull. With both of these activities, she manages to pay for the education and food costs of her small children. Her biggest wish is to have her own car, so she can make the most of her earnings. This is her ninth opportunity to have a credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and during this time (almost 5 years) in her communal bank, she has proven herself to be responsible with repaying her credits. On this occasion, she will keep demonstrating her responsibility and making her payments on time. The money that she is requesting will go towards the purchase of parts and maintenance of the car that they are using.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain the car with that she uses for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Paz y Amor, inicia su 16 ciclo con 24 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, fabricación D. ladrillos, verduras, carne, cochinilla, frutas, tara, bebidas, comida. 

Como es el caso D. la señora Guillermina que es casada, tiene 41 años y 1 hijo, Guillermina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, Guillermina necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar, lucia necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,650 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, verduras, carnes, frutas, tara, cochinilla, leña y para el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios, compra un carro y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Paz y Amor” (Peace and Love) is starting its 16th loan cycle with 24 members who are from the community of Huayllapampa, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses selling groceries, bricks, vegetables, meat, cochineal (an insect used in making red fabric dye), fruit, tara (a plant extract that has various uses), beverages, and prepared foods.

Such is the case with Sra. Guillermina. She is 41 years old, married, and has one child. Guillermina has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She needs a loan of 300 soles in order to buy rice.

Lucia is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She manufactures and sells handmaD. bricks from the same location. Lucia needs a loan of 300 soles in order to pay her workers.

The members need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 10,650 soles to the entire Communal Bank. The funds will be used to buy rice, vegetables, fruit, tara, cochineal, firewood, and also pay laborers’ wages.

The members dream of expanding their businesses, helping their children finish their education, buying a car, and building their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Salvador Caetano

texts.pt:
Salvador Caetano António nasceu no Distrito de Chinde, Província da Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 14, 10, 05 anos e 1 de 06 meses de idade, os 3 mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez bacharelato na faculdade de ciências pedagógicas. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu de Zambézia para Maputo a casa da sua irmã para dar continuidade com os seus estudos, depois da formação no Instituto de Magistério Primário na Matola, ingressou no Ministério da Educação onde trabalha ate então como docente sem horário fixo. E do Quadro deste ministério a mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 6.444.44mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos em outros bancos (Novo Banco) e mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores que obteve no Novo Banco foram de 15.000.00mt, 25.000.00mt e 38.000.00mt todos foram fechados também destinados para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência, assim como para iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Salvador Caetano A. was born in the district of Chinde, in the province of Zambezia in the central region of Mozambique. He is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children whose ages are 14, 10 and 5 years, and 6 months. The 3 older children go to school. Salvador has a degree in Pedagogical Sciences. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of two brothers who live with him. He left Zambezia for his sister's house in Maputo in order to continue with his education. After finishing his studies at the Instituto de Magistério Primário [Institute for Primary Education] in Matola, he began to work for the Ministry of Education as a teacher. He continues to work in the same job today, with a relatively free work schedule. He has been employed by the Ministry of Education for more than 5 years and doesn't employ anyone else to help him. He has a monthly salary of 6444.44 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is occasionally able to save some money in his bank account. Salvador had taken out loans before with another bank (Novo Banco), but he decided not to continue for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who have also worked with the institution. This is his 1st loan, for the amount of 25,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (zinc plates, stones, cement, sand and other items) in order to continue working on his construction project. His earlier loans from Novo Banco were for 15,000.00, 25,000.00 and 38,000.00 Meticales All were repaid and were used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and also to start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, and other items)

loans.name: Merab Atieno

texts.en:
Merab Atieno O. is 50 years old. She is married with six children and lives in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. Merab was a housewife depending fully on her husband’s meager earnings until 1990 when she began selling fish. She now also does tailoring. A determined and hardworking woman, Merab goes as far as Busia to purchase her tailoring materials on a weekly basis.
Merab would like to expand her business in order to earn enough income to open a community-based organization (CBO) to support widows, orphans and vulnerable children (OVCs) and also people living with HIV-AIDS (PLWHAS). She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her material stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing materials

loans.name: Carlos Adonis

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca Rodeo grande el señor Carlos Adonis H. N. dedica parte de su tiempo al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como la crianza de ganado en los que se destaca el ganado bobino, porcino y aviar así como  algunos cultivos como el Maíz, sorgo entre otros los que desarrolla en compañía de su esposa, también tiene un empleo como  docente de un colegio de secundaria con el cual financia la mayoría de sus actividades productivas, con el crédito que solicita pretende compra dos vacas paridas con las que espera mejorar sus condiciones  y mejorar su hato ganadero y así desarrollar su economía familiar, al realizar inversiones productivas para aumentar su capital de trabajo, con el credito anterior realizo la compra de un semental
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the Rodeo Grande district, Señor Carlos Adonis H. N. dedicates part of his time to the development of agricultural activities such as raising cattle, pigs, and poultry. He also grows crops like corn and sorghum, among others. He carries out this work with his wife. He also has a job as a high school teacher. Earnings from this job finance most of his agricultural activities.

With the loan applied for he intends to but two calves. He hopes to raise them and improve the condition of his herd and, thus, increase his family’s income. With a previous loan, used to increase his working capital, he acquired a bull for breeding.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calves.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a driver in the small township of Masindi, Uganda. He is married to a teacher and together they have three children aged seven, five, and three years. He has a vehicle which he uses in his transport business and he has operated it for five years now. He says you need to be a hard-working person to succeed in the transport business in Uganda, especially with small vehicles like Hassan’s. 

Hassan has, however, been able to build his own house from the profit from the business and he hopes to buy a new good vehicle in future for his transport business. For now though, he wants to use the loan funds to buy a second-hand vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: buying a second-hand vehicle for his transport business

loans.name: Mrs. Sithim Hai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan group and they live in Cheung Loung village in Takeo province. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sithim H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a weaver working at her home and her husband, Mr. Soch Nob, is a fisherman and aside from this, he is a farmer who owns a 1.70-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family. Since her weaving business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sithim H. is seeking a loan to buy silk. She is the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La señora Marciana vive con su ultimo hijo que esta estudiando en la universidad y su mayor deseo es que termine sus estudios y sea un profesional exitoso. Marciana pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles es socia hace 12 años y durante este tiempo ahorro y con ese dinero educo a sus hijos.
Marciana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, con la ayuda de su hijo. Marciana también viaja a las ferias llevando frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en su molino, productos que reparte a las tiendas de su zona. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz.
texts.en:
Marciana lives with her youngest son who is studying at the university. Her main desire is for him to finish his studies and become a successful professional. Marciana belongs to the communal bank "Los Claveles." She has been a member for 12 years; during this time she saved, and with this money she educated her children. Marciana has a store in her home where she sells groceries such as meat and vegetables with the help of her son. Marciana also travels to the markets where she takes fruit to sell, and where she also buys cereals that she later processes in her mill and distributes to the stores in her area. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley and corn.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley and corn

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and married. She is involved in farming and has been planting rice crops for more than a few years now. She helps her husband maintain their farm. While her husband does the major farming duties, she also manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells sugar, oil and other basic necessities people in her neighborhood regularly look for. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. 

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 47-year-old single lady.  She does dressmaking and embroidery to earn a living.  As a single mother of two, she works hard to provide for her family.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, in Bukima Lady's group, she has managed to improve her business, using her savings with the group. Currently, she can afford to pay wages to her two employees. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric for making clothes.  She hopes to open a textile shop and a boutique shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza P. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan Zambo.Del Norte. She is 57 years old. Feliza is married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Feliza owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Feliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Feliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Feliza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 44 años y vive en el distrito de Cachimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus  5 hijos. La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Eugenia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y gallinas, ella compra animales críos de la feria de Inquilpata y después de hacer engordar los animales, ella los vende en las ferias y mercados de Izcuchaca y Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eugenia que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar ovejas. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Eugenia pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 44, lives in Cachimayo district, Anta province, Cusco department, with her husband and 5 children. The city of Cachimayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Eugenia raises small farm animals like sheep, guinea pigs and chickens. She buys the young animals at Inquilpata’s farmers market and then fattens them up. She subsequently sells them at farmers markets and markets in Izcuchaca and Cusco. She has been in this business for 3 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.
