Eugenia expects to get 800 new soles in her next loan which she’d like to use to buy sheep. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years; Eugenia has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is the reason they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Jose están en el Segundo Ciclo con 16  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento D. responsabilidad con la institución.
 Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso D. sus emprendimientos.

La Sra. Eulogia P. es una D. las integrantes, ella posee una pequeña granja en la cual con su familia se dedican a la cria y engorD. D. animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos, así también poseen vacas para la producción D. leche, y así también la fabricación D. queso.
El negocio es bastante fructífero, teniendo en cuenta la calidad D. sus productos y animales.
Desea ampliar el negocio mediante la compra D. más animales como pollos (pollitos) para engorD. y a la vez productos balanceados, alimentos para animales, para así aumentar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo con la actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
The community bank called San Jose is in its second loan cycle and has 16 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive, and responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit, since they are up-to-date with their payments and they intend to finish this cycle by continuing to carry out their responsibility to the institution. With the acquiring of the loan, many doors will be opened for the progress of their businesses. Sra. Eulogia P. is one of the members. She has a little farm on which her family raises and fattens animals such as chickens, ducks, and pigs. They also have cows for the production of milk and cheese-making. The business is very productive, taking into account the quality of their products and animals. She wants to expand the business through the purchase of more animals such as chickens (baby chicks) to fatten and also by purchasing balanced feeds for the animals. In this way she wants to increase her income and continue expanding her agricultural business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire chickens and feed to fatten animals

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna A. is from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Lorna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna buys and sells firewood in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to sell

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
S. Abdukodir is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He is a very hardworking man. He owns land on which he grows potatoes and other vegetables. His wife sells their products. When she goes to sell their products, he remains behind to farm. What most aggravates him about this activity is when the opportunity to sell his crop arrives, sometimes he makes a lot of money and other times the market isn’t as kind to him. Abdukodir and his wife work hard for the education of their children. With the loan requested through Kiva, he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his field. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda B. is from the village of Villaros in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Roda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Roda owns & operates a "sari sari" (general store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roda joined ASKI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julius Kibet

texts.en:
Julius Kibet M. is 33 years old and married to Dorcas M.. He is a businessman who sells clothes on a busy street in Silibwet, a town on the outskirts of Narok. He has been running this business for the past two years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a friend who is already registered as a client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to increase his inventory by buying more clothes. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent a permanent shop where he can sell his clothes. He plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. 

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own house and be running the shop there. Julius believes he is hardworking and he only needs the resources to attain his goals

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica  a la crianza de pollos de engorde, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años, residen en Meanguera Departamento de Morazán, él trabaja junto a su esposa en la crianza y engorde de pollos desde hace dos años.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos pequeños y el alimento para los mismos, vitaminas, antibióticos y vacunas, para dar el mejor cuido posible a la granja e incrementar la posibilidad de crecerlos y comercializarlos a buen precio.
Su proyección es tener una granja grande y bien establecida que produzca muchos pollos para la venta y de esta manera ir mejorando su condición económica, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old and lives with his wife and three year old child in Meanguera in the department of Morazán.  He and his wife have worked together for two years raising broiler chickens.

He is asking for a loan to purchase chicks and food for them, including vitamins, antibiotics, and vaccines in order to give them the best care possible and increase the possibility that they will reach adulthood and be sold for a good price.

His dream is to have a large and well established farm that produces many chickens for sale so that he can improve his financial status, improve his home, and give his children access to education.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, vitamins, antibiotics, and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Edy Orlando

texts.es:
El señor Edy  Orlando tiene 35 años vive con su conviviente y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año, el señor Edy vive en la comunidad de Vinto chico junto con su hermano, ambos son huérfanos de madre ya se murió hace muchos años, y el padre los abandono cuando todavía eran muy pequeños, pues Eddy trabajando desde muy pequeño ayudaba a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

Eddy se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, con el préstamo anterior  le fue muy bien ya que ha crecido la cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero. Actualmente cuenta con 8 cabezas de ganado lechero.
El cliente está muy agradecido por el préstamo que se les otorgo, y por lo tanto solicita nuevamente para la compra de forraje ya que creció su actividad.

Entre sus sueños y metas sigue siendo crecer mucho más en su actividad hasta tener una granja de más o menos 30 cabezas de ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Edy Orlando is 35 years old and has a live-in partner with whom he has two children ages five and one. Edy lives in the town of Vinto Chico with his brother. They are orphans as their mother died several years ago and their father abandoned them when they were very young. Edy worked from a young age to help his mother with the household expenses. 

Edy works in the production of raw milk. He did very well with the previous loan he received. He was able to increase the number of milking cows. He currently has eight milking cows. He is very grateful for the loan he previously received and is now requesting a new loan to buy feed because his business has grown. 

Among his dreams and goals is to continue to grow his business until he can obtain a farm with about 30 milking cows.

loans.use: Purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Mercedes Susy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes Susy; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende todo tipo de telares y mantas hechos en hilo y tela, la socia tiene una tienda donde vende los telares y artesanía y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes Susy is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Mercedes Susy is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She sells all kinds of woven products and blankets made from thread and fabric.  She would like to have a store where she could sell her woven products and handicrafts.  Through her business, she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Mercedes Susy would like to expand and improve her handicrafts business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making her woven products.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making woven products

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: T. Harriet, 61 years old, says her 8 year poultry business was an enterprise she began on a small scale. The business, which she has been operating from Nizam-Jinja, has grown by leaps and bounds, given Harriet's hard work. She says she was more inclined to farming before she took up this business. Like most single women in Uganda, Harriet works hard, bearing in mind the societal odds stacked against enterprising women like her. She mostly sells layer chickens and eggs. This business generates 350,000 UGX monthly for her. With this loan, Harriet is going to buy more layer chickens to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more layer chickens to resell

loans.name: Concepcion Del Socorro

texts.es:
Concepción soltera, mujer emprendedora estudio como carrera técnica la costura así se ha ido superando al pasar de los años tiene su propio negocio es un taller de costura y vende ropa y accesorios, tiene como planes mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Encuentra dificultades en el campo laboral cuando se enferma ya que baja el trabajo e igual los ingreso.  
Alcanzado clientes de diferentes puntos de la capital por su excelente trabajo. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materias primas como: tela, hilos, botones, chinelas, copas, zipper entre otros materiales. Aumentado sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepcion, an enterprising single woman who studied the technical career of dressmaking, has been forging ahead over the years. She has her own business, a dressmaking shop where she sells clothes and accessories. Among her plans are improvement of the infrastructure of her home. Concepcion has encountered work difficulties when she fell ill and her work diminished as did her income. 

Concepcion has reached customers in different parts of the capital by means of her excellent work. The loan she requests will be invested in buying primary materials, such as cloth, thread, buttons, slippers, cups, among other materials. Augmenting her income will better her standard of living.

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR MAKING SCHOOL UNIFORMS

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: La señora Mirtha C. de 36 años de edad, es una de las integrantes del grupo comunal Santa Ana, una alcancía formada hace ya 4 años, que tiene como integrantes personas que día a día se esmeran y luchan por  mejorar la economía en sus hogares. Una muestra de ello es la señora Mirtha C. madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 a un son menores de edad, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado cerca a su casa, y comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba de mayores ingresos, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido construir su casa y darles educación a sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría terminar de construir su casa y ampliar mas su puesto de venta de verduras. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de verduras para la venta de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha C., age 36, is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank.  The bank was formed four years ago.  Its members are people who strive day to day to increase their household income.

Mirtha C. is an example of this.  She has four children; three of them are minors.  She sells vegetables every day in a small market that is close to her house.  She started in this business because income in her house was too low, and she needed greater earnings.

Through her work efforts she was able to build her house and give her children an education.  In the future she would like to finish building her house and expand her vegetable stand.  She will use the recent loan to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Nandintsetseg, 29, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her father's backyard. Her husband works as a driver for a mining company and her older daughter attends a local primary school. 

Nandintsetseg used to work as a tailor in a clothing factory between 2000 and 2003 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. In 2004 she moved from Ulaanbaatar to her current home. In 2007 she began manufacturing felt handicrafts. She bought a couple of sewing machines for her business in 2009 with the money she made from her business. Afterward she began making deels, traditional Mongolian long coats, as well as modern clothing by custom order at home. 

She is planning to rent a location to open her workshop and she hopes to hire a couple of tailors to work with her. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a couple of sewing machines for the workshop that she is going to open soon. She is a hardworking and active person who says, "I wish to operate my own tailoring business where I can produce many kinds of clothes with my own employees in the future."

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines to grow her business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim G. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Kim is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Kim owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing like t-shirts, blouse, and shoe products in the local community. Kim has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kim joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kim has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Kim is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional t-shirts and blouses to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Kim from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirts and blouses to sell in her store

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Madame Léonie a 40 ans et est mariée. Elle a à charge 4 enfants. Pour participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle vend à la devanture de sa maison les charbons de bois à Baguida. Elle achète les marchandises à Anié et cumule 9 ans d’activité. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir 40 sacs de charbons de bois et ainsi  satisfaire plusieurs clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léonie is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four dependent children. 

In order to improve her children’s living conditions, she sells charcoal in front of her house in Baguida. She buys her stock in Anié. She has nine years of experience in this activity. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase 40 bags of charcoal and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Cheryl Marie

texts.en:
Cheryl Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Videoke Bar business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to stock drinks and other supplies for her Videoke Bar/videoke rental business. She dreams of expanding the business for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a supply of beverages for her videoke business

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 38 years old and lives with his relatives in a house in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He manages a public transportation service business between Gobi-Altai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Purevsuren started his business in 2006. At first he used to drive another person's minibus. By saving his salary he managed to buy his own minibus and began working independently in 2008. He travels four or six times in a month between Gobi-Altai and Ulaanbaatar. He transports 12-14 people for one ride. His business gets profitable during national or school holidays. He is a very safe and reliable driver who became well-known amongst his customers. 

He is a diligent man who says, "All I want is a bright future for me and for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts for his minibus.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Leonor Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Consuelo; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de brindar servicio turístico, ella tiene una combi que hace servicio hacia la ciudad de Machupicchu y también la socia tiene una agencia de turismo y también se dedica a trabajos independientes como vender productos de belleza, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de servicio turístico. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar productos de belleza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Consuelo is a member of the communal bank "Mateo Pumacahua".  The bank is located in the district of Chinchero in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.  

She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities between offering tourist services and independently selling beauty products.  She has a combi (micro van) and provides transportation service to Machupicchu as well as running a tourism agency.  Through these businesses she is able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her business of providing tourist services.  She is requesting a loan to maintain her car and to purchase beauty products.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar productos de belleza.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene, 48, lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city . His wife is a cook in a cafe, while he manages a taxi service in his town, having started the business after working as a driver in a private company for several years. Within a short time period Bat-Erdene managed to stabilize his enterprise and bought a plot of land in order to start a vegetable growing and sales business in the near future. He also started construction work on his house.

A polite man who says, "I am planning to finish construction work on my house and start my vegetable business in the future," Bat-Erdene is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to purchase some construction material.

loans.name: Tatiana Anabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tatiana, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años. El marido es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido ir aumentando más su negocio.

Es una joven ama de casa que divide su tiempo entre su hogar y su trabajo, ya que también se dedica a la venta de artículos tanto para el hogar como de uso personal, estos los hace a través del sistema de cartillas, el mismo que consiste en buscar cierta cantidad de clientes para luego cada semana realizar las entregas de los productos que pidieron y también realizar los cobros respectivos. También en su casa realiza trabajos de cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas entre otros trabajos de belleza, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más artículos para el hogar como: planchas, ventiladores, colchones, licuadoras entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa del suegro.

En la foto nuestra socia está con su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
In the Rio Chico parish of the Portoviejo Canton, there is a place called San Clemente where the members of the communal bank "SAN CLEMENTE DE RIO CHICO" meet every two weeks.  This area is known for its lush vegetation and the fact that most people are involved in agriculture.

Here we meet Mrs. Tatiana, 20, who has a common-law husband and a three-year-old son.  Her husband is a merchant.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and has been able to expand her business with the loans she has received through the bank.

She is a young homemaker who divides her time between taking care of the home and working.  She sells household and personal care articles.  She does this by taking orders from enough customers each week to later go out and deliver the orders and collect payment.  At home she also cuts hair, and paints finger-nails among other beauty services she provides.  For two years she has been doing this and things have gone well for her.

The loan will be used to buy household items such as irons, fans, mattresses and blenders, among others.

Her dream is to have her own house someday since she now lives with her father-in-law.

This member is shown in the photograph with her young son.

loans.use: To buy irons, fans, mattresses, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda, a market entrepreneur from Melitopol, lives with her brother and sister in their own private house. Nadezhda has been selling household and dishware items in the central market of her home town for 15 years. Setting a reasonable pricing policy which attracts potential customers who come looking for quality dishware items, she has 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital, while her income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month.

Her determination and business-orientation helping her to set goals and seek further development of her enterprise, Nadezhda is now requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional dishware merchandise. One of her plans for the extra profits arising from the loan is to remodel her house, a long-needed project for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dishware for retail sale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
For the past 5 years, Adwoa has been selling slippers, sandals and materials.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a mason. 

She has been through senior high school.  Adwoa, as part of her marital duties, assists her husband to pay utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more of the goods mention above to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more slippers, sandals and materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Ollantaytambo, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, los hijos de la socia son todos independientes, La socia se dedica a la atención de sus restaurante la socia tiene un restaurante en el poblado de Ollantaytambo, este pueblo es muy bonito y lleno de cultura, a este poblado llegan todos los días muchos turistas, los cuales hacen una parada para apreciar todo el paisaje natural y el complejo de Ollantaytambo, este pueblo es considerado por muchos un pueblo museo porque en las mismas casas inkas viven los lugareños y conservan mucho de la tradición inka. La socia muy orgullosa de su origen ha puesto hace 4 años atrás un restaurante el cual lo administra personalmente y atiende a todos sus comensales, la socia se encarga de casi todo con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad los cuales ella usa a diario como son arroz, aceite, papas, carne y los comprara al por mayor en sacos y le será más rentable de este modo ella economizara.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to La Amistad de Ollantaytambo Community Bank located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. She is 49 years old, married, and has three children, all of them independent. 

She runs a restaurant in the town of Ollantaytambo. It’s a lovely town, full of culture, and many tourists visit there daily. They come to enjoy the beautiful scenery and the nearby ruins. The town is considered by many to be a museum because local people live in the very same houses once inhabited by Incas, and they keep many of the same traditions. This woman is very proud of her origins.

She opened her restaurant four years ago and administers it herself as well as personally looking after her customers. She takes charge of almost everything with help from her children and husband.

She would now like to borrow money to buy supplies in daily use such as rice, oil, potatoes, and meat in quantity and at wholesale prices. The savings will make her restaurant more profitable. She is very satisfied and grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes, and meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat has been working in farming for many years ago. She has a good skill for plant different kind of crops on her existing. In average, she could get an income $2.5 a day. Her husband always helps assist her in the farm field as well. Aside this, Mrs. Sat’s husband also used his old motorbike to run a motor service in the busy market for additional profits. The couple blessed with four children and two of them works as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh City of Cambodian. For the rest, they still study in local school yet. Rainy season is coming now, and it is the best sign for planting all kinds of crop. Therefore, Mrs. Sat has requested some fund from Kiva to buy bean seeds for planting. She really hopes that she could get a good result from her planting. Mrs. Sat was taken a photo with her husband. With her future plan, she wishes to purchase a plowing machine, to decorate her old house, and to support her children to finish the high level of education.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 49 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Priscilla has a business selling goods like rice and corn. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Priscilla has requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

Priscilla has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Priscilla would like to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food vending business

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas y otras cosas más.  El crédito que requiere Nemecia es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.  

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nemecia was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 42 years old. She currently lives in the same city where she was born and it is where she also carries out her economic activities. She has a small grocery store in her house and she sells basic consumer goods, such as rice, sugar, pasta, preserves, and other products. The loan that Nemecia requires is to purchase merchandise such as flour, sugar, pasta, and other goods.

The communal bank "Virgen de Chapi" meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial region. It is also known for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi, and it is also the location of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods such as flour, sugar, pasta, and other products.

loans.name: Iris Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS APOSENTOS
ESTA INTEGRADO POR LA SEÑORA GUADALUPE  LA SOCIA YA TRABAJO UN CREDITO CON FAPE ES EL SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITA,  ES LA PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO ELLAS SE DEDICA A DIFERENTE ACTIVIDAD COMO  A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA SU NEGOCIO LO REALIZA DE AMBULANTE,ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ROPA TIPICA LA SIGUIENTE SOSIA SE  DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO EN SU COLONIA, ELLAS NECESITAN SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO PARA PODER SURTIR SUS PRODUCTOS Y LOGRAR MEJORES VENTAS Y MEJORES GANANCIAS, PARA PODER OBTENER UNA VIDA Y DARLE LO NECESARIO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a partner in the Duo los Aposentos.  She already has one loan and this loan from FAPE is the second loan she is asking for.  She is president of the group whose members work in different sectors such as the sale of traditional clothing.  

She operates as a street vendor and is asking for this loan to buy traditional clothing.  The other partner sells everyday products in her neighborhood.  

They need the loan in order to buy more stock to be able to then supply more products and achieve better sales and profits, thereby make a living and providing for their children.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kouen

texts.en:
Kouen, 29 years old, has three children, all of whom are studying. She works in a garment factory, earning $2.50 a day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 a day. Every month this couple has to spend $55 on food, $7 on rent, $9 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses.

Kouen is requesting a loan of $800 to buy pigs to fatten and sell. This loan will help her family to establish a new source of income which will help support them. If this venture succeeds, she will buy more pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Abdalah, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  He also takes care of his mother.  He has been running a general store business for one year now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to stock the missing items from the general store.  He also bought a piece of land.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants this loan to increase the store's inventory.  His dream is to one day be able to make his general store into a supermarket.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Reli.  Reli has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a divorced woman with one school-going child. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Amina has operated a cafe for the past four years; her potential clients are lorry drivers and her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cafe operators. She dreams of establishing a hotel.

Amina plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase foodstuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil and to renovate her cafe. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities and affordable repayment rates.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and to renovate her cafe.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  

Karar has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers as well as a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,100 loan to renovate his shop and purchase a barber chair. He is hoping to earn more profits to afford him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase a barber chair.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with one young child. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. 

For the past six years, she has been a farmer, keeping cattle for milk sales and bulls for tilling the land. She sells milk at the market and to her neighbors and passersby. Chinyavu's work is very challenging during the dry hot season and the amount of milk produced then is lower. She dreams of establishing a borehole to store water for her cattle during dry season.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, to purchase a bull for plowing the land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bull to plow the land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36, married and has four school-aged children. They live happily in a village and have a plan to uplift their status of living and to continue sending their children to school to give them a better future. Farming is one of their major sources of income- they plant corn and vegetables for sale. They have been in this business for more than eight years and usually earn a profit of PHP 28,000 in every harvest season. Their income is usually spent on their food, clothing, and children's allowances.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to earn more income to satisfy their family's needs. Elizabeth is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and for the labor cost required for a corn plantation. They believe that this loan will be a great help for them to expand their corn plantation and to increase their yields.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and labor required for her corn plantation

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Honolata, who is in her early 20s, is single with two children who go to school. She has been a tailor for two years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy materials for making dresses and bedsheets and for household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy materials for the tailoring business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tamba," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Teresa sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, fideos, gaseosa entre otros. Teresa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios.  

En esta oportunidad Teresa requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. 

Teresa está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa continues to participate in the “Comuzone III” communal bank of the Arariwa association in Cusco.

She continues to sell primary needs products, such as rice, sugar, and milk.  She also sells other types of products, like snacks, noodles, and soft drinks among others.  Teresa benefited from her previous loan and things went well for her.

Now she needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.  In this way she’ll be able to have a greater variety to offer to her customers.

Teresa is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Cantaloma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CANTALOMA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Placida es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, producción de leche, agricultura, compra y venta de ganado.

La señora Placida  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azúcar, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y el crédito ágil.
texts.en:
The "Cantaloma" Community Bank is beginning their first cycle with "Pro Mujer" (For Women), in the center of the town of Patacamaya. The group is comprised of ten members and is lead by governing board. Placida is the secretary. The members of this communal association have various businesses, among them a local grocery store, a milk production business, a farm, and buying and selling cattle.
Mrs. Placida said that this is the first time she has worked with "Pro Mujer". She was invited to join this organization by the organizer. For many years she has had a neighborhood store. She learned this business from her sister.
This loan that she is requesting will increase her working capital. She will buy sugar, noodles, etc. She buy these in El Alto and sells them in her community. This work allows her to generate income so that she can support her family. She is single and has one child.
When she was asked, she said that she likes "Pro Mujer". She likes the health education they provide and the easy access to credit.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, rice etc.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 48-years-old, married and the father of three children.

He has been operating a food kiosk for the past four years and he is doing great. This marks his second loan since he was introduced to KADET and will be used to expand his business. He will use the loan to open another food kiosk.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and he hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to open another food kiosk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children between 11 and 24 years old. Two of her children are in school and live at home. Alice has been involved in business for the past 10 years. She started this business with hairdressing and currently she sells palm oil. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future, she wants to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 32 years old. She is not married and is a mother of two children. She is a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills to secondary students. Joyce deals with bicycle renting in her village. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by employing one person to run her business when she goes to deliver sessions of life skills at school. The profit will be used to pay for household expenses and increase bicycles in her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by employing one person to run her business when she goes to deliver sessions of life skills at school

loans.name: Delmis Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is Delmis Esperanza (hope). I have a small business in the house where I live and we call it Pulperia O.. We sell all types of food and have been doing this for a long time. I'd like to increase the number of products that we offer so that my customers have greater variety to choose from.

SPANISH
Mi nombre el Delmis Esperanza, cuento un un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia O., con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, actuamente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de azucar, arroz, manteca,Pastas,salsa de tomate, confites, pan, carnes,embutidos y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand meat business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema Mwaka K. is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.  Apart from her children, she also takes care of her aged mother and three of her sister’s children, since her sister is ailing. Rehema lives in Mlolongo town near the Mombasa-Nairobi highway. 
Rehema’s story is that of a woman with pure determination to succeed. After getting married she did not like idling around waiting for her husband to put food on her table. Therefore Rehema started off by saving Ksh 20 (about US$0.3) from every coin that her husband gave her to buy food for the day. She did it for 2 years until she managed to save Ksh 10,000 (US$150). With this money, Rehema rented a stall at Mlolongo for Ksh 1,000 a month. She then began to travel to rural areas where cereals are sold cheaply. She bought her first stock of cereals and started her sales business in year 2000. The business has been doing well, and now Rehema wants to expand it. She sees that the town is growing at a rapid rate, and therefore her supply may no longer be enough.          
Rehema is asking for a loan of US$350, so that she can purchase a weighing machine and a variety of cereals. These additions will help Rehema earn more income and enable her to better support her dependants as well as the community at large. She intends to repay the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a weighing machine and a variety of cereals

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: This single man is 26 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Alekseyevka.  Elnur is enjoying his business and has a lot of clients. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy cloth to meet all the demands of his clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Mrs. Ann P., age 28, breeds and sells pigs to earn about $8 in revenue per day. Her husband, age 33, buys and resells recyclable products, earning about $11 per day in revenue. They have two children who are too young to attend school. Ann would like to request a loan of US$ 800 to purchase young piglets to raise and fatten for sale as well as a larger stock of recyclable products for her husband’s business so as to take advantage of bulk discounts and increase their profit margin. They plan to use the increased income to educate their children and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and recyclable items

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
I am 33, married, and have four children. All of my children attend a nearby local school. I live with my partner and children in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I have been sewing clothes to order for my neighborhood clients for four years.

My husband runs a grocery store in his locality, where he sells daily use items. He wants to invest in his store and stock items such as sugar, oil and legumes in bulk. Please lend him $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy grocery items in bulk

loans.name: Akoété

texts.fr:
Mr. Akoété K. was born in Hahotoé on November 11, 1970. Married and the father of three children, he lives with his wife who does hair braiding. Lacking financial means, his parents abandoned him, so he came to live with his brother in Lomé where he was set up in an apprenticeship. He completed the apprenticeship, earning a diploma as shoemaker, and opened a little shop with what meager means he disposed of.

He is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 which he can use to purchase leather and other necessities for his trade so that he can better satisfy the demands of his clientele. He will use the leather and tools he purchases to make shoes and handbags from scratch, and this should help him out of his present difficult situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur K. Akoété est né à Hahotoé le 11 novembre 1970. Marié et père de trois (3) enfants il vit avec sa femme qui est une tresseuse ambulante. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyen, ses parents l’ont abandonné et il rejoint son frère à Lomé qui le ment en apprentissage. Sorti avec un diplôme de cordonnier, il installa son atelier avec son petit moyen de bord.

A travers ce projet, il demande un financement de $1000 qui vont lui servir à l’achat d’autres fournitures et du cuir qui lui manquent afin d’être complet et de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Ce fonds lui servira également à fabriquer des chaussures et sacs pour la vente. Ceci lui aidera à sortir de sa crise.

loans.use:
Purchase of leather and other necessities for his trade as shoemaker

Achat de fourniture pour la fabrication de chaussures
